story:
Here's Our Story

Back in 2017 I started writing a comic script. As time went on, I started weaving a novel about past betrayals, loyalty, and friendship, with fighting or dialogue on every page. I wanted to write pulp! 2019 rolled around, and I finally published my first novel. I kept getting a nagging thought in the back of my head, though. I'd done several successful crowdfunding campaigns so far in tabletop, why not comics? 

A Wonderful Partnership

​I contacted Startwo, a creative duo based out of Portugal on the recommendation of my buddy Cirsova (who runs a delightful pulp magazine). They were perfect for the job, and we hit it off right away. Despite all of the troubles the pandemic threw at us, we produced 22 pages of gorgeous full color art! Provided our funding here goes well, we'll produce longer and even more fantastical comics in the very near future. 

How You Can Help

All of the art for issue 1 has been completed, and lettering is very soon to follow. What we need from you is a sign EOTF can keep going. Should our first issue receive a satisfactory amount of funding, new issues will be commissioned! This is primarily a labor of love for me, but artists and letterists and printers have bills to pay and families to feed. 

Our Leap of Faith

The biggest source of our nervousness on this project is the shipping of physical products; it always is. I've been running tabletop kickstarters for around 2 years now, and I still get nervous about fulfilling physical rewards! We're keeping track of printers and ensuring they aren't going to get nuked by covid issues, and if they are, keeping an eye out for alternative printers and fulfilment options.

story:
Story

Luna has never known her mother. One morning at breakfast she gets a call that her mom has died. Not only that, she finds out that she's part of a line of vampire hunters called Vetita. Being a Vetita means she has all of the vampires strengths and none of their weaknesses as long as she doesnt give into the lust.

What are you Backing?

  • Mature Readers
  • 48 page graphic novel
  • Full color 

Stretch Goals

$8,000 FREE print

$8,500 5 FREE PDFs 

$10,000 FREE Trading Card 

$11,000 FREE Wallpaper

Preview

Creators

Marcel Dupree - Writer

Owns and operates Evoluzione Publishing, which produces comicslike  Le Fay and Babylon Working.  He also edited Punch Drunk from Arcana Comics.

Joshua Metzger - Writer

Writes Le Fay, Babylon Working, and Dirty Work At The Crossroads.  

Gaurav Shrivastava - Artist

I'm a Comic book artist from a small town Morena, India. I have been reading comics and drawing stuff since I was a 4. My career began with holycow entertainment where i did numerous titles.  I am known for my dynamic muscular superhero art also for beautiful women drawing. I have won the best penciller award for my best selling title the last asuran. I am now working with Evoluzione Publishing and other indie publishers. 

Chuck Michael Obach-Colorist 

An animator who fell in love with coloring comic books. He has worked on more than 50 books in his decade long of coloring career.

story:
Welcome to a comic book as wild and weird as Texas itself:

  •   
    Howdy folks, I’m Drew Edwards and ya'll know me as the writer/creator of the long running indie comic hit, Halloween Man. While, I've been in the funny book biz for quite some time, this project is one that is particularly special to me.  Because this time I'm bringing together a creative team that is completely comprised of talent from right here in Austin, Texas.   People I'm proud to work with and proud to call friends. 
  • I think you'll find this comic very different from even the other Halloween Man comics I've published in the past.  The stories contained within range from the personal to the comedic to the lurid.  They're stories that speak to me both as a writer and as someone who loves to collaborate with artists.   Because they were all tailored directly to the artist's requests of things they'd like to draw.   This approach means these stories will a different place within Halloween Man canon and have a unique feel.
  •   
    Texas has also always had a special place in Halloween Man lore, because I'm a child of the lone star state.  As a kid, I always wanted there to be superhero adventures that look place in Texas. The creation of Halloween Man's hometown of Solar City, TX grew out of wild summertime story sharing telling sessions I used to share with my twin brother on our boat dock on Possum Kingdom Lake.  It's only natural that as an adult, that Texas pride would drive me to create this comic, a comic completely rooted in Austin and its artistic talent. So, I could showcase the many wonderful people who live and work in this city. 

THE LOWDOWN:

  • Your donations are going to go to help pay our creative team's page rate.  Also, you will help cover printing and advertising costs.  They say everything is bigger in Texas, well we want to launch this book big, both in print and digitally on Comixology.  Help us prove a little indie comic from Texas can get in there and compete with the Big Two up in New York City!  
  • Loyalty such as yours will not go unrewarded! Amazing prizes await our donors!  Get your hands on original production artwork, sketch covers, and even a COMPLETE Halloween Man library!  All this and more can be YOURS! Keep in mind, we need you to make this happen, every single one of you counts. 
  • Also, if there is one thing Austin loves, it's a party! And if we reach our goal, we're going to through the best Halloween bash possible! It'll be your chance to meet us in person and get some comic books signed!

Why This Matters:

Indie Comics always have a tough road to release, please help us hit our goal:

  • While Halloween Man has been around a long time, it's always been a tough road for what is a labor of love for myself and everyone else who has been involved over the years.  As a small press comic, it's always easy to get lost in the sea of mainstream comics.  Your funds will not only help us have the biggest impact possible.  But it will also help our creative team help get a leg up in a tough industry.
  •  
    I've always seen Halloween Man as a place for talent to build their resume and take the risks that help them grow and mature as artists.  This your chance to help talent local to Austin to hit the national stage in as big a way as possible. 
  •  The Bat City Special is funded by fans, for fans!  We love our fans and want to make this THE best comic possible FOR you!    Every fan counts and we're grateful for all of ya'll.

NO RISK,NO GLORY: 

 

 

Make no mistake, off-beat comics have to fight,fight,FIGHT for their place in the increasingly competitive comic book market of the 21st Century!  We know, as fans you have lots of other places your hard-earned dollars could go.  But if you like seeing comics that are quirky and have a little bit of an off-kilter world view, please help us achieve four color GLORY!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help: 

 

Remember, even if you can help fund the book, there are other ways you can help.  Do you know someone who is into indie comics?  Please send them a link here.  Do you run a comic book or genre related website?  Please run a feature on the Halloween Man: Bat City Special! Like I said, every fan counts and there are lots of ways for you to help!

MEET THE BAT CITY TEAM: 

 

DREW EDWARDS(Creator/Head-Writer): 

Comic book writer, horror film historian, music journalist , rock promoter, and showman extraordinaire; these are all guises of the creative force known as Drew Edwards. Edwards is best known as the writer and creator of the long-running underground comic, Halloween Man. He is also a contributing writer for Rockabilly Online and through Halloween Man Productions, an active part of the Austin music scene. Each week his voice is been heard by thousands as part of the Castle of Horror Podcast. Bridging horror and comic culture with Austin's music scene, Drew's the event planner, promoter, and host of numerous events Edwards currently lives in Austin, Texas with his wife, musician Jamie Bahr. 

DAN PRICE(Artist/Editor/Co-writer): 

Dan Price is a comic book artist (and sometimes writer), creative director and painter based in Austin, TX.  In comics, Dan has worked on titles such as Latex Avenger, Masters of the Obvious, Guano Guy, Halloween Man, Excelsi-ish for the Stan Lee Foundation and is a contributor for The Comic Jam. Follow him on Instagram at @danomyte139.

PAULO HERNANDEZ(Artist):

The youngest of five Paulo found himself growing up with welfare holidays and hand me downs and from his older brothers, and on the rare occasion his sister. Finding himself with a lack of other entertainment he soon took to creating his own characters by drawing them. Paulo currently lives in Austin, TX and is still pursuing his dream of inspiring the world to laugh, cry and appreciate life with his artistic talents.

John Gholson(Artist): 

John Gholson is a writer, actor, and illustrator who's called Austin home for the past twenty years. You may have seen his work at AOL, Fandango, GQ, Vice, Pulp & Popcorn, Adult Swim, or one of the mobile apps from his day job, but probably not. He currently performs comedy when he can and raises two cats - Peter Cushing and Captain Benjamin Sisko. 

 

SHANE CAMPOS(Artist): 

Shane lives in Austin TX and loves Cartoons, Comics, Weird Movies and terrible, terrible Metal Music.

Joey Muerto(Artist/Videographer): 

Joey Muerto is an artist, musician and filmmaker from Austin, Texas. He plays in the horror-surf band, Bat City Surfers, and he co-owns and operates the record label, Bat-Tone Records.

Lou Pons(Cover Artist): 

Lou Pons was born and grew up in Newcastle Upon-Tyne, England. She was always known as the kid who could draw. "I didn’t get seriously into art until I relocated to Austin Texas in 2005. I started following more artists and began creating my own style.  Austin has a great art scene so what better place to give it a try. I got involved in comic conventions and some local art events. I began creating pin up and fantasy art and began using water color as my go to medium. " She enjoys collaborating on art projects with friends but always have something to work regardless since hrer mind is always full of images she needs to draw or paint." I’m currently getting back into the art scene since I had to take a break for eye surgeries due to glaucoma. I’m grateful to be able to continue creating art, especially for Halloween Man, even though I have sustained some sight loss, and am thankful of the support I constantly receive from the wonderful people I’ve met on my journey." 

Jeremy "The Artist" Martinez(Artist): 

JTA's diverse work has been featured in a variety of media, including the children's book, "One Day Luisito", the teen movie comedy "Ned Venture", the board game, "Super PACS! The Game of Politics About the Game of Politics", and the music video/printed comic book, “You Ain’t”. Most recently, JTA succeeded in a Kickstarter campaign for his first fully colored art book, "Aw, Hell! A Demon Art Book”. JTA loves monsters, pin ups and most foods (the variety of food options being one of the many reasons he loves Austin). JTA is a nerdy artist type, but likes to believe he also has some class. To that extent, he owns a pair of socks with a gentleman cat print and wears them. A lot."

story:
DEATHSWORN is an action packed 80's inspired world expansive adventure. The first half of an epic space opera, Combining the creativity of franchises like Masters of the Universe with the grit and humor of John Carpenter.

 

But only YOU can bring this adventure to life! Your support not only helps produce this book but will also help me start work on future books.

 

DEATHSWORN : First Hunt is a 46 page black and white manga sized comic that follows Deathsworn on a solo mission to sabotage a Darkstar space station. Deathsworn comes face to face with a Darkstar elite on this espionage mission, The Twisted and sadistic emissary Razor!

 

 

 

 

Each one of the extremely limited 4 inch Deathsworn and Tatiana Darkstar figures are hand painted to ensure that each figure is a unique piece of Art.

Each figure comes in a handmade box with plastic window to keep your figure in mint condition. Each box is decorated with Deathsworn art and signed.
 

 

 

 

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT!

 

 

*Artwork not final*

story:
What happens when you are no longer the most dangerous force in the shadows of your city?  When the wicked fear something else,  something much more dangerous? A larger, more powerful creature of legend now prowls those very shadows you call an ally.  Now this creature is turning you from the hunter into the hunted.  What do you do?  If you're Matt Rocklin,  also known as The Convictor,  you do your damnedest to survive the night with every ounce of fight and skill that you can muster.  You wont quit until the fight is won  ....or you're dead.  

 

 

WILL I LIKE THIS BOOK?

Well, lets go through our checklist shall we?

Do you like comics like The Punisher , Daredevil, Spawn, and TMNT?

Do you like Vigilantes and Anti-Heroes?

Do you like dark heroes with an even darker sense of justice?

Do you like classic movie monsters like Werewolves and Vampires?

Do you like genre bending Mash Ups?

Do you like in your face one on one fisticuffs action?

If you answered yes to one, or more of these questions, then The Convictor: Hunters Moon is for you! It pits our dark hero, The Convictor against a supernatural beast of legend, The Wolf-Man in a one on one battle under an unnatural Full Moon!

 

 

THE COVERS:

"Teeth" Original Main Cover by Dennis Valencia 

 

" Wolf-Man Victory"  Cover by Jason Pharo / Colored by Cristiano Cruz 

 

"Thrawler Attack" Cover by Dennis Valencia / Colored by Cristiano Cruz 

 

"Free Fall"  Cover by Mo Lubsian / Colored by Cristiano Cruz 

​

 

What You Get

A choice of covers:

  • Original main Dennis Valencia Hunters Moon "Teeth" cover option
  • IGG Exclusive Jason Pharo " Wolf-Man Victory" cover option 
  • IGG Exclusive Dennis Valencia "Thrawler Attack" cover option
  • IGG Exclusive Mo Lubisan "Free Fall" virgin cover option 

 

A CHOICE OF TWO (2) COVERS BUNDLE OPTIONS​

  • ​You can pick a bundle of TWO (2) covers: either the Monsters Attack or the Indomitable Will bundles 

 

​AN INDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE COVERS BUNDLE

  • You get all THREE (3) of the IGG exclusive covers from Dennis Valencia, Mo Lubisan, and Jason Pharo, all colored by Cristiano Cruz 

 

A SIGNED COLLECTORS BUNDLE OF ALL FOUR (4) COVERS 

  • You will get all FOUR cover options, which will be signed by ​The Convictor creator Jason Pharo 

 

​STRETCH GOAL OFFERINGS: 

At our $1000 mark we will offer this grayscale mini poster of "Thrawler Attack" by Dennis Valencia free to all PHYSICAL BACKERS 

 

At our $1300 Mark we will offer this mini poster of "Manga Convictor" by artist Marie Lycorice (Akuma Circus Monster)  free to all PHYSICAL BACKERS 

 

More stretch goals will be announced at the $1500 , $1800, $2000, and $2500 marks respectively.

 

INTERIOR PAGE SAMPLES:

 

PANEL ART SAMPLES:

 

 

OUR TEAM:

Jason Pharo : Writer, Artist, and World Builder of The Convictor series

 

Dennis Valencia: Pharos Creative Studios Cover and Sequential Artist 

 

Cristiano Cruz: Pharos Creative Studios Colorist

 

Chris Michael: Pharos Creative Studios Letters and Layout 

 

Mo Lubisan: Pharos Creative Guest Cover Artist 

 

Risks & Challenges

We do not for see any true risks with this campaign . Our book is 100% completed and this funds raised here will go to paying our team members and for printing and distribution of our title. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our page to social media, tell your friends, coworkers, and even your neighbor that you really don't like about our campaign! We would appreciate it!

Dennis Valencia: Pharos Creative Studios Cover and Sequential Artist 
 
Cristiano Cruz: Pharos Creative Studios Colorist
 
Chris Michael: Pharos Creative Studios Letters and Layout 
 
Mo Lubisan: Pharos Creative Guest Cover Artist 

 
Risks & Challenges
We do not for see any true risks with this campaign . Our book is 100% completed and this funds raised here will go to paying our team members and for printing and distribution of our title. 

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Please share our page to social media, tell your friends, coworkers, and even your neighbor that you really don't like about our campaign! We would appreciate it!

story:
Es ist geschafft!!!
Tausend Dank für all Eure wunderbare Unterstützung!
Das Buch wird

in vollem Umfang umgesetzt.
Dadurch, dass die Kampagne nicht das volle Funding Goal erreicht hat, kann die Arbeit etwas länger dauern, als erwartet.
Sobald es Neuigkeiten gibt,
schicke ich Updates über die Kampagnenseite.
Ich freue mich wie 'n Luchs
auf die Arbeit an dem Buch!
Bis bald! :)
Filip

----------------------------------------------

It's done!!!
Thanks a million for all your wonderful support!
The book will be
completed in full.
Due to the campaign not reaching the full funding goal, the work may take a little longer than expected.
As soon as there's news, I'll send updates via the campaign page.
I'm looking forward like a lynx to working on the book!
See you soon! :)
Filip


---------------------------------------------------------
ENGLISH TRANSLATION FURTHER DOWN
---------------------------------------------------------

Hallo! Mein Name ist Filip und ich bin studierter Illustrator und Animator. Ich bin 31 Jahre alt und arbeite als Freiberufler in Deutschland.

Ich habe von 2011 bis 2020 Illustration und Animation an der Kunsthochschule Kassel studiert. Als Beispiel ist hier mein Abschlussprojekt STROMLAND. Ein detailliertes Animatic zu einem 24-minütigen animierten Kurzfilm, den ich über das Erwachsenwerden eines Jungen erstellt habe. Der Film enthält biografische Elemente aus meiner Familiengeschichte.

www.tinyurl.com/stromland-animatic-final

 

Bei dieser Kampagne geht es um mein neuestes Projekt "Weird World Hero Book" (Arbeitstitel). Es wird ein kleines digitales Artbook mit Illustrationen von seltsamen Charakteren aus einer meiner seltsamen Fantasiewelten sein. Es wird etwa 50 von mir erfundene und illustrierte Charaktere enthalten. Zusätzlich wird jeder Charakter einen kurzen Flavor-Text auf Englisch über sein Leben, seine Fähigkeiten oder andere interessante Details bekommen.

Das Buch wird eher an ein erwachsenes Publikum gerichtet sein, da es Zeichnungen enthalten wird, die Gewalt und teils nicht-explizite Nacktheit darstellen. Ich möchte Männer, Frauen und andere Kreaturen auf Abenteuer, in oder nach Kämpfen und in gewagten und körperbetonten Posen zeigen. Ich werde keine Zeichnungen erstellen, die nur Nacktheit oder Brutalität um der Nacktheit oder Brutalität willen zeigen, weil ich das zu langweilig finde.

Dies Artbook wäre mein erstes selbstgemachtes Buch mit eigenen Illustrationen. Ich denke, die Welt könnte daran interessiert sein, wie schräg und faszinierend einige meiner Helden tatsächlich sein können.

Danach würde ich das Buch gerne drucken lassen und verkaufen. Das hängt allerdings stark davon ab, wie viele Leute sich für das Buch interessieren und wie viel vom Finanzierungsziel erreicht wird. Das wird ein Teil des nächsten Produktionsschritts sein und ist noch nicht Teil dieser Kampagne.
Da Indiegogo hauptsächlich eine amerikanische Website ist und der Versand einzelner Exemplare an einzelne Adressen in den USA von Deutschland aus sehr kostspielig ist, kann es mir noch nicht leisten dieses Artbook zu drucken und international zu versenden. Für deutsche Unterstützer rechne ich damit, dass es möglich sein wird, das Buch nach der Kampagne für einen kleinen Aufpreis in gedruckter Form zu bekommen. Aber das hängt ganz davon ab, wie viele Leute ein gedrucktes Exemplar haben wollen. Da das digitale Artbook in Schwarz, Weiß und wahrscheinlich Grautönen sein wird, wird es auch auf E-Readern gut lesbar sein :)

DEUTSCHE BACKER DES SAGE-PERKS ERHALTEN DAS WEIRD WORLD HERO BOOK VORAUSSICHTLICH OHNE AUFPREIS IN GEDRUCKTER FORM!!!

 

Im Moment habe ich so wenig Geld, dass ich jeden Monat befürchte, meine Miete nicht bezahlen zu können. Außerdem habe ich einen hohen Schuldenberg durch mein Studium. Aber ich möchte nicht nur um Geld bitten. Ich möchte den Menschen, die mir helfen wollen, etwas von meinem Zeichentalent zurückgeben. Das ist der Punkt, an dem Ihr die Bühne betretet. Euer finanzieller Beitrag wird mir helfen, meine Miete zu bezahlen, aber auch einen Bildband mit schönen Zeichnungen zu produzieren, in den Ihr dann eintauchen können.

 

Die Erstellung dieses kleinen Buches wird einige Zeit in Anspruch nehmen.
- Ich plane 50 Charaktere in schwarz-weiß und Grautönen zu entwickeln und zu illustrieren.
- Auch plane ich für jeden Charakter einen kleinen Flavor-Text zu schreiben, der seine Person, sein Leben, seine Besitztümer, seine Fähigkeiten oder andere interessante Dinge beschreibt.
- Schließlich werde ich das kleine Buch layouten müssen, um es für den Druck vorzubereiten.

Für jede Zeichnung werde ich etwa 8 Stunden Arbeit benötigen, bis sie fertig und einzigartig ist. Das macht 50 x 8 Stunden = 400 Stunden Zeichnen.
Für jeden Flavor-Text werde ich bis zu 1 Stunde brauchen, um ein interessantes, vielleicht ein wenig humorvolles und korrekturgelesenes Stück zu bekommen. Das macht 50 Stunden für das Schreiben.
Schließlich wird es noch einmal 10 Stunden Arbeit erfordern, alles zu layouten, um es druckfähig zu machen.

Insgesamt sind das 460 Stunden Arbeit. Ich möchte mein Finanzierungsziel auf 4.600€ (~5.400$) setzen, was mir 10€ pro Arbeitsstunde einbringen würde.

 

Die Perks, die ich erstellt habe, reichen von winzigen Beteiligungen bis hin zu großen Schritten, die Ihnen die Chance geben, an meinem kleinen Artbook mitzugestalten. Wenn Ihr zum Beispiel den höchsten Perk gewählt habt, werde ich ein kleines Gespräch mit Euch darüber führen, wie Ihr Euch als schräger Held in meinem Buch sehen würdet oder welchen Held Ihr schon immer mal illustriert sehen wolltet. Ich werde dann das, was Ihr mir gesagt habt, in eine einzigartige Zeichnung eines Charakters für das Buch interpretieren.

Kleinere Perks enthalten das Buch als PDF oder einzelne digitale, von mir signierte Versionen eines der Charaktere.

Natürlich wird jeder Backer im Buch namentlich erwähnt.

 

Wenn nur ein Teil des Finanzierungsziels erreicht wird, könnte das Buch einfach kleiner werden. Alles ab 25 Zeichnungen aufwärts anstatt der vollen 50 Helden ist möglich. Wenn die Finanzierung nur einen sehr kleinen Teil des gesamten Ziels erreicht, hilft Dein Beitrag einem freischaffenden Künstler in Deutschland, harte Zeiten zu überstehen und auf die Beine zu kommen. (Das wäre dann ich :) )

 

Das Weird World Hero Book kann für jeden wertvoll sein. Ich selbst liebe Fantasy und Science-Fiction vor allem wegen ihrer Kraft, meine Gedanken weg von den Problemen des realen Lebens und hin zu fiktionalen Ereignissen und Welten zu lenken, in denen ich träumen und Stress loslassen kann, während meine Vorstellungskraft positiv angeregt wird.

Ich möchte, dass die Zeichnungen und kurzen Texte meines winzigen Buches Euch an die Hand nehmen, Euch zu einem riesigen goldenen Tor mit einem Schlüsselloch von der Größe Eures Kopfes führen und Euch hindurch in eine andere Welt blicken lassen, die vor Abenteuern und seltsamen, faszinierenden Dingen nur so strotzt. Ich möchte, dass mein kleines Buch Euch dazu bringt, es viele Male durchzuschmökern und immer wieder neue Details zu finden. Ich möchte, dass es Euch entspannt und gleichzeitig inspiriert.

Das Weird World Hero Book kann aber auch einen viel praktischeren Nutzen haben. Wenn Du - wie ich und viele andere Leute heute - ein Fan von Tabletop-Rollenspielen bist und vielleicht Deine eigenen Rollenspielkampagnen leitest, kann mein Buch eine Inspiration für Charaktere, Schurken und Helden in Deiner eigenen Fantasy-Welt sein. Wäre es nicht toll, wenn Deine und meine Fantasy-Welt sich gegenseitig beeinflussen könnten? Ich fände es super!

 

Vielleicht arbeite ich in der Zwischenzeit auch an anderen Aufträgen. Das wiederum lässt mir nicht immer Zeit, für das Weird World Hero Book zu zeichnen. Ich zeichne allerdings schon, seit ich 8 Jahre alt bin. Und ich liebe es, mich zurückzulehnen, mit einer Tasse Tee zu entspannen und abends oder nachts zu zeichnen, wenn die Welt ruhiger und die Ablenkungen immer weniger werden.

Insgesamt sollte es etwa 2 Monate dauern, bis das ganze Buch fertig ist. Bei Problemen, die ich noch nicht sehen und nicht berechnen kann, werde ich dem Buch 3 Monate geben, um sicher fertig zu werden.

Ich bin sicher, dass ich genug Zeit finden werde, um das Buch bis November 2021 fertigzustellen.

 

Wenn Du keine Kreditkarte oder kein Google Pay oder Apple Pay hast, dann kontaktiere mich doch über mein Profil oben direkt. Wir können auch eine andere Form der finanziellen Unterstützung wie z.B. PayPal festlegen, mit der Du natürlich das erwünschte Perk genauso erhältst.

Wenn Du es dir nicht leisten kannst, mir finanziell zu helfen, zeig meine Kampagne doch Deinen Familienmitgliedern und Freunden, die daran interessiert sein könnten. Menschen geben ständig Geld für Fantasy-Comics, Sci-Fi-Filme, Action-Videospiele und andere tolle digitale Inhalte aus. Vielleicht möchten sie auch die Entstehung eines kleinen Artbooks voller schräger Fantasiegeschichten mitverfolgen?! Wer weiß?!

Was ich definitiv weiß, ist, dass ich es sehr zu schätzen weiß :) Vielen Dank dafür!

Beste Grüße!
Filip


ENGLISH TRANSLATION

-------------
---

Hi! My name is Filip and I am a professional illustrator and animator. I am 31 years old and work as a freelancer in Germany.

I studied illustration and animation at the School of Art Kassel in Germany from 2011 to 2020. As an example here's my graduation Project STROMLAND. A detailed animatic of a 24 minute animated short film I created about the coming of age of a young boy. The film contains biographical elements of my family history.

www.tinyurl.com/stromland-animatic-final

 

This campaign is about my newest project "Weird World Hero Book"(working title). It will be a little digital art book with illustrations of strange characters from a weird fantasy world in my mind. It will contain about 50 characters invented and illustrated by me. In addition, every character will get a short flavor text in English about his life, abilities or other interesting details.

The book will rather be for adults, as it will contain drawings depicting violence and some non-explicit nudity. I want to show adventuring men, women and other creatures in or after fights and in bold and body-confident poses. I won't create drawings just showing nudity or brutality for the sake of nudity or brutality because I find that too boring.

This would be my first ever selfmade book with my own illustrations. I think the world might be interested in how weird and intriguing some of my heroes can actually be.

Afterwards I would love to get the book printed and sell it. That depends hugely on the amount of people interested in the book, though, and how much of the funding goal is reached. That will be part of the next step of production and is not yet part of this campaign.
As Indiegogo is mainly an american website and shipping single copies to individual addresses in the U.S. from Germany is very costly. I'm not able yet to afford printing this art book and shipping it internationally. For German backers I expect it to be possible to get the book after the campaign for a little extra cost in printed form. But that completely depends on the amount of people wanting a printed copy.
As the digital art book will be in black, white and probably graytones, it will be readable perfectly on e-readers. :)

GERMAN BACKERS OF THE SAGE-PERK WILL PROBABLY RECEIVE THE WEIRD WORLD HERO BOOK IN PRINTED FORM AT NO EXTRA CHARGE!!!

 

At the moment I have so little money that I fear not being able to pay my rent every month. Additionally I'm looking at a big amount of debt from my studies. But I don't just want to ask for money. I want to give something coming from my drawing talent back to people who want to help me. That is where you enter the stage. Your financial aid will help me pay for my rent, but will also produce an illustrated book with beautiful drawings that you can delve into.

 

The creation of this little book will take quite some time.
- I plan to develop and illustrate 50 characters in black, white and maybe grey tones.
- I also plan to write a little flavor text for every character, describing his person, life, possessions, abilities or other interesting things.
- Finally I will have to layout that tiny book to make it ready for printing.

For every drawing I will need around 8 hours of work until it's finished and unique. That makes 50 x 8 hours = 400 hours of drawing.
For every flavor text I will need around 1 hour to get an interesting, probably a little humorous and proofread piece. That makes 50 hours of writing.
Finally it will take another 10 hours of work to layout everything to make it printable.

In total that is 460 hours of work. I want to set my funding goal to 4.600€ (~5.400$) which would pay me 10€ per working hour.

 

The perks I created go from a tiny participation of yours to a huge help that can give you the chance to be represented in my little book. For example if you chose the highest perk I will have a little conversation with you regarding how you'd like to see yourself as a weird hero in my book. I will then interpret what you told me into a unique drawing of a character for the book.

Smaller perks contain the book as a pdf or single digital versions of one of the characters signed by me.

Of course every backer will be named in the book.
 

 

If only a part of the funding goal is reached, the book could just become smaller. Anything from 25 drawings upwards instead of the whole 50 is possible. If the funding only reaches a very small part of the whole goal, your contribution will help a poor freelancer artist in Germany survive hard times and get on his feet. (That'd be me :) )

 

The Weird World Hero Book can be valuable to absolutely anybody. I myself love fantasy and science fiction especially for their power to direct my thoughts away from real life problems and towards fictional events and worlds, where I can dream and let go of stress, while being positively stimulated in my imagination.

I want the drawings and short texts of my tiny book to take you by the hand, guide you to a huge golden gate with a keyhole the size of your head and let you look through it into another world that thrives with adventures and weird, fascinating things. I want my tiny book to make you read it many times and always find new details. I want it to relax and inspire you at the same time.

The Weird World Hero Book can also have a much more practical use. If you are - like myself and many other people today - a fan of tabletop roleplaying and maybe leading your own roleplaying campaigns sometimes my book can be an inspiration for characters, villains and heroes in your own fantasy world. Wouldn't it be great if your fantasy world and mine could affect each other? I'd absolutely love it!

 

I might also work on other jobs in the meantime. That again won't always leave me time to draw for the Weird World Hero Book. I draw since I am 8 years old now, though. And I love to sit back, relax with a cup of tea and draw at night, when the world calms down and the distractions become less and less.

In total it should take around 2 months to finish the whole book. Regarding problems I'm not able to see yet and can't calculate I will give the book 3 months to be finished safely.

I'm certain I'll find enough time to finish the book until November 2021.

 

If you don't have a credit card or Google Pay or Apple Pay, then contact me directly via my profile above. We can also set up another form of financial support such as PayPal, which will of course give you the same perk you chose.

If you can't afford to help me financially, show my campaign to your family members and friends who might be interested. People spend hundreds on fantasy comics, sci-fi movies, action videogames and other great digital content all the time. Maybe they'd like to follow the creation of a little book filled with weird fantasy heores, too?! Who knows?

What I definitely know is that I'll greatly appreciate it. :) Thank you!

Best,
Filip

This would be my first ever selfmade book with my own illustrations. I think the world might be interested in how weird and intriguing some of my heroes can actually be.
Afterwards I would love to get the book printed and sell it. That depends hugely on the amount of people interested in the book, though, and how much of the funding goal is reached. That will be part of the next step of production and is not yet part of this campaign.As Indiegogo is mainly an american website and shipping single copies to individual addresses in the U.S. from Germany is very costly. I'm not able yet to afford printing this art book and shipping it internationally. For German backers I expect it to be possible to get the book after the campaign for a little extra cost in printed form. But that completely depends on the amount of people wanting a printed copy.As the digital art book will be in black, white and probably graytones, it will be readable perfectly on e-readers. :)
GERMAN BACKERS OF THE SAGE-PERK WILL PROBABLY RECEIVE THE WEIRD WORLD HERO BOOK IN PRINTED FORM AT NO EXTRA CHARGE!!!
 

At the moment I have so little money that I fear not being able to pay my rent every month. Additionally I'm looking at a big amount of debt from my studies. But I don't just want to ask for money. I want to give something coming from my drawing talent back to people who want to help me. That is where you enter the stage. Your financial aid will help me pay for my rent, but will also produce an illustrated book with beautiful drawings that you can delve into.
 


The creation of this little book will take quite some time.- I plan to develop and illustrate 50 characters in black, white and maybe grey tones.- I also plan to write a little flavor text for every character, describing his person, life, possessions, abilities or other interesting things.- Finally I will have to layout that tiny book to make it ready for printing.For every drawing I will need around 8 hours of work until it's finished and unique. That makes 50 x 8 hours = 400 hours of drawing.For every flavor text I will need around 1 hour to get an interesting, probably a little humorous and proofread piece. That makes 50 hours of writing.Finally it will take another 10 hours of work to layout everything to make it printable.
In total that is 460 hours of work. I want to set my funding goal to 4.600€ (~5.400$) which would pay me 10€ per working hour.
 

The perks I created go from a tiny participation of yours to a huge help that can give you the chance to be represented in my little book. For example if you chose the highest perk I will have a little conversation with you regarding how you'd like to see yourself as a weird hero in my book. I will then interpret what you told me into a unique drawing of a character for the book.
Smaller perks contain the book as a pdf or single digital versions of one of the characters signed by me.
Of course every backer will be named in the book. 

 

If only a part of the funding goal is reached, the book could just become smaller. Anything from 25 drawings upwards instead of the whole 50 is possible. If the funding only reaches a very small part of the whole goal, your contribution will help a poor freelancer artist in Germany survive hard times and get on his feet. (That'd be me :) )
 


The Weird World Hero Book can be valuable to absolutely anybody. I myself love fantasy and science fiction especially for their power to direct my thoughts away from real life problems and towards fictional events and worlds, where I can dream and let go of stress, while being positively stimulated in my imagination.
I want the drawings and short texts of my tiny book to take you by the hand, guide you to a huge golden gate with a keyhole the size of your head and let you look through it into another world that thrives with adventures and weird, fascinating things. I want my tiny book to make you read it many times and always find new details. I want it to relax and inspire you at the same time.
The Weird World Hero Book can also have a much more practical use. If you are - like myself and many other people today - a fan of tabletop roleplaying and maybe leading your own roleplaying campaigns sometimes my book can be an inspiration for characters, villains and heroes in your own fantasy world. Wouldn't it be great if your fantasy world and mine could affect each other? I'd absolutely love it!

 


I might also work on other jobs in the meantime. That again won't always leave me time to draw for the Weird World Hero Book. I draw since I am 8 years old now, though. And I love to sit back, relax with a cup of tea and draw at night, when the world calms down and the distractions become less and less.
In total it should take around 2 months to finish the whole book. Regarding problems I'm not able to see yet and can't calculate I will give the book 3 months to be finished safely.
I'm certain I'll find enough time to finish the book until November 2021.
 


If you don't have a credit card or Google Pay or Apple Pay, then contact me directly via my profile above. We can also set up another form of financial support such as PayPal, which will of course give you the same perk you chose.
If you can't afford to help me financially, show my campaign to your family members and friends who might be interested. People spend hundreds on fantasy comics, sci-fi movies, action videogames and other great digital content all the time. Maybe they'd like to follow the creation of a little book filled with weird fantasy heores, too?! Who knows?
What I definitely know is that I'll greatly appreciate it. :) Thank you!
Best,Filip

story:
The cult classic film from the 80s is back with a vengeance, Directed by the legendary Albert Pyun, who created a beloved story that has transcended time. Now we have the opportunity to expand the universe with a 22-page color comic book, with incredible art by Ozzy Longoria and an amazing cover by legendary artist Simon Bisley.  

 

 
 

We are Creamy Rat Studios in association with Gemini Comics, We love the Sword and the Sorcerer movie so much that we needed to have the rights and produce our dream project,  We have produced successful campaigns in the past and this one won't be different.  With your help and support, we will deliver you an amazing product that everybody will enjoy.

 
 
 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

With your contribution, we will send the books to print and send it straight to your home, We are not charging huge amounts, we just want everyone to have a copy at a fair price. So it will be a win-win situation, You get an amazing book and perks and we get to do a dream project.

What do we need? How about $500+. That covers printing, shipping, and perks. Most importantly we need your belief that this comic will kick ass!

The comic is in production. It will ship on time. 

Besides the comic...you want perks! We have Albert Pyun autograph cards! Shirts! Prints, Want to be in the comic? We can make that happen!!! AND ORIGINAL BISLEY ART!!!

If we fall short of our reasonable goal? Smaller print runs! We will not be stopped!

The Impact

The Sword and the Sorcerer is the third project on Indiegogo from Creamy Rat Studios. Both Synthcore Dreams and Mean Guns were successful. We covered all books, perks, and artists.


Any and all help is greatly appreciated! Please share the links.

story:
Stretch Goal Announced!

A Creepy Collectible Trading Card!

Welcome, travelers of the dark corridors,

During our daily reading of the Necronomicon we uncovered a sinister secret reward for those who are faithful to the writings of the book.  If this Reanimator The Eternal Lie IndieGoGo project can gather enough support to exceed the $12,500 level, all of the pledge backers will receive a free limited edition collectible promotional trading card depicting the diabolical cover of Herbert West meeting Lady Demon and Vampirella SIGNED BY ARTIST BLACKY SHPHERD!

Breaking News Reanimator IndieGoGo Extended With New Variant!

The clock was about to strike 12 on the Reanimator The Eternal Lie, but as the Witching Hour approached, so too did an amazing opportunity!  One of the most well-known and popular comics retailers and purveyor of all things cool, Jesse James, was so excited about this project that he wanted to be a part of it...literally!  Working directly with Blacky Shepherd and Cullen Bunn, Jesse orchestrated this incredible variant putting himself directly into the path of Herbert West and his denizens!

This extremely limited edition of James under attack is going to grace an exclusive variant cover on Reanmiator The Eternal Lie that is launching on IndieGoGo and celebrating Jesse James Comics.  Thanks to everyone involved, we're making it available to all the great IndieGoGo supporters!  You can get this extremely rare variant as either a pledge level or an add on.  The James variant comes with the exclusive Reanimator pen and the Francavilla mini print as well. 

To give everyone a chance to get their hands on this variant, we are extending the Reanimator The Eternal Lie IndieGoGo campaign an additional 30 days!  Thank you for being a part of this terrifying tale and watch for even more updates forthcoming!  

 

CLICK HERE TO LEARN HOW TO PLAY

REANIMATOR THE BOARD GAME

story:
We're creating a graphic novel about war in the Arctic

DAMOCLES is a book-length comic book that pits the United States and Russia against each other in a high-tech battle for one of the world's last major untapped oil reserves, under the Arctic Sea.

DAMOCLES is under contract with U.S. Naval Institute Press, the publisher that launched Tom Clancy's career with The Hunt for Red October.

Not coincidentally, DAMOCLES is best described as "Clancy-esque." The conflict is grounded in actual politics and geography. The weapons, tactics and strategy are realistic. The characters are strong, brave, competent ... and expendable.

DAMOCLES is written by David Axe.

  • Longtime journalist and former war correspondent
  • Has written for The Daily Beast, Wired, The Village Voice, The Washington Post, Salon and many others
  • Author of several nonfiction books and six other graphic novels including War Is Boring
  • Screenwriter and filmmaker

 

DAMOCLES is drawn by Mike Morocco. Here's a sample.

We want to put you in our book

Chip in toward the substantial cost of writing and drawing the comic, and we'll include you in it.

  • Donations over a certain level entitle you to appear as a minor character
  • Send us a photo for reference
  • Look for yourself as a U.S. Army paratrooper, U.S. Navy submariner or Russian Spetsnaz commando
  • For a bigger contribution, we'll even name a character after you and make sure to mention it in the text
  • We'll send you a copy of the book

You're helping to make the coolest-ever war comic

Creating comics is hard work. With a book like DAMOCLES, the advance from the publisher doesn't remotely cover the roughly two years of work it takes to actually produce 200 pages of inked and lettered art. We do it because we love it, but we need your help.

DAMOCLES is something special. A big, serious and exciting work of graphic fiction that explores one of the world's great future conflict zones through the lives of unique and sympathetic characters.

Get your name and face in our comic, and you'll be a part of comics history.

story:
Babylon Working follows a crew of misfit space pirates who call themselves Babylon. The crew attempts to pull off an easy job of stealing the cargo of an ancient cult. Little did they know that the cargo was housing an elder god. Now every collector, cult, and fearmongering zealot is after them.

WHAT ARE YOU BACKING?

  • This is a 32 page full color comic, single (third) issue of a series.
  • Sci-Fi genre
  • Mature Readers

PREVIEW

 Read The First 11 Pages Of Issue 1

Rewards

Day One Print

story:
Ned Hume is not having a good week.

His career as an actor..... Well, to call it "struggling" is generous.

His girlfriend has begun to bring up the dreaded subjects of marriage and kids. (He's settled on the tried and true tactics of deflection and feigned hysterical deafness.)

His brother has just died. Yeah, he was an ass, but still, y'know, family.

And then there's the fact that he's lost his mind. At least Ned hopes he's lost his mind. What else could explain the hallucinations? This morning, on the streets of Manhattan, he started seeing creatures. Monsters; Grotesqueries; Demons; shambling, crawling or oozing along with the usual NYC sidewalk crowd. No one seems to notice them. But he sees them. 

And they see him.

And while some might turn out to be more lost than menacing, a ten foot tall fanged and tentacle-waving nightmare asking for directions to the nearest subway station is no less disturbing. Ned's lost his mind, right? That's what he hopes. Unfortunately...

As you can guess from the title, NED is not the name of a person you'd expect to be the ruler of a Pit in the bowels of Hell. (Actually, I'm not sure I want him near the bowels of anything.) Or involved in the supernatural at all for that matter. He agrees wholeheartedly, and would prefer it not be so. But in this new, original 144 page graphic novel written and drawn by me, I don't give him a choice.

It's a funny (to us) and frightening (especially to him) story of an average guy discovering the world is so much stranger than he thought, and his family (himself included) are way more connected to the darker, scarier side of reality than he knew or would ever ever want. The darker side, it turns out, doesn't want him either. 

This first volume (the story does continue) runs over 130 pages of story; as I draw, I keep adding pages, letting scenes breathe so the page count is not set in stone. There's a great thing about creator-owned and Crowd-funding: No editor saying "Can you have this five pages fit into three, even though it screws up the storytelling and kills the gags and any suspense?" And there'll be extras of course, like behind the scenes goodies; of course the THANK YOU page listing the name of every backer; and guest pin-ups by Mike McKone, Tom Raney, Matt Clark, Alan Davis and others to be announced. And a forward by Louise Simonson.

 This campaign is specifically to get the book to hardcover. There is an additional stretch goal that will expand the page count to 160, and include a bonus stand alone extra story.

In 30+ years working in comics, besides various work on VALIANT books, Deadpool, Black Panther and the BAT-books, I've been lucky to have had extended runs on some great books with amazing writers. Peter David's AQUAMAN. Judd Winnick's EXILES. GOTHAM UNDERGROUND with Frank Tieri. RED LANTERNS with Charles Soule. DEADPOOL with Christopher Priest. SECRET SIX with Gail Simone. I love comics; it's all I've ever wanted to do since I can remember wanting to do something other than soil my diaper... though I guess that wasn't really a conscious decision. (I swear.) And all I want to do is just keep making comics. My own comics. It took over twenty years to get back to doing my own stuff, and I'm happier for it. This is my third crowd-funding project, after two previous successes.

I'm the one on the left....

Plans are to print in the US, with the goal of printing minimum 5,000 copies. All backers will be listed in a THANK YOU page in the book; and each book will come with a custom NedLOP bookmark and postcard inside (just because I think they're fun). The $25 perk level will get you the physical book.

SHIPPING- 

  • USA- $10
  • Canada- $15
  • The Rest of the World- $25

 About some of the premium perk levels:

$85 - REMARK-- This is a b&w FULL head-sketch that's done on the inside front cover or first blank page of the book. Backer's choice of character. (People use the term "remark" different ways; this is how I mean it.) **Amount is limited**

$195 - SKETCH TIME-- This is a con-style 9x12 sketch; it's the size I work at conventions when I'm sitting in Artist Alley. Single figure with a simple background. Below is an example of a 9x12 done recently. **Amount is limited**  Example below:

The b&w art for the cover seen up above is one of the perks too; b&w is below:

SHIPPING- Note that there is an additional shipping charge for the commissions (not the REMARK of course; that is done in the book itself) and the cover, as they are shipped separately:

  • USA- $20 addt'l
  • Canada- $25 addt'l
  • Rest of the World- $35 addt'l

Thanks for checking out my project. It will only be done because of you, and it's impossible to say how much, funded or not, I appreciate everyone who supports this project.

Risks and challenges

This is my third crowd-funding project. It's been a few years since the success of LEAVING MEGALOPOLIS, and I've been itching to get back to creator-owned, especially something I created from scratch. I did want to makes sure at least part of this project was in the can before the campaign, and about half the 130+ pages are done. And I'm continuing to work as the campaign runs. Just to be safe, as life has an annoying way of intervening, I'm allotting 4 months for completion of the book (including colors, lettering, production etc). Then I'm at the mercy of the printer's schedule, followed by shipping.  Tentative ship date is March 2020. Like I said, life can be very obstinate about the plans of mice & men, but I think this is a safe deadline. Some rewards, like the sketches, should ship much earlier.

NED, Lord of the Pit and related characters ™ & © James Calafiore

story:
Ellie the Eliminator: A cartoonish joy

She's cute, she's deadly, and now she's on a new mission to get her story printed and in your hands! Ellie the Eliminator was a comic series that started off with a silly idea: What if a Terminator robot was really bad at their job?  Wonder no more! Now you can jump in to the first three issues of what could be a long on-going series following the misadventures of Calvin and Ellie in their cat and mouse chases. It's the perfect gift for kids who are looking to read their very first comics. This could be your only chance to get these wonderful stories in print, so act fast!

Not sure if Ellie is for you? Check out some pages below and see what you think!

(ISSUE #1)

(ISSUE #2)

(ISSUE #3)

All three issues in one makes for 65 pages of story along with 3 one-page mini comics.

 

Goodies and Loot

It means a lot to me to print Ellie the Eliminator since it's one of my favorite comic series to write. So if you help me fund the printing, I'll give you a little something in return. If you're backing from overseas, you can grab the Digital bundle perk, which will contain the pdf of the graphic novel along with concept art. If you want the printed book, then you'll receive it signed with love along with the digital bundle. And if you want to give a little something extra, then you can back the poster tier and get this adorable poster of Ellie and her friends.

Not enough? You drive a hard bargain. But ask and you shall receive! Help us reach some stretch goals, and more goodies will come your way~

$5k Stretch Goal- Coloring Book Pages and How-to-Draw Included!

$10k Stretch Goal- Bookmarks and stickers!

15k Stretch Goal- ??? I really want plushies ???

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign and get the word out to people who might be interested
  • Share our animations on our Burning Star youtube channel
  • Share our digital comics on burningstarcomics.net
  • Send in some fanart ;)

(ISSUE #2)





(ISSUE #3)
All three issues in one makes for 65 pages of story along with 3 one-page mini comics.
 

Goodies and Loot
It means a lot to me to print Ellie the Eliminator since it's one of my favorite comic series to write. So if you help me fund the printing, I'll give you a little something in return. If you're backing from overseas, you can grab the Digital bundle perk, which will contain the pdf of the graphic novel along with concept art. If you want the printed book, then you'll receive it signed with love along with the digital bundle. And if you want to give a little something extra, then you can back the poster tier and get this adorable poster of Ellie and her friends.

Not enough? You drive a hard bargain. But ask and you shall receive! Help us reach some stretch goals, and more goodies will come your way~
$5k Stretch Goal- Coloring Book Pages and How-to-Draw Included!
$10k Stretch Goal- Bookmarks and stickers!
15k Stretch Goal- ??? I really want plushies ???
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign and get the word out to people who might be interested
Share our animations on our Burning Star youtube channel
Share our digital comics on burningstarcomics.net
Send in some fanart ;)

story:
Welcome Aboard The Richest Treasure Ship You’ve Never Heard Of

From 1565 till 1815, THE single-richest treasure-ship a pirate could dream of taking as a prize was THE MANILA GALLEON.

“…but what is THE MANILA GALLEON?” you may ask. Click on our above video intro and you’ll get the idea. [ also, follow us on Facebook and Instagram @ManilaComic ]

 

Who We Are:

Eugene Park (artist) – creator/writer/artist of the Red Roger comic, independent illustrator, and pirate lore, cartoon, and film enthusiast.  IGG @eugeneypark / @red_roger_official_page

http://Eypark0704.myportfolio.com

Paul Suda (writer) - horseman/swordsman you may have seen on Deadliest Warrior, Full Metal Jousting, Gamology’s Experts React series, and producer/fight designer of Tower of Joy – A Game of Thrones FanFilm.  IGG @actorpaulsuda

What We're About In These Waters:

Our campaign goals are simple:

  • Self-Publish Manila #1 (using a USA-based Printer!), in which our characters are introduced and face their first challenges (a yacht race in Manila Bay and a Dutch attack), digitally and in-print, for our backers.
  • Give our Mighty Artist a head-start on drawing Manila #2, in which the plot thickens and THE GALLEON arrives in-port...
  • Create an excited Crew of Readers to follow the MANILA storyline to its conclusion as we self-publish new Issues on a regular basis.

 

Here's a breakdown of how your precious Booty gets paid-out:

 

A Worthy Maiden Voyage...

As you might have deduced, MANILA does not take place in the Caribbean, nor in Old Europe. Rather, it's a story of East and West colliding in the beautiful and treacherous waters of the Philippine and South China Seas. It's something of a fish-story, larger-than-life, as we fans of pirate tales prefer, BUT it's also based on the very real historical events of the mid-17th century, in which the whole world scrambled and fought for a piece of the East Indies, and all the riches pouring out of that region.

MANILA is a tale in which our intrepid heroes are primarily FROM East Asia, and in which their main antagonists are from Spain (the colonial overlords of Manila and its environs) and The Dutch East India Company (a rising maritime power, having ruthlessly established a nutmeg monopoly and hungering for more). 

The Crew executing the Galleon heist includes:

  • Yang - Taiwanese shipwright, Architect of THE PLAN
  • Gan - Yang's son, Taiwanese-Malay boat Skipper
  • Imugi - Korean crack-shot, Master Gunner
  • Makisig ("Phil") - tribal Filipino highlander, Top-Man 
  • Hu - Chinese accountant serving the Ming consul, Purser
  • Chesa - Javanese-German adventuress, Thief
  • Tala - Filipina Manila-dwelling tavern-owner, Quartermaster
  • Bunji - Japanese Ronin
  • Jesus - Mexican-Spanish Forger
  • Houghtalen - Dutch-American Bosun

As fun as the classic West Indies setting can be for a pirate heist, we thought you might enjoy a change of scenery, a fresh take on high-seas Adventure, as well as more than one cultural reaction to European incursions in Asia.

Rocks and Shoals

This is a new course we've set for the pirate genre. No story exactly like this one has been told before, and like so many explorers setting sail over unexplored horizons, we're relying on OUR SKILLS and YOUR HELP to get us into the safe harbor we seek. Luckily...

  • This Story, these Characters, and this Setting are SO MUCH FUN
  • ...and you're going to dig all this KILLER ART

Join Our Crew. Better yet, join our PRESS GANG!

Your contributions to our VENTURE (the original root for the word 'ADVENTURE') are invaluable, really they mean the world to us, and we won't stop reminding all of you how meaningful your Booty will be.

That said, if you're strapped and/or in hock to your own Pursers, YOU CAN STILL HELP!

  • Share our campaign and YouTube video links to social media, get the word out, Shanghai your friends and relations, and let the pirate and comic fans among them know we've got something very special to share with them!

story:
Hello, I am Gary Shipman the creator of the Pakkins' Land and Titan Mouse of Might graphic novels. My work has been nominated for Russ Manning, Harvey, and Eisner awards in the comic book industry. 

I would like to welcome you to the Titan Mouse of Might Artist's Edition IndieGoGo campaign.

Almost from the beginning concept of Titan Mouse of Might, I have wanted to make it into an 14" x 10" Artist's Edition. The problem has been finding a printer who could accommodate the larger format and the lower print run. Now we have found the printer and with your help on the campaign, we can make theTitan Mouse of Might Artist's Edition a reality.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need the funding to make theTitan Mouse of Might Artist's Edition. All of the art is done and ready to go. We will need to cover the printing and the shipping of this volume. 

In return you will get in your hands Titan Mouse of Might Artist's Edition volume one.

You can make your volume a "one of a kind" by getting the Artist's Edition +Drawing by Gary Shipman perk!

Every drawing will be hand drawn by Gary Shipman during a live stream on the Gary Shipman Art channel @YouTube 

The Impact you are making is big. You are making it posable for me to create new an fun projects like this and others, You contribution means so much, and I thank you for that.

I want to share my art and tale my stories and try to add value to you and to the world.

STRETCH GOALS:
$10K!  LOCKED! To be announced. 
$15K!  LOCKED! To be announced. 

I have a successful track record with fulfilling several projects...like these:

https://igg.me/at/titanmouse/x/18833604#/

https://igg.me/at/esjlDLyruSs/x/18833604#/

https://igg.me/at/TITAN-2/x/18833604#/

https://igg.me/at/Sketch2018/x/18833604#/

https://igg.me/at/2019sketchbook/x/18833604#/

https://igg.me/at/GothUgly/x/18833604#/

Risks & Challenges

 

The Risks are very low. The book is done. All we need is to have it printed and then shipped. 

I have done many campaigns in the past and feel qualified to bring this project all the way to fulfillment.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

Just by you sharing and get the word out...making some noise about your campaign help a ton.

Indiegogo makes it easy! Sharing is just a click away. You can use the share tools at the top of the campaign!

That's it.

Thank you for your time.

Your friend in comics,

Gary Shipman

story:
THE MERMAIDS—A teacher joins a team of rebels determined to overthrow and kill a powerful mermaid queen!

 

The script, pencils, inks, colors, letters and covers are all 100% done!  The ALL-NEW full color comic, 48 pages, ships April 2021!  

 

Look Inside The 100% Completed Book Here:

 

Script by: MJ Negueruela & Stefan Petrucha   

Interior Art by: David Lorenzo and Esther Sanz

Covers and designs by Gerry Gertrudia  and two special covers by Javier Aranda

Interior art by David Lorenzo & Esther Sanz with color design by JayJay Jackson​

 

'

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

THE MERMAIDS DAGGERS COVER!    by Gerry Gertrudia & Esther Sanz

 

THE MERMAIDS SAI COVER!  by Gerry Gertrudia & Esther Sanz

 

THE MERMAIDS SWIMMING COVER!  by Javier Sanchez & Nurmaliza


THE MERMAIDS JHANA AND EDRIS COVER!   by Javier Sanchez & Nurmaliza​

 

 

THE MAKING OF THE MERMAIDS BOOK: (100 PAGES)

 

100 page black and white book featuring the full script, all pencil layouts and more than 20 full page designs by The Mermaids cover artists and key designer Gerry Gertrudia!

   

Full script and layouts for entire graphic novel!

Over 20 full page designs by The Mermaids cover artist and key designer Gerry Gertrudia!

 

 

THE MAKING OF THE MERMAIDS also features exclusive, detailed character backgrounds and information on 30+ characters!

 

Jhana: A gifted teacher, Jhana spent her early life in the service of the young. When she finally indulges her own passions, they nearly destroy her. While tutoring the childlike Princess Melina, Jhana falls hopelessly in love with the dark, visiting princess Edris. Their torrid affair ends with the announcement of a political engagement between Edris and Melina, leaving Jhana devastated and suicidal. Though planning to end her misery on their wedding day, a visit with her benefactor Vana opens her eyes to the devastation caused by Queen Leith. Rather than end her life, she devotes it to overthrowing the Queen and the house of her former lover.

Kendan: One of Jhana’s pupils, Kendan is good-hearted merchild with an extreme lack of focus, often seemingly unaware of what’s right in front of her. Rather than pay attention in class, she is forever running off to watch the scintillating colors of the rainbow fish. Is she a hopeless dreamer, addicted to shiny surfaces, ADD or all three? In any case, she’s present enough to remind her teacher to bid farewell to a benefactor, shaking Jhana from her own malaise.

Gidri: Divine herald of Kalise, Gidri is tasked with rousing the creatures of the sea. The sadness of knowing all living things must die keeps her from accomplishing her goal. Enraged, Kalise gives her gills and fins, and casts her from his presence. Though her task is finally completed, she remains removed from her divine source. To the mermaids, she is a goddess in her own right, and an example to live by. Through worship they honor her love and sacrifice.

Melina: Naïve, childlike daughter of Queen Leith, ruler of Loria, Melina loves both Jhana and Edris with an open heart. Unaware of their affair, her engagement to Edris delights her. Unaware of politics, her kidnapping by the rebels only confuses her.

Edris: Impulsive daughter of Sandra’s Queen Vanthi, blackfish of the family, Edris loves the tutor Jhana with a passion. At the same time, she’s tired of living in the long shadow cast by her more noble sister, Elexa. When her mother betroths her to the naïve young Melina for political reasons, she turns her back on Jhana and obeys, only to find herself in a battle for the realm, on the opposite side of her former.

Vava: A kindly older mermaid who took Jhana in when her affair with Edris ended and she was forced to leave the palace. It’s only when the compassionate Vava and her family are forced to leave Loria that Jhana sees firsthand the cruelty of Leith’s armies.

Leith the Shark Queen: Everyone has heard the rumor that Loria’s ambitious ruler Leith killed her own mother to speed her ascension to the throne. Far fewer know that Loria is also a changeling, able to transform a deadly killer. As new leader, the Shark Queen’s cruelty begat rebellion, her harsh military response has destroyed the realm’s resources and forced the starving to flee in droves. Marrying her daughter Melina to Edris of Palagia, ties her family to the ocean’s most powerful army, leaving the other realms wondering who she’ll seek to conquer next.

Thessa: Queen of Rhanur, the compassionate Thessa risks attack when she opens her borders to Loria’s starving fugitives. If Queen Leith believes her in league with the rebels, Rhanur may be her next target. Though supporting the rebel cause, Thessa not only has a far weaker military, she and her wife Ydim have a child on the way.

Ydim:  Wife of Thessa, Queen of Rhanur, Ydim is pregnant with their first child, who will be heir to the throne – if the realm survives. Though she loves and respects her queen, the more pragmatic Ydim fears her too-kind wife will bring the Shark-queen’s wrath down on their smaller realm when she opens their borders to Loria’s starving fugitives.

Loria: The undersea realm of Loria is second only to Palagia in size and strength. Once the gem of the seas, the cruel reign of Leith, the Shark Queen led to rebellion. The harsh military response collapsed the civil order, devastated their resources and led to a massive exodus of starving refugees. Rather than help her people, Leith is more interested in joining her family to Palagia by marriage. When she succeeds, neutralizing her biggest threat, it seems only a matter of time before the army shifts from crushing rebels to conquering new territory.

Pelagia: With the most powerful military under the waves, whither Pelagia turns, so goes the undersea world. Only Loria’s army, if it joined with just one other realm, might challenge her. Some believe Loria’s recent aggressions led Pelagia’s Queen to agree to joining the ruling families through the marriage of her daughter Edris to Loria’s Princess Melina.

Gordova: Gordova, capital of Loria, holds the grand palace of the vicious Queen Leith, where she lives with her conniving concubine, the Lady Vita, and her naïve, child-like daughter Melina. Once-glorious, thanks to Leith’s harsh treatment of the rebels, the city is now by plagued by famine and a decaying social order. The citizens live in fear, the starving flee in droves.

Rhanur: A vulnerable neighbor to the newly militant Loria, the peaceful Rhanur has opened its borders to the starving refugees. Its own resources strained, should it prove to harbor the rebels Loria wants to destroy, it may swiftly become Queen Leith’s next target. When princess Melina is kidnapped and Loria’s armies on the move, the time has come for Rhanur to act.

Vanthi: Queen of Sandar, the most powerful undersea realm, Vanthi is also mother to Edris, the family’s impulsive blackfish, and the noble Elexa, hero to the people. When Elexa returns from a quest suffering a strange madness, a cloud hands over the realm. With the powerful Loria stretching its muscles, Vanthi arranges a marriage between Edris and Loria’s Princess Melina, perhaps hoping to stave off an attack from her only military rival.

Elexa: Daughter to Vanthi, princess of Pelagia, the epic feats of the brave, noble Elexa have set an example throughout the seas. When she returns from a dangerous quest suffering a strange madness, it makes the realm seem weaker. Family blackfish Edris becomes the only viable heir, and a pawn in a complex political game.

Gimaine: Jester and gadfly to more than one queen, Gimaine’s brash, scathing tongue has nearly been cut out by irate royalty on many occasions. At the same time, had the old Queen of Loria heeded her warnings, she might still be alive, and her ambitious daughter not dragging the whole of the watery world into war. Much as Gimaine prefers to stand outside the ocean’s madness and observe with clever quips, Leith’s cruelty leads even the fool to take a stand – with the rebels.

Madja:  Queen of Denor, while recognizing the danger of Leith’s aggression, Madja clings to what she knows best, a diplomatic solution. War is to be avoided at all costs, not only because of the loss of life, but because Denor’s army is hardly huge. Her concern rises when Edris and Melina are married, moreso when rebels kidnap Loria’s princess. It’s only when she’s goaded by Rhaur’s Queen Thessa that she feels her options have run out, and she must risk her people to take a stand against the Shark Queen.

Grumia: Although one of the smaller realms, wealthy Grumia is known as the cultural center of the seas. What it lacks in numbers it makes up for in expertise, luxury and advanced weaponry. When Queen Barra invites the newlywed Edris and Melina to enjoy their honeymoon in Grumia’s lush environs, it’s taken as a signal of her decision to support the Shark Queen.

Barra: The calculating Queen of Grumia, cultural center of the seas, Barra carefully tracks the shifting military powers. When Loria is joined to the powerful Pelagia in marriage, Barra chooses to ally with the cruel Queen Leith rather than face her wrath. Her decision, subtly announced at the wedding, rattles the other realms, forcing them to choose sides, or fall like dominoes.

Sandar: Largest and most powerful of the undersea realms, Sandar’s standing army could easily squash any of the other realms. Only the newly aggressive Loria might prove a challenge – but when the two houses are joined by marriage, what could possibly stand in their way?

Shere: Hopelessly cheery even in these dark times, Shere continues to run one of the few remaining inns on the outskirts of Loria. Though it doubles as a rebel base, despite the danger, the idealist rebel still adheres to the old rules of hospitality. Otherwise, she figures, they’re just as bad as Leith. Her kindness pays off when she allows Jhana inside, unwittingly giving the rebellion their newest, and perhaps most key, member.

Rinko:  Curt, steely Rinko is a veteran, jaded by war and the loss of her comrades. Though lending her blade to the rebels, strategy makes her impatient, and she bristles at any command. Will her hot temper help or destroy their chances at success?

Anaya: Terribly strong, and unwaveringly loyal to the rebel cause, Anaya is a rare changeling, able to puff her body up like a blowfish with terrifying results. Using her powerful arms to draw foes into her body and incapacitate them, she can likely defeat any single enemy.

Abyssinia: Her body multi-colored and translucent, her mind opaque even to those who know her best, Abyssinia is a stranger in a strange land. Though she sides with the rebels, her motives remain as cryptic as her origins and her odd way of talking that makes her seem an alien species.

Itsar: Leader of a ragtag rebel team, Itsar is a born strategist. Now, dogged on all sides by Leith’s soldiers, the clever mind that never failed her now struggles just to keep them alive. In a final, desperate effort to turn the tide, Istar decides on a desperate gambit – the kidnapping of princess Melina. The effort is a success, but now the whole of the Queen’s armies have one goal; finding and destroying them. If she makes it to neighboring Rhanur with her prize, it means the beginning of a war. If not, death.

Vita: Concubine to Queen Leith, the Lady Vita’s own aspirations are kept in check by the fear of her lover. Eagerly taking the throne whenever the queen is away, she revels in the power, only to meekly surrendering it whenever her sadistic paramour returns.

General Sot: Leader of Leith’s ruthless armies, once honored as a great military mind, General Sot now lives on a razor’s edge. Should she ever fail the queen, regardless of her stature or her experience, her life would be forfeit.

Denor: Though one of the smaller realms, Denor has survived and thrived thanks to the clever diplomatic machinations of its calculating Queen, Madja. But in war, one cannot be a friend to all, and whose side they take, for good or ill, will likely decide Denor’s survival.

The Three: Capable of rare magic, the Mer-crones known as The Three act as a means of instant communication. Through them, voice and image instantly travels the leagues, allowing the rich and the royal to speak with one another as if they were next to each other.

Chaka the Joker:  One of four gods whose boredom creates the world, the jovial Chaka embodies the primal force of earth. His joyful mirth makes manifest all mountains, plains and canyons. With Raden, he brings lava, with Kalise, the swamps, with Aitor fertile soil.

Raden the Furious:  One of four gods whose boredom creates the world, the explosive Raden embodies the primal force of fire. His rage brings flame, volcano and lightning into being. With Chaka, he brings lava, with Kalise, steam, with Aitor, hurricanes.

Kalise the Wailer: One of four gods whose boredom creates the world, the emotional Kalise is the embodiment of the primal force of water. His tears bring the seas, lakes and rivers. With Chaka he brings the swamps, with Raden, steam, with Aitor, the rain.

Aitor the Dreamer: One of four gods whose boredom creates the world, the ephemeral Aitor embodies the primal force of air. Through him come the wind, breath and ether. With Chaka, he brings fertile soil, with Raden, he brings hurricanes, with Aitor, the rain.

Tendri: Divine herald of Chaka, Tendri is tasked with rousing the trees, seaweed and other plant life that blanket the earth and seas. She performs her duties with swift joy.

Ladri: Divine herald of Aitor, Ladri is tasked with rousing the birds and flying fish that dance in his skies. She performs her duties with dancing abandon.

Rugri: Divine herald of Raden, Rugri is tasked with rousing the warm spark of life that permeates all living things. She performs her tasks with a fiery intensity.

 

THE MERMAIDS is RATED "T" – TEEN – Appropriate for readers age 12 and older. May contain mild violence, language and/or suggestive themes.

 

 

and don't miss my other series...

COLLEGE OF THE DEAD GRADUATION DAY"

 

"Where College Costs You An Arm And A Leg!"

 

The script, pencils, inks, colors, letters and covers are all 100% done!  Book One is 140 pages in black and white, Book Two is 48 pages and full color.  Both are in print and can ship with your copies of THE MERMAIDS for no additional shipping if you purchase them in APRIL 2021!  

 

 

 

 

Please support this campaign, and let others know!  Spread the word and share the link!

www.epicmermaids.com
