Octopus Cowboy Book 1 Pencils by Jason Orfalas, Bristol, 11"x17".
Page 8

 
 
Shipping and Handling
The following items will be shipped securely in Gemini Comic Flash Mailers.

 
International Backers please be aware that import fees may apply depending on your location.. Taxes and duties are to be paid by the receiver, if any.
 
Collectibles
 
'First!' Sticker
2" x 2"
Where it all started. This sticker sports the first ever artwork of Octopus Cowboy at the center.

'Prizefighters' Trading Cards
2.5" x 3.5"
Octopus Cowboy's three main characters!



'Think Fast' Bookmark
2" x 6"

 
Risks & Challenges
I have minimised the risk to my backers as much as I can by working over a year in advance before even announcing this campaign.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Consider sharing this campaign to your friends. It would be a big help. Thank you!

story:
We are pleased to present Cerebus No. 2, in a deluxe, Remastered & Expanded edition! 

In December 1977, Cerebus No.1 was published - chronicling the adventures of a short-tempered, barbarian Aardvark created by Dave Sim. Originally conceived as a parody of Barry Windsor-Smith's masterfully illustrated Conan the Barbarian (which was a big hit for Marvel Comics in the 1970s), Sim quickly found his own voice as a storyteller and illustrator and went on to publish 300 issues, eventually ending the series in March, 2004.

The original, early issues of Cerebus were printed on thin newsprint paper and decades later, most of the few surviving examples are found in lower grades. This new edition of Cerebus No. 2 presents the original issue in its entirety, with painstakingly remastered art and printed on premium paper! Early Cerebus has never looked so good!

In addition to the original content, this expanded edition contains an additional 24 pages of rarities including the thumbnails for a previously unpublished 6-page Cerebus story from 1978 titled, "ANATOLE'S SOLECISM." This version of the story features Sim's original pencil breakdowns and finished lettering, with the unfinished art offering a rare glimpse into Sim's creative process in the early days of Cerebus.

CEREBUS No. 2, Remastered and Expanded will not be widely distributed or sold through comic book stores. 

THE BOOKS

Cerebus No. 2 comes in a choice of 7 different variant covers. For the serious collectors, we are offering bundles including the logo free, ultimate "POP" variant! Every book will arrive individually bagged and boarded. BONUS: Each variant comes with a trading card!

$10 - Collector Cover

The Collector cover + 1 trading card. (1 book)

$30 - Gold Bundle

The Collector and Gold covers + 2 trading cards. (2 books)

$50 - Platinum Bundle

The Collector, Gold and Platinum covers + 3 trading cards. (3 books)

$95 - Vault Bundle

The Collector, Gold, Platinum, and Vault covers + 4 trading cards. (4 books)

$125 - Cerespawn Bundle

The Collector, Gold, Platinum, Vault, Cerespawn and Zombie Cerespawn covers + 5 trading cards. (6 books)

$195 - Pop Bundle

The Collector, Gold, Platinum, Vault, Cerespawn, Zombie Cerespawn and Pop covers + 6 trading cards. (7 books)

$250 - Everything Bonus Bundle!

The Collector, Gold, Platinum, Vault, Cerespawn, Zombie Cerespawn and Pop covers + 6 trading cards. (7 books). Additionally, this bundle will come with 2 stickers, 2 postcards, the Dave Sim autograph trading card, the ultra rare glow in the dark Demon Khem trading card, the full color Jaka card, and a 1.5" round Cerebus button! That's not all, we will include some cool bonus Cerebus rarities that we have left over from previous campaigns. These might be trading cards, stickers, postcards, etc... we will load you up! Below are samples of some of the guaranteed extras you will receive in this bundle.

TRADING CARDS

Every book comes with one trading card created exclusively for this edition.

ADD-ONS

$50 - Bonus Book Bundle

We have a limited number of books from previous campaigns. These all had low print runs and are out of print. In this bundle you will receive 3 books, the 64 page High Society Notebook, the remastered Cerebus No. 1, and the Secret History of the Counterfeit Cerebus No. 1. These are the very last publisher copies!

$275 - Original Art Cards

​Dave Sim created a limited number of one of a kind, hand drawn, original art trading cards.​We have 10 available and each original art card will be sent out at random. Below are samples of some of the cards!

$395 - Signed & Numbered Proof Set

We produced a set of advance proofs of 5 books featuring all of Dave Sim's new cover art printed in black & white. Only 30 Signed & Numbered sets were produced and we only have a few left!

story:
The Cosmic Warrior!

Chosen as a champion of peace and justice...

...he must prevail to save the galaxy! 

The Cover: 

The Story:

Blue Angels Captain Daniel Sawyer is transported through space, where he learns he has been chosen to be a champion of the peaceful Jolan people. At war for centuries against the evil Phobos, the Jolans have staved off their enemies through ritual combat in an arena, with fighters chosen by each side to resolve their conflicts.

When their ancient laws fail, all out war breaks out. Not only is the Jolan world in peril, but Earth's fate hangs in the balance as The Cosmic Warrior fights on behalf of the innocent everywhere!

THE COSMIC WARRIOR is a 66-page sci-fi superhero graphic novel which will bring back memories of great comics like THE GREEN LANTERN and JOHN CARTER OF MARS. 

The story is written by #1 Bestselling and award-winning Sci-Fi author, Jon Del Arroz, drawn by Brazilian sensation Cloves Rodrigues with colors by Levi Ramirez. 

And by popular demand - JDA will sign each volume of this campaign! 

Preview Pages: 

The Books: 

THE COSMIC WARRIOR can be obtained in two forms:

1. A standard-cover trade paperback

2. The limited hardcover 

Each of these will be exquisitely printed by Jon Del Arroz's printer he uses for all of his projects. This means a higher quality paper than standard comic books because novels are meant to last! 

Jon Del Arroz's complete superhero library is also available, including his acclaimed FLYING SPARKS series and DYNAMITE THOR. Each of these books are available as add-ons individually as well.

STRETCH GOALS: 

$3,000 - All backers will receive Digital PDFs of Jon's Clockwork Dancer #1 and AI Wars #1 in addition to the rewards.

$5,000 - We will include a cosmic warrior logo sticker with each book! 

$10,000 - We will make a Cosmic Warrior Trading Card for each book. 

Thank you so much for all of your tremendous support and reading the real alternative to mainstream comics! 

Fans of Dan Fraga, Black Flag, Aaron Lopresti, First Man, Wraith of God, Arc Athena, The Lucent, Michael Bancroft, Liam Gray, Wonder Island, Shane Davis, Inglorious Rex, Black Hops, Kamen America, Tim Lim, Timothy Lim, Mark Pellegrini, Rainbow The Brute, Stealing Solo,  Fandom Menace, ComicsGate, Ethan Van Sciver, Cyberfrog: Rekt Planet, Graham Nolan, Alien Alamo, FragaBoom, Jon Malin, Graveyard Shift, Shadowbinders,  Micah Curtis, Godlike, Billy Tucci, Shi Omnibus, Shane Davis, Graham Nolan, Jack The Ripper, Cyberfrog Action Figures, Earthbound, Art Thibert, and more will love THE COSMIC WARRIOR.

story:
presents

 

"a Sam Glanzman tour de force."

–Comic Book Resources

 

Welcome to the campaign from IT'S ALIVE! to publish AIR WAR STORIES #4!  Each issue of AIR WAR STORIES focuses on aerial war battles from the last hundred years, illustrated brilliantly by comic book legend, World War II vet, and Eisner Award-nominee, Sam Glanzman! This issue features: "One Was Doomed," set during WWI; "Hayseed Hharrington," set during WWII; and "You Only Lose Once," set during WWII. Also included are essays about Glanzman, original covers, vintage advertisements, and more! Also included are essays about Sam Glanzman, original covers, vintage advertisements, and more!  Here is the standard cover, along with the variant cover.  As always, there will only be 100 printed of the variant cover, and it is only available from this campaign! PLEASE NOTE: each issue of AIR WAR STORIES is a one shot anthology of stand alone war stories.  What I mean to say is, if you missed the first three issues, you can still enjoy this one!  But if interested, you can pick up all four issues from this campaign.

 

AIR WAR STORIES #4 (cover A)

 

AIR WAR STORIES #4 (cover B) (IndieGoGo Exclusive)

 

If you missed the campaigns for the first three issues of AIR WAR STORIES, you can pick them up from this campaign.  Here are the covers:


AIR WAR STORIES #1

 

AIR WAR STORIES #2

 

AIR WAR STORIES #3

 

Check out what Atomic Avenue had to say about AIR WAR STORIES:

"Since DC Comics cornered the market on war comics for most of the time that they were popular, it's easy to forget that many other publishers had war titles that were often on par –and occasionally superior to–anything DC had to offer. Case in point in this Dell title, an anthology focusing on combat in the skies. During its run in the 1960s, AIR WAR STORIES delivered excitement and moral tales (often with a twist) set throughout the history of air war from World World I to the Cold War era in which it was published.  The series is notable for the regular contributions of artist Sam Glanzman."

This comic book series was originally published by Dell in the early 1960s.  As such, the original films are not available, and we had to scan directly from the original 50+ year old, yellowed comic book pages. Therefore, each page of this comic has been expertly restored by the brilliant Allan Harvey, to give reader's the best possible presentation of Sam Glanzman's  incredible artwork.  Below are three restoration samples from AIR WAR STORIES #4, to give everyone a better idea what this book will look like upon publication.  We hope you will consider baking this campaign, and spreading the word to your family and friends, helping us to continue bringing more of Sam Glanzman's best work back into print.  Thank you for your help and  support!

 

 

 

 

As many of you know, I have worked very hard for several years to bring the incredible work of comic book master Sam Glanzman back into print.  Collections I have edited and/or published include A Sailor's Story, U.S.S. Stevens: The Collected Stories, ATTU, Red Range: A Wild Western Adventure (with Joe R. Lansdale), Voyage to the Deep, and (coming soon) The Lonely War of Capt. Willy Schultz (with Will Franz). We were even lucky enough to receive an Eisner Award nomination for the U.S.S. Stevens collection by Glanzman that I edited, which contains true stories about his time serving in the Pacific Theater during WWII.  But aside from his USS Stevens comics, AIR WAR STORIES might just contain some of the best war comics that Glanzman ever illustrated.  I can't wait to get another issue of AIR WAR STORIES back into print for both long time fans to enjoy, and a whole new generation to discover!  Your support will ensure this incredible -and historically important- comic book series lives on for years to come!

 

SAM GLANZMAN

(1924-2017)

Sam Glanzman was an American comic book artist and writer, who  began his career during the "Golden Age of Comic Books" in the 1940s. He is best known  for his war comics for Charlton, Dell Publishing, DC Comics and Marvel.  Glanzman's World War II stories stood out for their realism and  originality, especially theThe Lonely War of Capt. Willy Schultz, and the stories dealing with his own experiences aboard the  U.S.S. Stevens during World War II. He was the first to make  autobiographical comic book stories. He also addressed issues of race and homosexuality in comics at a time when this was still a taboo.

Willy Schultz, and the stories dealing with his own experiences aboard the  U.S.S. Stevens during World War II. He was the first to make  autobiographical comic book stories. He also addressed issues of race and homosexuality in comics at a time when this was still a taboo.

story:
Jared Louche looking rough but what the hell is wrong with Seibold?

Who the Hell are we and why do we deserve your money?

Hey everyone! My name is Jeremy Frazier and I'm the creator of Synthcore Dreams. WHO? Well I'm not super famous but I have written comics for metal bands like Rotting Christ, Tyr and Graveworm. I've also written a comic for the movie series "Meathook Massacre" and have a monthly comic strip which is published in China of all places.

The wonderful artists? Alfonso Pinedo and Bart Buytaert. Alfonso has worked on European editions of Power Rangers and Transformers...and several of my projects. Bart is working on Graveworm at the moment. Thanks guys for the awesome art!

And Dave...Daveoramma if you want to get picky. Daveoramma does a little of everything. Music, setup, pics, the wonderful video...he's our muse!

Why did we make this book? We want to help out...so profits from this project will go to Darkest Before Dawn and Electronic Saviors. We were inspired by ColdWaves and figured since we can't play music (except for Daveoramma) this would be a fitting way to support the cause.

Enough about us! You came for the book and music! Synthcore Dreams is THE Industrial Comic. We have participating bands from all corners of the genre.

                                    Adam Grossmann of Skrew...takes no crap.

VOLUME 1 -New music from Hate Dept., Skrew, Society Burning, Centhron, SMP, Bloodwire, dRAWBACKS and Microwaved. Plus remixes and rare tracks by Leaether Strip, Chemlab, 16Volt and more...

The participating band list-

Leaether Strip, Chemlab, 16Volt, Acumen Nation, Go Fight, Larva, Centhron, Pitchshifter, Drawbacks,  Skrew, Hate Dept, Rabbit Junk, Cyanotic, Gothsicles, Fourth Man, Rob Robinson, SMP, Society Burning, UCNX, Die Robot, Bloodwire, Microwaved, Red Locust, Conformco, Bellhead, Machines on Blast, Missy Hell, Damsel in the Dollhouse, Solemn Assembly, Chrome Corpse...and many more!

                                    Our heroes waiting for new allies to thaw!

Where does your money go?


Printing the comic. Manufacturing CDs. Printing shirts. Plus other random expenses. We aren't going cheap with these...only high quality. No thin t-shirts or home burned CDs.

What do you get?

Synthcore Dreams 72 page comic and CD.

We have 2 shirts (t and work)!

We have original art! Sketches and original inked pages from the comic.

We have PADDLES! What? Why not? Get freaky with us!

Do you want to be in the comic? We can make that happen!

                                        Powell, Claus and Semonik are reborn!

What happens if we don't reach our goal?

I go into credit card debt. This project will be funded! It will be ready by Fall 2019. You will be able to give the gift of Industrial for the holidays!


Why should you contribute?

Sometimes people need someone to talk to. That's why Darkest Before Dawn is there. Also no one likes cancer and Electronic Saviors kicks ass. Lets help eradicate it!
Plus you get lots of cool perks.


Our Risks & Challenges

The book is finished. The only obstacle now is the printing costs. There is no risk of this project taking forever. Never ask for money with just an idea!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help with cash...please...SHARE! SHARE! SHARE! Tell your rich uncle to invest! Use the money you got from that Nigerian Prince! Tell those local businesses to advertise (free copy if they do!)

                                                              Exit Stage Left!

 

NOTE ABOUT SHIPPING TO EU/CANADA. I EDITED THE SHIPPING...IT IS NOW LOWER. EXCEPT FOR THE HEAVIER ITEMS AND THE BOOK/CD COMBO (AFTER SOLD I CANT EDIT).

IF YOU ORDER CD/BOOK FROM EU/CA I WILL REFUND/PAYPAL THE DIFFERENCE.

USA SHIPPING HAS NO CHANGE...ALREADY LOWEST FOR ITEMS.

story:
Short Summary

The White Cat Comics Brand

After two campaigns (and three books) successfully fulfilled, our company praises itself by being one of the most reliable and trustworthy out there when it comes to crowdfunded comics. The bottom-line is that if we hit our goal you will receive your book and merchandise, all the while we stay in touch sending updates, and communicating with you! Look us up, you will know that we deliver, and we deliver fast! In addition, If we hit certain stretch goals, more merchandise will become available!

STRETCH GOALS

Let's get to our next stretch goal at 7K!! This gorgeous SIX AM Comics Sticker of Alden will be added in every physical backer's package!!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute with money. However, there are other ways in which you can help this project become a reality:

  • You can share our campaign on social media and help us reach a broader audience.
  • Tell your friends and family about us and help us spread the word!

 

Where you can find us:

Here is our social media, and other ways you can communicate with us. Give us a follow, we always follow back and reply!

Twitter: @Carla_Tornielli and @JohnGal74923137

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCO_6vUrQziFoWZ...

story:
Short Summary

The story exists in a fantasy world pushed past the medieval era, where gunpowder has shaken the very foundations of society – much in the way it did our own world. Gunpowder has democratized power by diminishing the role of knights and mages. The story follows a young wannabe knight – a member of a noble house of former knights and dragon hunters. Favian (aka The Flintlock Knight) struggles to find his place in a world that has moved on from the antiquated idea of knights.
Before the events of the story, The Flintlock Knight spent his days roaming the countryside, trying to recapture the honor and glory of the past by completing petty tasks and helping people in need. But when an ancient evil is re-awoken, he is thrust into an epic world of sorcery, intrigue, and adventure.

Created and written by David W., pencils and inks by Marcelo Oliveira Costa, and letters by Jahch.

This campaign is for Issue #1, consisting of 22 pages of story. The issue is now completed and is at the printer!

The comic will be in full greyscale.

What I Need & What You Get

I am 100% committed to this project and will fulfill regardless of how much money is raised. I’m putting this issue out there because I’m excited to share this new world I’ve created with you. If this campaign does well, more issues will be on their way!

The Impact

I’m here to tell a great story. Forget about politics and agendas in your entertainment. The Flintlock Knight goes back to basics and does it well.

Risks & Challenges

I have saved up and set aside funds to make this campaign possible. I’m willing take the risk, and take the hit, if this campaign goes south. In any case, you WILL get your comic.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don’t have the funds to contribute, spread the word! Reach out to all your favorite comic creators and let them know about The Flintlock Knight!

 

Cover

Interior Pages

story:
INTRODUCING BLOOD COUNT

What happens when an ancient vampire awakens in a world  full of superheroes hungry for the powers and their blood?

A Vampiric anti-hero emerges with dreams of becoming the city's newest hero.

 

WHAT IS STAR CROSS COMICS?

Welcome to the Star Cross Comics Universe.

 Star Cross Comics is an innovative and disruptive indie publisher specializing in exciting and provocative comic books created by talented artists from around the world, Star Cross Comics is creating a universe of stories and books ranging from horror and thriller to sci-fi and fantasy, superhero, Christian, adventure, and crime.  The company is passionate about making the latest creations from well-known artists as well and new talent available to the public worldwide.  Connecting fans with artists, together the community is rapidly expanding the exciting Star Cross universe.

Who will like Blood Count?

Everyone!! But especially fans of:

  • Supernatural Horror
  • Vampires
  • Superheroes
  • Thrillers

story:
Cover Art. Penciled and inked by Keith Hinman. Colored by Ryan Best.

 

 

 

My name is Chael Roberts. I am the writer and creator of the Guardians of Erloth. Guardians of Erloth is a 24 page comic set in the fantasy land of Erloth, in a Kingdom called Kass. This is an origins story that will follow the main protagonist, Caius, on his journey from being an heir to the throne of a smaller kingdom to his path of becoming a Guardian of the Kingdom of Kass. 

The Team:

Writer/Creator: Chael Roberts

Artist/Colors: Ryan Best

Cover Art: Keith Hinman

Video Promotion: Prevalentmind Studios

All funds will go toward completing the last 14 pages (pencils/inks/colors/letters) of Issue #1. Anything extra will be put toward Issue #2

Currently, there are five pages fully colored and lettered. Pages 6-10 are colored and will be lettered soon. All art is scheduled to be completed with colors and letters by late February. Fulfillment will take place in April of 2019.

Help me spread the word. You can follow me on Twitter Comics Du Nord@Chael Roberts and on Youtube Comics Du Nord. Follow me on Instagram  @Scribeoferloth.

story:
Chronicles of Calamity Issue 2

After the fantastic success of our issue 1 launch, we see no reason not to bring you the further adventures of the Chronicles of Calamity Crew. Do they drown in a well? Do they escape the burning town? Are they lost forever in the swamp of contact high? Find out!

What We Need & What You Get

A glorious 26-page adventure featuring fights and funnies awaits you! Most of the artwork for issue two is already completed, but we need your support to print out physical copies. As usual, the campaign will be chock full of cool optional extras- including stickers, original art tiers, and even the option to be drawn into the comic!

Your contribution makes this a reality, and if you want to own a piece of the Authors and Dragons adventure to hold in your hand, now is your chance!

Risks & Challenges

Risks are minimal because the art all exists, but as usual, the challenges will be getting all of our cool bonus tier artwork and brush-ups done in a timely manner. As last years almost biblical amount of natural disasters can attest to, we never know what's going to trip us up. We're sure it'll be a fun time finding out!

Other Ways You Can Help

Once again, other than funding, word of mouth is the best way to help an indie project get off the ground. We'd love to take as many people as possible on our strange, problematic trip, so let the world know! Like, subscribe, share, smash things (or however that goes!)

story:
Second Chance Campaign for people that missed the original Kickstarter!

Book now 400 pages of story and art!

[PG and PG-13 on rare occasions]

Foxy and Wolfy volume 1 is the first of 7 planned books for the series. Each book will be 160-240 pages, except the first one at 400 pages. This project is my heart and soul and I want to share this awesome adventure with everyone! We have updated scenes, redone dialogue and colored 100%

Foxy and Wolfy is about the adventures of two spirit guardians. A Foxy young spirit guardian with muscular dystrophy named Misaki Kimura and her Wolfy partner, Amaya Bellerose.

Known as mahou shoujo ("magical girl") or just majokko ("witch-girl") in Japanese, Magical Girls are empowered by various means with fantastic powers that both assist and complicate their lives, but manage to persevere despite this.

In the world of Foxy and Wolfy Chaos, spirit guardians are humans who fight genocidal demons and purify souls consumed by hatred. Through the use of spirit keys, the main characters Misaki and Amaya (along with their friends) travel between the human and demon worlds to defend all they hold precious against nefarious demons seeking chaos.

Volume 1 follows their initial origins at Foxshuffle academy as new kid mages, and their first official mission as adults! Expect magical combat, silly shenanigans and deadly fanatical demon attacks! You will see them when they are kids first and later as adults going after their first target.  Come join the fun!

Why was this created? 

 I’ve always enjoyed storytelling and manga since I was a very young child. This is why I chose the manga style.

What made me want to create this story was, for two main reasons. The first and foremost reason is to make an entertaining, positive story for the world. Something to honor all of the dear friends and family that I have lost over my lifetime. Every character has pieces of people that were dear to my heart. This is a project that has become my entire reason to keep pushing forward.


 Secondly, as an LGBT+ creator with Duchenne muscular dystrophy, I want to show that disabled people want and like the same things as other people. The story purposely doesn't ignore or focus on this and focuses more on fun characters, some just happen to have a disability. One of my goals is to positively portray a disabled LGBT+ character without making it the only layer to them.  The first priority is fun for all! Comics bring EVERYONE joy and should be enjoyed by all.

 Who will love Foxy and Wolfy?
 

 Fans of Sailor Moon, Puella Magi Madoka Magica, Cardcaptor Sakura and other fun magical girl series.
 

People who like My Hero Academia, Fairy Tail, Inuyasha and other fantasy tales with a large, fun cast of characters.
 

Collectors of independent comic books and manga!
 

If you like your comics with shonen style fighting, fun shenanigans, and wholesome yuri, THIS IS YOUR BOOK! 

 

DIGITAL WALLPAPER EXAMPLES

If you want something added like a print, just let me know to add it at kitsuneonwheelz@foxyandwolfy.tokyo and I will do my best to make it happen!

 

Credits

story:
The Market Forces...they surround us, bind us, compel us...to print and release the STEAM WARS TPB, which collects issues 1 through 5 of the Steam Wars color series and is OFFERED FOR THE FIRST TIME AS A HARDCOVER EDITION. If you've supported our other Indiegogo project, thank you very much, and we hope you support this one. If you are new to Antarctic Press, we appreciate you taking the time to look over this new Indiegogo campaign.

You may already be familiar with Antarctic Press—in particular, our long-running Gold Digger series by Fred Perry.  However, Fred's creativity and storytelling ambition are far too great to be contained within a single series or genre.  Over the years, he has produced numerous other projects with Antarctic Press, all of them a delight to read.  Then, a few years back, in a production office not too far away...Fred decided to venture into the realm of steampunk.  The result was Steam Wars, in which Fred put his prodigious artistic talent to spinning a tale based on some his favorite SF/space opera epics. 

Not so long ago, in a galaxy relatively close by, an epic struggle began on a world seized in the grip of the tyrannical Hegemonic Crux. Only a ragged alliance of rebels oppose the Crux's leader, Lord Baron, and his black guard, but hope is fading. While fleeing from the steam-driven war machines of her imperial pursuers, Duchess Imoen stumbles across the home of the last Quantum Dragoon: the legendary storm foil warriors of ancient lore! This unique steam-fantasy epic will give you thrills that haven’t been felt since 1977!

Here is a preview of the first 16 pages of STEAM WARS which can be downloaded on any PDF capable device (approx 30 MB)

https://app.box.com/s/cba2acmlbv1dfkmermku56b6bpua66uq

This classic has never been produced in a hardcover format.  Plus we have new Add-ons including a coloring book, stickers and SOUNDTRACK. 

 

Add-ons

 

We appreciate that you are looking at our campaign. We have done multiple campaigns and have fulfilled them all to completion. Please enjoy a sampling of the

STEAM WARS SOUND TRACK by Patric Farrell of Built for the Future fame.

https://www.mediafire.com/folder/5qkls9kxl0g7u/STEAM+WARS

story:
Short Summary

I am a child of the 80’s. I grew up with some amazing TV and film, especially in the sci-fi and action genre. Movies like Total Recall, Blade Runner, Alien, Aliens and Terminator were on the top of my list. On the TV side, we had A-Team, Battlestar Galactica, and of course Miami Vice. Not to mention, some really great cartoons. Mars City Vice is inspired by a lot of great 80’s film and TV!  You will receive a digital version when you back a printed copy.

What's the Story of the Comic?

Mars circa 2089, humans live and play alongside various extraterrestrial races. Several planets in our solar system have been colonized for many years. The Moon has sprawling slums, while Mars has become a popular and exclusive theme park based on a super stylized version of 80's Miami - a synthetic world of cloned flamingos, neon and fast cars. Two unlikely police detectives, a human Maxwell 'Moony' Boone and his new alien partner Tykar 'Ty' Baths try and overcome their differences, as they work undercover in this fake 1980's Miami investigating a mysterious kingpin, who is threatening to corrupt the solar system with a new drug made from a rare alien blood

Recap of Issue #1 & #2

Issue #1: 'Wipe off that Grin'

Our story starts in the crime infested slums of Moon York, Moon York. We open on the alien detective Tykar 'Ty' Baths. He is working deep undercover on his own trying to find his missing sister Carena. She is being held against her will by the arch criminal Hadrian, who is making a drug created using the blood of Bath's and Carena's people (Maldakiens). Boone also starts out in Moon York as an undercover detective on the trail of Hadrian, but finds himself the target of his own fellow policeman.

Issue #2: 'I've Seen Your Face Before'

Boone is transferred to Mars City, currently themed like Miami in the 80's. He is prepped about all things 1980's and inserted into the amusement park city to be more actor than cop, which he hates. He soon learns that nothing is as it seems, and there is real crime in the fake city. He is partnered up with the stoic Baths by their hard-boiled Lt Vedanko and the two 80's obsessed alien twins. Baths and Boone butt heads at first, but come to realize they are both after the same arch criminal. Hadrian sends a hit squad led by an unstoppable killer, and there is of course - a big explosion. Does someone die?

We have two covers for issue #2 available. The Original Cover for #2 by IDW GI-Joe Alum Netho Diaz & James G. Brown. It's pretty awesome - isn't it?

And this 'Jim Steranko Homage' variant cover by Deivid Deon and colored by James G. Brown, which is also super rad. Collect them all!

A word from co-creator and writer Craig E. Sawyer

What We Need & What You Get

Just your life force! We kid, we kid. The first issue is completely finished. 50% of the second issue still needs to be colored and lettered - and that's where you comes in. Every dollar you back with will go to help the pro team bring this exciting story to life. We will then print Issue #2 and reprint of Issue #1, then get them into your comic book loving hands. *Note: The Deivid Deon variant(Jim Streranko homage cover) will be revealed early next week. It is awesome!

And if you're new to Vice - don't forget to catch up by backing Issue #1! This is where it all started! Cover by Deivid Deon and colored by James G. Brown.

The Impact

We take backers and their contributions very seriously, and this is not our first Indiegogo for Mars City Vice. We were very successful last time.  We finished the book on schedule and got the rewards out on time. We know what we are doing, so rest assured that Issue #2 will stay on course. And if for some unforeseen reason it cannot - you will be the first to know

Risks & Challenges

We live in an unsure world, as we have all experienced this past year. Things like printing, shipping delays sometimes happen, not often, but it is possible. We promise to work hard to fulfill on the promised dates, and we will be transparent about any hold-ups or issues that we come across.

Creative Team:

Writers & Creators

Craig E. Sawyer and Chris Webb are the 80's are the troubled minds behind Mars City Vice. Craig is not only a writer, but also owner of the successful board game company Sentient Cow Games and has written for comics, horror and sci-fi mags & TV/film ( “New comic book Adventures of The Rifleman”, Weirdbook, Monkey's Fighting Robots, Shotgun Honey crime fiction and the upcoming classic monster comic series - “The Forbidden Museum of Henry Harker”) Craig's Writer Site: https://craigsawyerwriter.wixsite.com/website-1

 

Chris has over twenty years of experience producing television commercials and interactive content for www.chriswebb.tv. Chris has successfully helmed a broad range of live action and CG animation productions featuring celebrities ranging from Dwyane Wade to Jerry Seinfeld. Chris came to producing via art school having attended both the Savannah College of Art and Design, and The Art Institute of Ft. Lauderdale.

Cover Artist's & Interiors:

Deivid Deon's action packed pencils are perfect for our sci-fi world of Mar's City Vice. He is also good at drawing weird aliens; which is great for us! Deivid is a fresh new talent on the professional scene having cut his teeth with indie publishers such as Top Secret press and Meraki. He has always killed deadlines with turning out strong pages on a daily basis.

Netho Diaz:

Netho has been rocking the comic world for a while now, as a penciler/inker and cover artist for DC's Aquaman, Valiant's Man-O-War, Dark Horse, and currently GI-Joe – A Real American Hero for IDW. Netho has taken over as the cover artist for Mars City Vice starting with issue #2 and will finish out this five issue arc.

Inker:

Sandro Ribeiro's debut happened at Marvel, where he inked some editions of the title Marvel Adventure The Avengers, then went to DC Comics and did work on Teen Titans, Action Comics, Justice League, Green lantern Blackest Night, Red Tornado, Final Crisis Aftermath and others. He has also worked in publishers such as Top Cow, Avatar, valiant and others

Colorist:

Colorist James Brown has spent 25 years in the comics industry. Deadlines met. No excuses. Always in communication with editors and creators. He has worked with such staples of the industry as IDW on their books Transformers and GI Joe A real American Hero. He has also worked with Marvel Comics on the titles Fantastic Four: A Death in the Family and Thunderbolts.

Letterer:

Ed Dukeshire is a Harvey-nominated letterer working in the biz since 2001. He has lettered comics from mainstream to creator-owned favorites including Hulk, Mighty Morphin Power Rangers, and Shadow Hawk for publishers like Marvel, Boom! Studios, Image and DC Comics.

Reviews:

Geek vibe Nations: https://geekvibesnation.com/review-skull-dust-p...

Monkeys Fighting Robots: https://monkeysfightingrobots.co/craig-sawyer-h...


Other Ways You Can Help

Do you want this to be wildly successful? then please spread the word on all of your social media platforms. Include the link to this Indiegogo page and talk to people at your local comic shop.

Issue #1: 'Wipe off that Grin'
Our story starts in the crime infested slums of Moon York, Moon York. We open on the alien detective Tykar 'Ty' Baths. He is working deep undercover on his own trying to find his missing sister Carena. She is being held against her will by the arch criminal Hadrian, who is making a drug created using the blood of Bath's and Carena's people (Maldakiens). Boone also starts out in Moon York as an undercover detective on the trail of Hadrian, but finds himself the target of his own fellow policeman.
Issue #2: 'I've Seen Your Face Before'
Boone is transferred to Mars City, currently themed like Miami in the 80's. He is prepped about all things 1980's and inserted into the amusement park city to be more actor than cop, which he hates. He soon learns that nothing is as it seems, and there is real crime in the fake city. He is partnered up with the stoic Baths by their hard-boiled Lt Vedanko and the two 80's obsessed alien twins. Baths and Boone butt heads at first, but come to realize they are both after the same arch criminal. Hadrian sends a hit squad led by an unstoppable killer, and there is of course - a big explosion. Does someone die?
We have two covers for issue #2 available. The Original Cover for #2 by IDW GI-Joe Alum Netho Diaz & James G. Brown. It's pretty awesome - isn't it?

And this 'Jim Steranko Homage' variant cover by Deivid Deon and colored by James G. Brown, which is also super rad. Collect them all!

A word from co-creator and writer Craig E. Sawyer

What We Need & What You Get
Just your life force! We kid, we kid. The first issue is completely finished. 50% of the second issue still needs to be colored and lettered - and that's where you comes in. Every dollar you back with will go to help the pro team bring this exciting story to life. We will then print Issue #2 and reprint of Issue #1, then get them into your comic book loving hands. *Note: The Deivid Deon variant(Jim Streranko homage cover) will be revealed early next week. It is awesome!


And if you're new to Vice - don't forget to catch up by backing Issue #1! This is where it all started! Cover by Deivid Deon and colored by James G. Brown.

The Impact
We take backers and their contributions very seriously, and this is not our first Indiegogo for Mars City Vice. We were very successful last time.  We finished the book on schedule and got the rewards out on time. We know what we are doing, so rest assured that Issue #2 will stay on course. And if for some unforeseen reason it cannot - you will be the first to know


Risks & ChallengesWe live in an unsure world, as we have all experienced this past year. Things like printing, shipping delays sometimes happen, not often, but it is possible. We promise to work hard to fulfill on the promised dates, and we will be transparent about any hold-ups or issues that we come across.

Creative Team:
Writers & Creators
Craig E. Sawyer and Chris Webb are the 80's are the troubled minds behind Mars City Vice. Craig is not only a writer, but also owner of the successful board game company Sentient Cow Games and has written for comics, horror and sci-fi mags & TV/film ( “New comic book Adventures of The Rifleman”, Weirdbook, Monkey's Fighting Robots, Shotgun Honey crime fiction and the upcoming classic monster comic series - “The Forbidden Museum of Henry Harker”) Craig's Writer Site: https://craigsawyerwriter.wixsite.com/website-1 Chris has over twenty years of experience producing television commercials and interactive content for www.chriswebb.tv. Chris has successfully helmed a broad range of live action and CG animation productions featuring celebrities ranging from Dwyane Wade to Jerry Seinfeld. Chris came to producing via art school having attended both the Savannah College of Art and Design, and The Art Institute of Ft. Lauderdale.
Cover Artist's & Interiors:
Deivid Deon's action packed pencils are perfect for our sci-fi world of Mar's City Vice. He is also good at drawing weird aliens; which is great for us! Deivid is a fresh new talent on the professional scene having cut his teeth with indie publishers such as Top Secret press and Meraki. He has always killed deadlines with turning out strong pages on a daily basis.
Netho Diaz:
Netho has been rocking the comic world for a while now, as a penciler/inker and cover artist for DC's Aquaman, Valiant's Man-O-War, Dark Horse, and currently GI-Joe – A Real American Hero for IDW. Netho has taken over as the cover artist for Mars City Vice starting with issue #2 and will finish out this five issue arc.
Inker:
Sandro Ribeiro's debut happened at Marvel, where he inked some editions of the title Marvel Adventure The Avengers, then went to DC Comics and did work on Teen Titans, Action Comics, Justice League, Green lantern Blackest Night, Red Tornado, Final Crisis Aftermath and others. He has also worked in publishers such as Top Cow, Avatar, valiant and others
Colorist:
Colorist James Brown has spent 25 years in the comics industry. Deadlines met. No excuses. Always in communication with editors and creators. He has worked with such staples of the industry as IDW on their books Transformers and GI Joe A real American Hero. He has also worked with Marvel Comics on the titles Fantastic Four: A Death in the Family and Thunderbolts.
Letterer:
Ed Dukeshire is a Harvey-nominated letterer working in the biz since 2001. He has lettered comics from mainstream to creator-owned favorites including Hulk, Mighty Morphin Power Rangers, and Shadow Hawk for publishers like Marvel, Boom! Studios, Image and DC Comics.

Reviews:
Geek vibe Nations: https://geekvibesnation.com/review-skull-dust-p...
Monkeys Fighting Robots: https://monkeysfightingrobots.co/craig-sawyer-h...
Other Ways You Can Help
Do you want this to be wildly successful? then please spread the word on all of your social media platforms. Include the link to this Indiegogo page and talk to people at your local comic shop.

story:
Super Harem will be at least 48 pages graphic novel filled with laughs and adventure! More content is possible with stretch goals!

HERE ARE THE NEW COLOR PAGES BY Farah Nurmaliza

THE SETTING

Apollo Beach is a popular resort town in the summer. There was a time that the small town even claimed it's own super hero, The Valkyrie! The Valkyrie once defended Apollo Beach against strange giant monsters. In winter now the tourists are all gone and they aren't all that is missing. Both The Valkyrie and the monsters she once battled have all disappeared.

Tim Boring is one of a handful of people who knows what happened to her. The Valkyrie's real name is Sofie Iceni and she was the love of his life. Sofie left Tim upon learning that it was The Valkyrie's powers themselves that had summoned the monsters she fought.

THE CONFLICT

At a drunken party Tim meets Journeigh Weathers. Journeigh is a free spirited and somewhat selfish young woman who gladly takes on the mantle of The Valkyrie. Journeigh thinks fighting giant monsters would be fun and isn't concerned with the safety of those around her. Now he's stuck with a crazy woman who is willing to put all of Apollo Beach in danger for her own entertainment!

 


This is a high quality, HIGH production value book. The initial goal will only pay for the beautiful pen and inks by artist Joe Ball and the print run! We have a lot more stuff we want to do but right now, all I'm asking for the bare minimum. You can't get this level of quality from the big two anymore. It is only available from crowdfunded books like this!
 

SUPER HAREM IS SET TO ROCK YOUR SOCKS

 

Sexy pin up by Karl O'Rowe

Ashcan with original art by Matt Wenger

 

I already drew 75% of this book myself but realized the concept needed something bigger. I handed the pages I made over to Joe and he has been having a BLAST making them his own.

story:
Wassup wassup, Peeps!?!

Welcome to the campaign for Hunting Alice!

The 48 Page Perfect Bound B&W Graphic Novel by Auby Anne Meletio & Anthony Romano, published under DarkGift Comics!! (All Physical Perks signed by Anthony)

COVER A - Anthony Romano

Colors by Matt Crotts

The Story!

Agent Verily Wingate must turn to her former mentor-turned-serial-killer, Fauste (previously thought dead) to help stop a mysterious new serial killer. While hunting him down, she starts to realize she may be the hunted.

What is this connection she shares with these two madmen?

But that's not the only mystery Verily will uncover. This journey will take her down a psychological roller coaster through the dream world, other realities, and past lives. Which is the real "her"? Are any? Are they all?

And who is the mysterious organization known only as The Jabberwocky?

VIC KING VARIANT COVER

Colors by Billy Bacsko 

 

Interior Art Page Samples

 

 

 

Added Bonus!

Free Agent Verily Wingate Trading Card for all Physical Backers!!

 

Also Available!!

A 12 page 5.5" x 8.5" ashcan for our secondary character, Roulette, totally done in Grayscale/Red Spot-Color.

JASON BASCOM COVER

 

The Story

Trauma victim therapist, Dr Devereaux “Red” Roulét takes matters into her own hands when the perpetrators of her patients evade justice. Confiding in her bartender friend, Sal Marini, she takes to the streets of Atlantic City, NJ at night dishing out her brand of savage justice in the name of those that justice has failed.

But is there more to Roulette, than meets the eye? 

 

Interior Art Page Samples

 

 

Also Available!

Cover A Blacklight Wall Tapestry (24" x 36")

 

Cover B Blacklight Wall Tapestry (24" x 36")

 

 

Roulette page 1 Original Art!

 

Anthony Romano Original Hunting Alice Cover A Art!

AND

Vic King Original Hunting Alice Roulette/Verily Team-Up Cover B Art

STRETCH GOALS:

@ $3,000 - Set of Jason Bascom &  Dan "Boob Dan" Plegel Roulette Prints (5.5" x 8.5")

@ $5,000 - Trading Card #3 Unlocked: Fauste!

@ $6,000 - Double Sided Bookmark!

@ $7,000 - Trading Card #4 Unlocked!

@ $8.000 - Print #3 Unlocked!

@ $20,000 - Books Signed by Both Anthony & Auby!

More To Be Announced Soon!

 

HOW WAS HUNTING ALICE CREATED?

Originally conceived as a television script by writer Auby Anne Meletio, and faced with many setbacks, the script sat in limbo. Meeting artist Anthony Romano under unusual circumstances, the two became fast friends. Anthony being a part of an online community of independent comic creators and fans, they birthed the idea of transcribing the script from one medium to another, breathing new life into an incredible story meant to be seen by the world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please consider donating, and definitely share the campaign amongst your friends and family, as well as your social media.

story:
The Captain likes to punch and fight!  "If you ain't 'natural', consider yourself forewarned." 

 

What is Island 19 A Tale of the Bermuda Triangle?

The story (90-100 pages), is based on the true events surrounding the 1945 disappearance of NAS Flight 19 over the Bermuda Triangle.

You'll follow the exploits of the mission commander of Flight 19, Captain Pete "Crash" Keddel as he may or may not become the inspiration for the classic fictional forever kid-- Peter Pan!

Never-Land was never like this! Nazis, Pirates, Native Tribes and an ancient battle between good and evil set the scene for Captain Keddel and his new friends as they look to uncover the mysteries of Island 19.  Please check out the preview below:

 

..................................................................................................................................................................

If you like The Venture Brothers, Raiders of the Lost Ark, Tales to Astonish, Captain America,  Dr. Strange, Land of the Lost, Peter Pan, classic literature and big epic sagas, this is for you!  There might even be some familiar faces, and when you think you know what it is...you're probably wrong. 

Preview:

OK, so the Captain get's younger, apparently there are some lost boys on the way...the natives are all kids, What's the deal? Is this Neverland?  Nazis? A magic pond? An Angel? (No, this is not a religious story).   You'll see what all this is about...

...but there's even so much more to unpack! 

You'll Meet the villains and  learn their dark plan! A rogue group of Nazis with the ability to access the magical island via their submarine...they seek the mystical powers of the island to create their  army of Detestables to enact their ambitions of overthrowing the U.S. mainland!

 

You'll also learn about the secrets the island collects from throughout history!  The island seems to act as a depository for lost items (sometimes of great power) and lost people from throughout history/time!

And just what kind of power do the Native Americans hold?  What are they doing on the island to begin with! And again, what's up with the angel!?!  

What is the Flying Eagle? Is it something good? Something bad? 

Find out all the answers to these questions when you back Island 19: A Tale of the Bermuda Triangle!  

One last thing: Adolf Hitler is here too! (at least in some form or another). 

People always tell me: "Drew your art looks like a cute little Golden Book style!" I say: "Wait til' you see Island 19...Your Little Golden Books were never like this!"

 

 

 

 

What's In It For You? Product List: All artwork for products below are subject to change, based on suppliers/vendors ability to meet demands (We're very demanding)  and better ideas and greater art that is to come! Shipping cost will be added to all orders.

Below is the 11"x17" image for the Pin Up poster art of Louise "La La" LaRue!

God Bless America!

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Your backing would fund the development of the graphic novel to completion.  Currently, about one third of the artwork is complete, meaning pencils, color and text is finished.  

  • Island 19: A Tale of the Bermuda Triangle (90-100) page full color hard copy graphic novel, at the traditional comic book size is the base product.

All Products: According to which perk you order you can get all items below.

  • Island 19: ATOTBT  hard copy graphic novel  signed by Drew Krevi
  • Island 19: ATOTBT  variant "spoiler" cover signed by Drew Krevi
  • Island 19: ATOTB  PDF Digital Download
  • 'Lightning Cats' Military Aviator Patch (just like Capt. Keddel has on his canteen)
  • 11"x17" Fold-out poster of original cover signed by Drew Krevi
  • Stickers! 3-6 unique die cut (shaped) stickers featuring heroes, creatures and locales
  • Bookmark: Featuring the island itself!
  • 11"x17" Limited number of prints Fold-out poster featuring WWII nose cone art of 
  • Louise "La La" LaRou!
  • Art Supplemental of concept art and character descriptions to be added to end of book (6 to 10 pages)

 

PURCHASE STRETCH GOALS:

Everyone gets:

$10,000.00......Bookmarks 

$12,000.00......Upgrade to add "Art Supplemental Images" pages at end of physical books. Images will feature concept art and character breakdowns.

$15,000.00......Lightning Cats patch 

$20,000.00......2 Stickers (6 with EXTRAS)

$25,000.00......Keychain 'Red Feather' (Keychain 'Canteen" with EXTRAS)

$30,000.00......1 Postcard Mini-Poster  (2 More Postcard Mini Posters with EXTRAS)

$40,000.00......3 Trading Cards (Whole Pack of 12 Trading Cards with EXTRAS) 

$45,000.00......11"x17" Fold-out Poster of Cover, signed by Drew. (2 More Posters with EXTRAS)

$200 Million......We start work on animated movie. 

$6.5 Billion......We start work on Island 19  theme park.

Perhaps, if we go past the $45,000.00 mark then maybe we could look into PVC toys. Probably to be offered through In Demand.

 

What's a Drew Krevi?

Drew's a longtime video game animator and concept artist who's worked on many titles you've probably played including titles for Marvel Comics, DC Comics, Warner Bros. Looney Toons, MLB, NHL, NFL, NCAA sports games for platforms like PlayStation, XBOX, Wii and Sega!

Freelance clients for Drew include Disney product illustration and  development for Bob Olszewski Studios for products to be sold exclusively at Disney theme-parks.

He's also been hired as a freelancer for concept art for theme parks, board games, character design , as well as illustrating six published children's picture books and most recently penciling and inking for educational comic books.

 

..........................................SEMI-SPOILER IMAGES BELOW..............................................

 

Remember, that these are "semi-spoiler" images because the story is so big, that these revelations will actually seem smaller once the story unfolds.  Also, we will add art updates here or at Drew's website as production on the graphic novel moves forward.  If you back us, check back often!! 

 

 Captain Keddel and Lily discuss the meaning of the Flying Eagle.

 

Apparently, Hitler was not loved by those who served him before the fall of the Third Reich. In search of a new body for his disembodied head Adolph gets into some goofy shenanigans.

Plenty of punching...the Captain likes to punch.

 

Some early character explorations...bottom right is the final design for Louise....she doesn't start out looking this way.  Top left is Doc Russell.

The Captain and Louise discover a pirates' ship...but are they friends or foes?

Why support this project?  

If you like character driven stories with plenty of action and some high strangeness then this is for you.  Also, we would like to see more comics/graphic novels like this get made...we love reading them too!  Though, this story definitely has a beginning, middle and ending,  there are real legs here for more stories on the mysterious Island 19!

Thank you for checking us out and considering backing Island 19: ATOTBT!

 

Risks & Challenges

Obviously there are always risks in undergoing a long project like developing a graphic novel. Certainly, the global pandemic could create slow-downs, and even though I have about a third of the final artwork finished, I have left some extra time before delivery of books and goodies for that. 

Also, as a 25+ year professional artist, I hit my deadlines!  Meaning as a freelancer, if I don't finish on time, I don't get paid. This anxiety tends to sharpen the mind. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't back us at the moment no worries!  Please let your social media pals know where you saw us. Thanks!

story:
A Tale Spanning the First Ages of Time and Space   

At the beginning of the universe, a world forms at its centre and life springs forth upon it. The world becomes known as Ines. The divine Dragi are the first advanced race to appear and in their divinity create two races, each containing different parts of themselves. The Homin and Orested. An age of peace ensues.

Not all is right in this world, however At its centre lies a dark heart. A creature of unimaginable terror emerges from this dark heart and bursts forth upon the surface. It brings forth a plague that mutates the bodies of the dead and creates monsters which spread out with one mission: KILL ALL LIFE. 

The peoples of the world, the Homin and Orested, band together with their creators, the Dragi, to fight back the monsters and defeat the terror. Ultimately the Dragi devise a way to defeat the evil creature at the cost of their lives. 

Peace returns to the world and time winds forward through history until the Age of the Angelous, the new ruling race of the planet. A hybrid of the Homin and Orested, they inherit the power the Dragi once processed. 

They raise an island nation into the skies as a testament to their power. From this land, rule over the remaining Homin and Orested just as their Dragi creators once did. 

The evil was not fully defeated and it now returns in a diminished, but no less dangerous form. After several lost battles against this new foe, the Angelous retreat to their flying cities and abandon the surface dwellers, betraying their role as protector in the most heinous of ways.

 A secret group forms within the Angelous military bent on helping the surface and ridding the world of this ancient evil. This elite group of deeply spiritual and moral warriors is lead by the great High Judicar Phasenion. His young, head strong,  but loyal student Onixia is tasked with the burden of finding the one thing that can save the world after a terrible tragedy.  As the events unfold, Onixia must complete this task or all life in the world shall perish.

“Of Time and Space” is a callback to the sci-fi and fantasy tales I was influenced by as a child, with some inspiration from religion and myths.

The Lunar Rise is the first Chapter of the 5 chapter spanning saga that is Of Time and Space. There are 5 Chapters mapped out for the whole story that follow a linear progression over thousands of years on the planet Ines.

By helping to fund this you are helping to fund many more stories to come in this saga. 

 

What You Are Funding and What You Get

Your funding is very important to the completion of this book in a timely manner. The script, design and basic layout are all complete. The funding will cover the remaining sequential art for the book, 14 of the 48 pages are complete at this time. With your support, I can order the rest of the pages from Rob Cannon all at once. Once funded, we plan to ship in December of 2019. 

There are great perks available, besides the book itself, every copy will be signed by me, Larry Holder, on the inside cover.

 

 

Besides the regular full wrap cover there will also a second full wrap variant available, in limited quantity,  featuring the two concept posters by Andre Boulard and Daswhox. These copies also come signed of course.

 

I also have a set of metal prints available featuring both the cover art and a selected image from Page 21 of the book. These are actually images transferred directly onto a sheet of aluminum. These will be available in super limited quantity due to high production cost.

 

A copy of the book is also available with a high quality poster print. This poster perk is available in either 8x10 or 11x14 and features the cover art by Rob Cannon. They are printed on Photo Metallic Cotton Rag paper for a really sharp look and glow that goes beyond a typical photo print. These poster tiers are available in limited quantity as well.

Here's a video sample of the paper used pre printing, notice the silver glow and thickness of the paper.

https://youtu.be/a69KypQekJE

There is also a mug tier that includes a 11oz Ceramic White Mug with the Rob Cannon Cover. The image below is a sample but does not have the image that will appear on the final mug.

 

Finally there is the “First Tale of the Universe: Making Of Time and Space” tier which includes the 40 page book about the conception of the project and goes through all the levels of design up to the sequential art.

 

Unlock-able Goals

$8000 - Full colour pages, with your help making this goal we can offer even more beautiful pages like this.

 

$10,000 - Print insert and 3 trading cards

$12,000 - Square Bound book 

 

How This Project Will Impact Me and You

By backing this project you will be funding the start of many more stories to come. This is but a mere drop in the pond of the grand story I wish to tell. Though it won't revolutionize storytelling or the medium of comics, it will be a thoughtful tale aimed at capturing the glory and feel of the classic Sci-Fi and Fantasy stories. By backing this you will insure the completion, of what very well may be my life's work, and allow me to bring that story to a wider audience. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge faced by this book is raising enough to finish the artwork and pay for the printing and shipping. Rob is a very talented man that deserves paid for every hour he works and I plan on doing that to see this book to print. It is a huge financial risk to myself seeing that I'm not wealthy but with the help of the backers that can be remedied. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, you can still help by sharing this page online and getting the word out to friends and family that may enjoy this type of story. Every little bit helps and word of mouth goes a long way. Thank you.

story:
WELCOME, DARLING,

TO ELVIRA'S CLASSIC ADVENTURES

Turn back the clock to 1993...Bill Clinton was President, the Blue Jays won the World Series, and Jurassic Park ruled the box office.  A young horror host (why barely out of puberty I believe) named Elvira ruled late night television and became the Queen of Halloween.  An independent comic book company began working with the Mistress of the Dark delivering some brilliantly funny and frisky comic stories.  Creators from every corner of the industry contributed to her growing lore with stories and art celebrating the "sassy lassie with the classy chassis" including comic legends like Kurt Busiek, Paul Dini, Neil Vokes, Fred Hembeck, Dave Cockrum, and a host of others!  

It's the 13th today - the "luckiest" day of the month and now the fiends at Dynamite are digging up the grave of these lost adventures and delivering them to Elvira's fans with a beautiful custom Elvira Mistress of the Dark "The Classic Comic Collection" Omnibus!  This awesome tome of darkness is packed with Elvira awesomeness and is available in both a deluxe hardcover and an ultimate darkness edition signed by yours cruelly, Elvira Mistress of the Dark!

The Elvira Mistress of the Dark Classic Years Omnibus is the first volume kicking off reprinting the highly sought-after tales originally published by Claypool Comics. In these beloved adventures Elvira must contend with teen werewolves, killer clowns, aliens, a high school reunion, pro wrestling, and more! Plus, special Halloween, Christmas, and Easter stories. The book is available in paperback or hardcover and covers 26 issues, rounding out to a massive 600-page tome. And for a special surprise Dynamite is sneaking in extra bonuses amounting to .666 of an issue. That's right gals and ghouls, 26.666 comics in one massive book! Spooky!

 

DIG UP A SCARCE SPECIAL EDITION COMIC!

Does your face light up when you have that rare comic book in your collection much to the dismay of your rivals? Well don't dally, darling. This is your chance to get one of those impossible to find special editions. The Elvira Mistress of the Dark The Classic Years #1 is an extremely limited printing of the original Elvira comic book from 1993 featuring a special photo cover of yours cruelly. It available here for a limited time...

A bountiful bevy of talented creators contributed to these adventures. Known for his love of the macabre and the flirty, Paul Dini of Batman fame lent his hand. While this first volume also compiles the majority of the plentiful pages written by Kurt Busiek (Avengers, Astro City). Claypool head honcho Richard Howell (Vision & the Scarlet Witch) and Frank Strom also contributed writing. While on the art side, Tom Simonton is beloved by Elvira fans for his early contributions to the series, as well as John Heebink. X-Men fans will thrill to the lines of Dave Cockrum on stories, and Dynamite's Vampirella fans will love to see Louis LaChance. Other stars inside include Dan Spiegle, Fred Hembeck, and Neil Vokes.

 

 

A GHOSTLY SECOND CHANCE

And if that isn't enough to get your ghoul, we are thrilled to offer Elvira's fans that might have missed her successful Kickstarter project for "Elvira The Omega Ma'am" comic book a rare second chance to get the limited-edition comics. We only have a few left of these, so they are first come first serve to those that need to add the rare comic to your collections!

story:
WHO IS THE KILLING THE GODS?

FALLEN IS BACK!

The FALLEN series is back with it's 3rd issue in a 6 part series. Each issue is 22 pages, full colour and printed on standard American sized comic format on high quality paper.  FALLEN blends the genres of mystery and fantasy by creating a thrilling mythological noir story for mature readers. The story takes place in the vibrant, synth-pop filled era of the 1980's in the loud, crowded streets of New York City.

FALLEN 3 continues along as Casper Clay hunts for clues on who killed his boss Zeus. As he starts to pull on the threads woven throughout the criminal underworld of gods, more questions begin to pop up. As he gets closer to the truth, invisible walls begin to close in on him and if he's not careful he could be next.

Issue 3 Cover

 

Are you ready for FALLEN?

If you backed the first 2 issues you will really enjoy this one but if you're just getting on board now and you like any of these things, you're going to love FALLEN;

80's Pop Culture - FALLEN is inspired by and infused with a lot of the 80's classics from music,  movies and style.

Mythology - Doesn't matter if you're a fan of Greek, Norse or any other mythology, FALLEN is going to touch on it all.

Crime Thriller - If you're intrigued by stories of crime, murder and mystery. It's like a mash up of John Wick, Constantine and Clash of the Titans.

FALLEN is inspired by neo-noir stories like Blade Runner, Blade Runner 2049 and fantasy stories like Fables and The Wolf Among Us.

Issue 1 Cover

Issue 2 Cover

Issue 1 Page 1

Issue 1 Page 2

Issue 1 Page 3

Issue 2 Page 1

Issue 2 Page 2

Issue 2 Page 3

Issue 2 Page 7

Issue 3 Page 1 Line Art

Issue 3 Page 2 Line Art

Issue 3 Page 3 Line Art

 

Here's a list of things up for grabs!

  • Digital copies of all 3 issues, can be added on
  • Physical copies of all 3 issues, can be added on
  • An exclusive FALLEN album by F-Stop The Visionary that features 5 synthwave/ambient/trip-hop tracks to add to the FALLEN vibe!
  • Also for the first time add-ons are available! By popular demand, the psychedelic pop art print from FALLEN #2 campaign is available again to add on to any physical tier!

 

Matt:  Writer of FALLEN. Matt has been working on the concept for the story for over 2 years. Matt has also written the 3 part stories Veiled for the Speed of Light sci-fi anthology published by Evoluzione. When Matt isn't writing he's gaming, playing D&D or watching 80's movies for some nostalgic inspiration. To stay up to date on what else Matt is up to sign up to the mailing list at badbeavercomics.com.

Henry: Henry is a talented and professional artist based out of the Philippines. He is a published Graphic Novel Artist on books like Children's Vampire Hunting Brigade volume 1&2, Alterna Comics Tinsel Town, The Devil Within, Seven Legions and various contributions on anthologies. To see more of his work visit:  https://www.artstation.com/henryponciano

Toben:  Toben Racicot writes and letters comics. He’s worked on Beastlands, The Wild Cosmos, Thorn Squadron, Menagerie, and Rumble Kings. Together with his wife, Alaire Racicot they created Crown & Anchor, the fantasy sci-fi pirate adventure. He also runs multiple Dungeons & Dragons campaigns and continues the hunt in Bloodborne, and is taking parenting lessons from Kratos as he plays God of War (2018). He’s also working on a PhD in Role Playing Games and Adaptation Theory at the University of Waterloo. To see more of his work visit: artstation.com/letterdrone

 

What are people saying about FALLEN?

FALLEN #1

"FALLEN provides a new spin on an old tale and does it by infusing the story with dirt, grime, and some godly magic. FALLEN is a must-read for lovers of mythology, crime dramas, or well-constructed comics." -  Monkeys Fighting Robots

FALLEN #2

"A multi-dimensional story arc that begs interest from the reader." - Soda and Telepaths

 

Timeline

Here is the projected timeline for the project;

Artwork completed: July - August 2021

Book manufacturing and freight: August 2021

Shipping of rewards: August-September 2021

story:
THE COMPANY MEN: DEAD, WHITE AND BLUE adds the action of SUICIDE SQUAD to the intrigue of HOMELAND and the shades of grey of BODY OF LIES.  Think STRIKEBACK with superpowers.

This 60-page full-colour book is loaded with action and conspiracy. It's the first issue in a three-issue story, totalling 180 pages. The language, violence and concepts are aimed at an adult audience, with a story that is layered and complex.

This campaign is funding the printing and delivery of the first issue of the first story arc, titled DEAD, WHITE AND BLUE.

60 pages of traditionally inked, action-packed art has been scanned and collated, ready for the next step. You can back with confidence! The book is almost complete, with only a small percentage of the colours and letters to go. This work is already budgeted for and is NOT relying on this campaign for finance! THE COMPANY MEN WILL BE PUBLISHED NO MATTER WHAT!

In a world where being superhuman is illegal, they are America's dirty little secret. A CIA funded prevention and response unit on paper, but in reality, a superhuman hit squad protecting the nation's interests in the Middle East. 

When they receive information that a terrorist attack is imminent, one that will affect even the United States, they follow every lead in a desperate race against the clock to stop it. At every turn, they are betrayed and attacked, by enemy and ally alike, until a final showdown tests their loyalty to their country, their job and each other.

Watch the video to learn more about the characters that make up THE COMPANY MEN!
 

 

 

 is a 60 page, full-colour comicbook with art by Celso Mazine and story by The Man Called Kemosabe, Lee Byron Carver! This campaign allows you to purchase additional items to accompany your comic.

 

The comic, digital and protection free. Don't pirate me, bro!

 

It's the comic, with an amazing variant cover by superstar artist Clayton Barton (Replicator, KOZOR) and colours by his brother, Korey Barton! It also comes chock full of extras, such as character profiles, script pages, breakdowns, concept sketches, costume design and sneak peeks into future COMPANY MEN projects! Available on its own or as part of the Three-Pack!


 

For those brave few who signed up to the mailing list, their reward is access to the comic with the Renzo Rodriguez (Splatto Comics, Thomas Valiant, Impossible Stars) cover! The only way to get this cover is to have signed up for the pre-launch campaign, or in the Three-Pack!

 

A physical, traditionally drawn pen and ink page of art from THE COMPANY MEN: DEAD, WHITE AND BLUE by Brazillian superstar artist Celso Mazine! Shipped worldwide! Limited to 20 pieces!

Example shown, Page 3 of THE COMPANY MEN: DEAD, WHITE AND BLUE Issue #1

 

The original, traditionally drawn ink and paper art for the cover of THE COMPANY MEN: DEAD, WHITE AND BLUE! One of a kind! Shipped worldwide!

 

This add-on perk includes an original sketch by Brazillian superstar artist, Celso Mazine! Request your character of choice, be it an established hero or villain, or an original character of your own design, and Celso will draw a one of a kind sketch just for you! This perk is limited to 10 pieces!

 

To mitigate risk I have ensured all line art has been 100% completed and colouring/letters have been budgeted for regardless of the performance of this campaign. No matter what happens during the campaign THIS BOOK WILL BE MADE!

  • Naturally, I want to do right by the people who take a chance on me. To ensure shipping costs are as low as possible and screw-ups are minimised, I am using a fulfilment service to get your books to you. 
  • Books will be shipped bagged and boarded in Gemini mailers! We want to ensure your new comic reaches you in the best condition possible!
  • With art complete and colours and letters budgeted for already, there should be a quick turn around time on this title! No year-long waits from BLACKPRYOR PRESS! In fact, while the Issue #1 campaign is live and funding, Brazillian Superstar artist Celso Mazine will already be hard at work on THE COMPANY MEN: DEAD, WHITE AND BLUE Issue #2! Again, this work is budgeted for separate to the outcome of this campaign!

 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please help to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! Remember: the better the campaign does, the more kit you guys get, and the bigger and brighter we can make THE COMPANY MEN, BLACKPRYOR PRESS  and all future titles!
