THE COMPANY MEN WILL BE PUBLISHED NO MATTER WHAT!




In a world where being superhuman is illegal, they are America's dirty little secret. A CIA funded prevention and response unit on paper, but in reality, a superhuman hit squad protecting the nation's interests in the Middle East. 
When they receive information that a terrorist attack is imminent, one that will affect even the United States, they follow every lead in a desperate race against the clock to stop it. At every turn, they are betrayed and attacked, by enemy and ally alike, until a final showdown tests their loyalty to their country, their job and each other.

Watch the video to learn more about the characters that make up THE COMPANY MEN!


 



 

 
 is a 60 page, full-colour comicbook with art by Celso Mazine and story by The Man Called Kemosabe, Lee Byron Carver! This campaign allows you to purchase additional items to accompany your comic.

 

The comic, digital and protection free. Don't pirate me, bro!

 
It's the comic, with an amazing variant cover by superstar artist Clayton Barton (Replicator, KOZOR) and colours by his brother, Korey Barton! It also comes chock full of extras, such as character profiles, script pages, breakdowns, concept sketches, costume design and sneak peeks into future COMPANY MEN projects! Available on its own or as part of the Three-Pack!

 
For those brave few who signed up to the mailing list, their reward is access to the comic with the Renzo Rodriguez (Splatto Comics, Thomas Valiant, Impossible Stars) cover! The only way to get this cover is to have signed up for the pre-launch campaign, or in the Three-Pack!

 

A physical, traditionally drawn pen and ink page of art from THE COMPANY MEN: DEAD, WHITE AND BLUE by Brazillian superstar artist Celso Mazine! Shipped worldwide! Limited to 20 pieces!

Example shown, Page 3 of THE COMPANY MEN: DEAD, WHITE AND BLUE Issue #1
 

The original, traditionally drawn ink and paper art for the cover of THE COMPANY MEN: DEAD, WHITE AND BLUE! One of a kind! Shipped worldwide!

 

This add-on perk includes an original sketch by Brazillian superstar artist, Celso Mazine! Request your character of choice, be it an established hero or villain, or an original character of your own design, and Celso will draw a one of a kind sketch just for you! This perk is limited to 10 pieces!

 


To mitigate risk I have ensured all line art has been 100% completed and colouring/letters have been budgeted for regardless of the performance of this campaign. No matter what happens during the campaign THIS BOOK WILL BE MADE!

Naturally, I want to do right by the people who take a chance on me. To ensure shipping costs are as low as possible and screw-ups are minimised, I am using a fulfilment service to get your books to you. 
Books will be shipped bagged and boarded in Gemini mailers! We want to ensure your new comic reaches you in the best condition possible!
With art complete and colours and letters budgeted for already, there should be a quick turn around time on this title! No year-long waits from BLACKPRYOR PRESS! In fact, while the Issue #1 campaign is live and funding, Brazillian Superstar artist Celso Mazine will already be hard at work on THE COMPANY MEN: DEAD, WHITE AND BLUE Issue #2! Again, this work is budgeted for separate to the outcome of this campaign!

 


Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please help to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
Use the Indiegogo share tools! Remember: the better the campaign does, the more kit you guys get, and the bigger and brighter we can make THE COMPANY MEN, BLACKPRYOR PRESS  and all future titles!

story:
253% Funded, 300 Backers, 10 Stretch Goals unlocked!

UNLOCK MORE PREORDERING HERE ON INDIEGOGO!

Click here for a 25 pages english preview.

Clicca qui per un'anteprima di 25 pagine.

 

Out of the box is the first issue of an anthologic magazine which includes 5 different stories, from 9 different authors, with a particular care about the writing.

We have all been influenced by the greatest writers and artists of all time and space, and Out of the box is our effort to express our thoughts and hearts about the art of comics.

Out of the box è il primo numero di una rivista antologica che include 5 diverse storie, di 9 diversi autori, con una cura particolare rivolta alla scrittura.

Siamo tutti stati influenzati dai più grandi scrittori e artisti del tempo e dello spazio, e Out of the box è il nostro sforzo per esprimere i nostri pensieri e le nostre emozioni riguardo l'arte del fumetto.

 

This happens because that half step away from ourselves and our world is necessary, to focus on who we really are and which are the correct questions we have to ask.

 

So, here's a spy story about maternity on a cosmic level, a road trip driven by a pair of Mongol shamans, a horror western where humanity will put their hands in the occult forces of Creation, a post-apocalyptic sci-fi which will investigate the misteries of memory and Nature, while looking for presumed treasures – physical or meta–physical. Like in the last story, where a Master of Theosophy will persuade Nikola Tesla to bring him into space, on a spaceship designed by Alfons Mucha.

A LEGENDARY artist could come out of our box, if you'll help us!

Kent Williams is a greatly esteemed painter who worked - among others - for DC (Hellblazer, Batman, Sandman, The Fountain...) and Marvel (Avengers, X-Men, Hellraiser...)

Kent will lend us his art for a variant cover if we hit our FINAL STRETCH GOAL!

You could also make his original sketches yours!!!

One of the most popular webcomic since 2012, Chris McCoy's creation is famous for its cute characters and its friendly and adorable humor.

A Japanese artist, Keigo has quickly become worldly popular thanks to his surreal, mind-bending and tremendously hilarious strips and illustrations.

DAW, EKRA and Massimiliano Favazza are three italian artists with different styles but one thing in common: a hugely funny and  twisted mind! :D

Their works are already unlocked and will be included in every Out of the box copy!

 

1890, American frontier. The natives’ Ghost Dance should have been a peaceful movement, a way to drive out the white invaders using dances and choral ceremonies. But after the resentment for the Wounded Knee Massacre takes over, the rites open actual rifts in the tissue of reality. Supernatural energies and monstrosities pour into the frontier, transforming a large part of America in a lethal no-man’s land. For the settlers the winning of the West, near to its end, has to restart from scratch. Meanwhile, half a world away, a coven of oriental magicians are studying this catastrophe with extreme interest…

Ten years later Castor, an old but still deadly gunslinger, roams the frontier’s desolate lands to tie up his last loose ends.

Two mysterious twins follow in secret his quest. They want to hire a group of desperados for an impossibile mission: reach China’s Forbidden City to kill a god.

Discover more!

 

The year is 1211. The Mongol empire, after their win of west Xia, moves towards the subjugation of Jin dynasty. The name of Gengis Khan is already pronounced with terror by his enemies, and with ardour by his allies. Mongol population begins to consider him a divinity, and for that, countless warriors and entire tribes start to gather under his banner.     Among them, there are the old shaman Oyun and his young apprentice, Saikhan. During their long journey, they will go in search of themselves and the nature of their people, forging unbreakable bonds in the vastness of the steppe.

Discover more!

 

On one of the many mechanical planets who host what is left of humanity after the “Upheaval”, lives Tempura, a collector of treasures, a thief without dignity but with an immense culture, with the mission of finding and selling on the black market ancient artifacts of memories wrapped in legend.

Hired by John Allegro – a famous adventurer and treasure hunter who, since 1962, has dedicated his existence to the search for the treasures of the Copper Roll, an ancient Palestinian scroll that tells of infinite riches in sixty-four places in Palestine – decides to leave for a new adventure.

But the treasures are not what he really believes, and contain a secret linked to the memory of the Earth, capable of spiritually conditioning not only the intricate mechanisms that keep a planet afloat, but also the past of each Earthman.

A secret that has the face of a mysterious little girl.

Discover more!

 

While on a mission in a mysterious structure, special agent Dana gets exposed to a gas of unknown origin. While at first it doesn’t seems to have side effects, Dana later discovers to be pregnant.

During the ninth months of pregnancy – while Dana will have to adapt herself and discover a maternity and a femininity which she never thought would fit her – her son will manifest incredible psychic powers, in fact creating a dual being who is the perfect special agent, essential to defeat the evil organization which created this and other experiments, even more unsettling.

Discover more!

 

Between 19th and 20th century, an old Master failed his Mission and went into exile on a secret island in the Bermuda triangle, to find a way to redeem himself.

In meditation, he receives a vision: the Treasure of Treasures, the ultimate secret of existence. Unfortunately, its location is in outer space.

With an improbable crew composed of vikings, ancient romans, mongol warriors, astronauts, aliens and Amelia Earhart, he will recruit the only scientist who could actually build a spaceship in those years: Nikola Tesla.

A measured-rythmically voyage where reflection and introspection will have the last word on everything.

Discover more!

 

 

Press release

  • Read the articles that site like Super Serious Comics, Comicsblog.fr and Comics Scene UK wrote about us!
     
  • Leggi gli articoli e guarda le interviste dal vivo rilasciate a siti come Lo spazio bianco, It.Comics, Gli Audaci, Just Nerd, Nerdream, Comix Island e altri!

 

 

Social Stretch Goals are all already unlocked and will be part of any digital or physical copy of Out of the box!

The final Social Goal is a complete, original card game, designed by Francis Green (a published game designer), in which you can create your own stories with the characters of Out of the box comics!

But continue following on our socials and sharing our stuff!

IF YOU LIKE THIS PROJECT, HELP US SPREAD THE WORD!

We are on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Youtube. We have a Facebook Group and a official site.

I Social Stretch Goal sono stati già tutti sbloccati e saranno parte di ogni copia digitale o fisica di Out of the box!

Il Social Goal finale è un gioco di carte originale e completo, ideato da Francis Green (un autore di giochi da tavolo già edito), nel quale potrete creare le vostre personali storie con i personaggi dei fumetti di Out of the box!

Ma continuate comunque a seguirci sui social e a condividere la nostra roba!

SE QUESTO PROGETTO TI PIACE, AIUTACI A SPARGERE LA VOCE!

Siamo su Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Youtube. Abbiamo un Gruppo Facebook e un sito ufficiale.

 

 

Would you like a treat? You can add whatever Add-On you want when you are selecting your pledge!

Art not final!

Only few slots left for each artist! First come, first served!

 

We plan a total of 10 issues for Out of the box. Each issue will contain a chapter of each of the five stories. Therefore, at issue 10, we will have five stories of about 200 pages each.

We know this is ambitious, and this is exactly why we are on IndieGOGO: because we cannot make it without you. :)

If you can reach all the Stretch Goals we have prepared for you, everything we collect in excess will go directly into the production of the second issue. With your help, we would like to be able to publish 2 issues per year.

Abbiamo pianificato un totale di 10 numeri per Out of the box. Ogni numero conterrà un capitolo di ognuna delle cinque storie. Pertanto, al numero 10, avremo cinque storie di circa 200 pagine ognuna.

Sappiamo che si tratta di un traguardo ambizioso, ed è esattamente il motivo per cui siamo qui su IndieGOGO: perché non possiamo farcela senza di voi. :)

Se riuscirete a sbloccare tutti gli Stretch Goal che abbiamo preparato per voi, tutto ciò che sarà raccolto in eccesso finirà direttamente nella produzione del secondo numero. Con il vostro aiuto, ci piacerebbe diventare in grado di pubblicare 2 numeri l'anno.

 

Please remember:

  • Shipping is not included in your pledge, and will be charged in a second time, when we'll close the pre-orders, in the Pledge Manager (Backerkit).
  • The prices below are an evaluation.
  • These prices refer to a non-tracked shipping, but there may be the possibility of a tracked shipping (for a higher price) in the Pledge Manager.

  • La spedizione non è compresa nella vostra offerta, e sarà addebitata in un secondo momento, quando chiuderemo i pre-ordini, attravrso il nostro Pledge Manager (Backerkit).
  • Riportiamo nella campagna solo l'opzione "piego libri" non tracciato. Questo non significa che non stiamo considerando spedizioni tracciate. Potreste trovare l'opzione di acquisto nel Pledge Manager alla fine della campagna, se abbastanza sostenitori lo dovessero chiedere.

COSTS TOO HIGH?

Feel free to join our Space Otter Romp Facebook group, and organize with other backers to split the shipping costs (but please note that we absolutely have no responsabilities on any conseguences that may or may not occur)!

The developing times are approximate and may vary depending on the final outcome of the campaign.

Our stories want to be exciting and offer insights of larger scale. They are based on the careful and realistic construction of the characters and their humanity, and the plots are the means to arrive at a much broader message and theme.

Space Otter Romp is a open Facebook Group where creatives of all kind can meet and show their work.

Out of the box is our first official project, but we successfully funded and delivered Misantropia - un gioco di sopravvivenza sociale, back in 2016 (sold-out in 2017), and took an active part on the Saloon Showdown 2020 Dracomaca campaign.

 

Out of the box authors

Giulia D'Urso

She works as Layout artist for Doghead Animation studio, in Italy. She has been colorist for Panini, Tatai Lab and other self-published projects. She has drawn an episode of Midnight Roads and illustrated the tabletop game Il mago delle carte, by Erickson Editions. She also cured the game board of Fantozzi e la coppa Cobram (Lamù editions).

In Out of the box she drew Project Hummingbird.

Zeno Colangelo

Born in Turin in 1994, Degree in Painting at the Albertina Academy of Fine Arts and International School of Comics in Turin. During the university he dedicates to painting and performance with the creative group Blucordero. He participates in numerous festivals, including the Paese a sei Corde of Novara and the Biennale Italia-China of Turin.  After the academy, he moves more actively towards the world of comics, and, after the firsts experiments with self-production, the first publications arrive with Attaccapanni Press (Beckup, 2018; Fists of Love, 2019).

In Out of the box he drew The copper roll.

Marta Zaccarini

Born in 1991 in Bologna.  Graduated from the ISART State Art Institute, she continued her studies at the International Comics School in Florence.  In 2014, with Connie Daidone and Elisa Serio, she founded the artistic collective Rêverie Studio, creating charity artbooks.

In Out of the box she drew The turquoise wolf and the fawn doe.

Elisa Di Virgilio

Elisa Di Virgilio works and lives in Treviso, and she attended the comic art program at the Padua branch of the “International School of Comics”.

She worked both as full artist and layout artist for local and overseas publishers – such as Star Comics, Editoriale Cosmo, Red Whale, and Space Between Entertainment.

She’s co-creator and artist of the indie series Midnight Roads and Echoes.

In Out of the box she drew Ghost Dance.

Eleonora Dea Nanni

Born in 1986, she graduated from the School of Comics in Milan.  Illustrator, comic book artist, graphic designer, she collaborates with Sergio Bonelli Editore, The Walt Disney Company, for independent publishing houses (Double-Shot, Passenger Press), and for the french publisher Petit à Petit.  Passionate about photography, she is pursuing a master’s degree in product and communication design.

In Out of the box she drew The old man and the Treasure of Treasures.

Brian Freschi

Born in 1993, he worked for many years in theater and stage arts before specializing in screenwriting and creative writing.

Since 2015 he has collaborated with the artistic collective Manticora, producing several comic books, and with numerous publishing houses such as BAO Publishing, Noise Press, Rêverie Studio, Attaccapanni Press and MaliEstremi.

Since 2018 he has collaborated as an author of illustrated books for children with Sassi Junior, Pelledoca Editore, Bacchilega Junior and Giazira.  He has worked for Gucci, Smemoranda, Banfi, G.C. Fausto Coppi, L’Inquieto Magazine and UniFI: University of Florence.

He teaches creative writing and scriptwriting for comic.

In Out of the box he’s the writer of The copper roll.

Giacomo Masi

Scriptwriter since 2008, in his first years he worked for television, cinema and advertising.

He has founded the award-winning videogames software house Studio V (Dry Drowning) in 2016, when he also started work with Tatai Lab, at the same time, for comic industry (GG: life is a videogame).

In Out of the box he’s the writer of The turquoise wolf and the fawn doe.

Matteo Parisi

Matteo Parisi is from Rome. He attended the screenwriting course at the “Scuola Romana dei Fumetti”, and was published in three anthologies tied to script writing competitions.

Since 2017 he is active in the Italian indie comics scene, as co-creator of the self-produced series Midnight Roads and Echoes.

In Out of the box he’s the writer of Ghost Dance.

Francis Green

Born in 1982 in Prato, Italy, he wrote for cinema, blogs, online newspapers and a radio show.  He published short stories for Delos and Bel Ami, and two more self-published books.

He’s the author of the lucky boardgames series Misanthropy, and he has been finalist with Giulia D’Urso at the "Lucca Project Contest" 2015, with the same Project Hummingbird presented in Out of the Box – of which he also put the staff together.

Out of the box is also the first project to inaugurate his own publisher label, Space Otter.

He wrote The old man and the Treasure of Treasures and Project Hummingbird.

 

Collaborators

Sara "Sbilemi" Marino

Born in '96 in Caserta. After high school, she studied comics to be able to work in the field of that expressive form that, since childhood, has peered through the pages of his notebooks. In the years following her graduation from the International School of Comics, she published for Attaccapanni Press and Shockdom.

She drew the cover of Out Of The Box #1.

Diana Laudano

After the School of Comics she began to collaborate with publishing realities, and at the same time she started her self-published fantasy saga, Sinergy. She's also working on Howard, published by Astromica. She works as artist and colorist for various studios and realities.

She helped with colors and lettering on The old man and the Treasure of Treasures and Project Hummingbird.

Andrea Alemanno

Is a compulsive illustrator who fills the line spacing, preferably at 300 dpi.

His artworks has been selected for several awards:  iJungle 2019, 2020, IBA volume 7 and 8, Annual of AI 2019, 2016, 2014, 2013, Lucca Junior 2020, and his first picture book "Barchetta" shortlisted at the "Premio Letteratura Ragazzi di Cento" 2013, won the third award.

He cured the graphic design of the Kickstarter campaign, and the OOTB cover.

Fists of Love, 2019).In Out of the box he drew The copper roll.Marta ZaccariniBorn in 1991 in Bologna.  Graduated from the ISART State Art Institute, she continued her studies at the International Comics School in Florence.  In 2014, with Connie Daidone and Elisa Serio, she founded the artistic collective Rêverie Studio, creating charity artbooks.In Out of the box she drew The turquoise wolf and the fawn doe.Elisa Di VirgilioElisa Di Virgilio works and lives in Treviso, and she attended the comic art program at the Padua branch of the “International School of Comics”.She worked both as full artist and layout artist for local and overseas publishers – such as Star Comics, Editoriale Cosmo, Red Whale, and Space Between Entertainment.She’s co-creator and artist of the indie series Midnight Roads and Echoes.In Out of the box she drew Ghost Dance.Eleonora Dea NanniBorn in 1986, she graduated from the School of Comics in Milan.  Illustrator, comic book artist, graphic designer, she collaborates with Sergio Bonelli Editore, The Walt Disney Company, for independent publishing houses (Double-Shot, Passenger Press), and for the french publisher Petit à Petit.  Passionate about photography, she is pursuing a master’s degree in product and communication design.In Out of the box she drew The old man and the Treasure of Treasures.Brian FreschiBorn in 1993, he worked for many years in theater and stage arts before specializing in screenwriting and creative writing.Since 2015 he has collaborated with the artistic collective Manticora, producing several comic books, and with numerous publishing houses such as BAO Publishing, Noise Press, Rêverie Studio, Attaccapanni Press and MaliEstremi.Since 2018 he has collaborated as an author of illustrated books for children with Sassi Junior, Pelledoca Editore, Bacchilega Junior and Giazira.  He has worked for Gucci, Smemoranda, Banfi, G.C. Fausto Coppi, L’Inquieto Magazine and UniFI: University of Florence.He teaches creative writing and scriptwriting for comic.In Out of the box he’s the writer of The copper roll.Giacomo MasiScriptwriter since 2008, in his first years he worked for television, cinema and advertising.He has founded the award-winning videogames software house Studio V (Dry Drowning) in 2016, when he also started work with Tatai Lab, at the same time, for comic industry (GG: life is a videogame).In Out of the box he’s the writer of The turquoise wolf and the fawn doe.Matteo ParisiMatteo Parisi is from Rome. He attended the screenwriting course at the “Scuola Romana dei Fumetti”, and was published in three anthologies tied to script writing competitions.Since 2017 he is active in the Italian indie comics scene, as co-creator of the self-produced series Midnight Roads and Echoes.In Out of the box he’s the writer of Ghost Dance.Francis GreenBorn in 1982 in Prato, Italy, he wrote for cinema, blogs, online newspapers and a radio show.  He published short stories for Delos and Bel Ami, and two more self-published books.He’s the author of the lucky boardgames series Misanthropy, and he has been finalist with Giulia D’Urso at the "Lucca Project Contest" 2015, with the same Project Hummingbird presented in Out of the Box – of which he also put the staff together.Out of the box is also the first project to inaugurate his own publisher label, Space Otter.He wrote The old man and the Treasure of Treasures and Project Hummingbird. CollaboratorsSara "Sbilemi" MarinoBorn in '96 in Caserta. After high school, she studied comics to be able to work in the field of that expressive form that, since childhood, has peered through the pages of his notebooks. In the years following her graduation from the International School of Comics, she published for Attaccapanni Press and Shockdom.She drew the cover of Out Of The Box #1.Diana LaudanoAfter the School of Comics she began to collaborate with publishing realities, and at the same time she started her self-published fantasy saga, Sinergy. She's also working on Howard, published by Astromica. She works as artist and colorist for various studios and realities.She helped with colors and lettering on The old man and the Treasure of Treasures and Project Hummingbird.Andrea AlemannoIs a compulsive illustrator who fills the line spacing, preferably at 300 dpi.His artworks has been selected for several awards:  iJungle 2019, 2020, IBA volume 7 and 8, Annual of AI 2019, 2016, 2014, 2013, Lucca Junior 2020, and his first picture book "Barchetta" shortlisted at the "Premio Letteratura Ragazzi di Cento" 2013, won the third award.He cured the graphic design of the Kickstarter campaign, and the OOTB cover.

story:
The story of the 47 Ronin!

47 Furious Tails is the story of the Ako Incident, the tale of the 47 Samurai who avenged the death of their lord and became legendary ronin.  This series tells this timeless classic from the pages of Japan's history through the use of anthropomorphic animal characters, in an art style that harkens back to the wood block prints of the Edo period and utilizes traditional ink brush techniques as well.   

Issues one and two of this twelve issue limited series are now printed and ready to ship.  

If you're looking for an exciting new title, enjoy furious samurai action, and support the indie comic renaissance, then this is the title for you! 

  • Featuring art by Kubert school alum Alexia Veldhuisen (Cover and all interiors)
  • Written by W.S. "Sam" Quinton (Sinopa Publishing).
  • Each tier ships print copy of issue 1 plus one (or more) of the available covers for issue 2.
  • Variant covers available for issue two by Kubert School instructor Fernando Ruiz and by Kubert school alum Paul Walcott.
  • Printed in 6 by 9 inch digest size, on 80lb paper with an exquisite 130lb satin soft touch finished cover.  Premium papers used for quality and durability. 

What We Need & What You Get

We know that a lot of Indie comic fans prefer the Indiegogo platform so we're bringing 47 Furious Tails here so you too can enjoy this new series. 

What do we get out of this?  We get to expand our readership, introduce people to our work, and generate more revenue to fund future issues.  Net proceeds from this campaign will be used to help fund future issues.  

What we are offering:

  • Our tiers ship print copies of 47 Furious Tails, Issue One (28 full color pages) and Issue Two (20 full color pages) straight to you.  
  • You can add on additional copies as you like.
  • All contributing artists have already been paid for their work at fair market rates and under written contracts. Proceeds from this campaign will fund shipping of backer rewards with remaining funds to be used for creating future issues.  
  • Shipping perks whether we reach goal or not (flexible funding). 

A little history and a glimpse into the future

I have fulfilled more than a dozen crowdfunding campaigns on another platform.  I have a lot of experience in campaign fulfillment.  These issues are printed and in hand so perks for this campaign will begin shipping once campaign funds are received from Indiegogo.  

Issue one's first press run sold out in its entirety so I commissioned a second cover from Alexia Veldhuisen and had a larger press run printed.  Print copies of issue one shipped through this campaign are from that second press run.  Issue two's successful crowdfunding campaign paid for the issue's art, variant covers and lettering, giving us three gorgeous covers for our second issue.  

Yes, this means that perks are shipping.

Take a look at my crowdfunding history both through my personal profile and through the Sinopa Publishing profile to see my track record of successfully funded and fulfilled campaigns.

 

Risks & Challenges

These issues are on hand and waiting to ship.  The only real risks are in shipping.  To help mitigate shipping risks we ship all comics bagged and boarded and packed in Gemini Mailers.  Large (11 by 17 inch) art prints shipped sleeved in UltraPro top loaders and are packed in USPS board game boxes (along with any other accompanying perks).   

There are a few things you can do to help make certain shipping risk is minimized:

  • Provide your full and correctly spelled mailing / shipping address.
  • If your address changes before fulfillment has begun, please notify me immediately so I can update the information before books are shipping out the door.
  • Provide a good email address so that my mailing software/service can send your tracking information to you.

Other Ways You Can Help

You've read this far and I'm grateful that you are so interested in 47 Furious Tails!  You can help support this campaign in a number of ways.  You can pledge for perks, share the campaign on social media, tell your local comic shop about our titles (have them reach out to us, we can set them up with sweet retailer packages), and invite us to speak with you for your blog, podcast or Youtube channel, if you're creating content I want to speak with you and your audience to get the word out!

Enjoy the series.  Creating comics is really only important so long as people are enjoying the title.  I hope you'll enjoy these issues, cherish them in your collection and look forward to issue three and beyond.

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to easily spread the word about our epic limited series, packed with furious samurai action!

story:
See our campaign video without the SPOILER BLOCK -

https://youtu.be/yef4RzQsv1g

Two people that have never met are suddenly drawn together by the same force that changed them... Hourglass the action comic.

Status:

    With three issues written, and one nearly complete, we are looking to fund the remaining two books if possible! BUT- if we hit our minimum goal we will be able to at least continue working on future books and get Issue#1 in your hands!

Who will like this?    

    Do you love THE RAID movies? Samurai and Kung-fu movies? Anime? This is the story for you and comic book miniseries for you!

 

       This first issue has some mystery to it... We get to know our two main characters through vibrant art, although it is not always bright and cheerful scenes. Things progress quickly through what should be a normal day for both of them. Suddenly things take a strange turn in what can only be called; a synchronized moment. This issue introduces to the paralleled lives of Angel and Pope. 

What will happen in Issue#2? Two unstoppable forces are brought together.

      Hourglass is an extremely unique story that brings together some of our favorite elements. Kung-fu movies, anime, manga, and modern martial arts films like THE RAID inspired much of the action. Conspiracy and imagination inspired the magic. It has 2 main characters, a young Latino boy named Thomas Angel Rodriguez (AKA- Angel) and 72 years old causation man named Nigel Pope.

They're lives are polar opposites and they have nothing in common except for the sudden change to their existence that draws them together! Once the fight begins... nothing can stop it until ...(SPOILER HIDDEN)

      This book is inspired by Kung-fu, martial arts, and samurai films... we just gave things an American Quantum twist. 

Our stretch goals include a secret WTF COMICS merch item. If we hit our goal plus a little we will send everyone with a physical reward tier, a bonus item. This might be some stickers, trading cards, or something else from one of our WTFC titles!

 

The amount we would need to raise for all three issues to be completed, and send to everyone varies. Because the number of backers and what tier levels they choose can change the amount of funds left over after the campaign we can not say for sure how much we must raise on Indiegogo to complete all three books. However we only need to have roughly $10,000 (after rewards and expenses)

 

      The art is incredible, interior pages jump off the page with the line work by Garrie Gastonny and Colorist Rifan Kartakusumah from GS20 Studios. 

      A lot of work wast put into the detail of these parallel lives as they come crashing together. This include subtle format and layout work that will have your mind lost in the sands of time.

 

    

Each character is given a color palette and design so that the scenes tell the story as much as the words. Pope, a man in his twilight spends most of his time thinking on the past.

 

 

MORE ART SAMPLES

8.5x11 Print

 

9x18 POSTER

 

ISSUE #1 (A#Cover)

 

MARIA KHE (VARIANT)

ISSUE #2 (A#Cover)

 

 

 

THE TEAM:

  • Jon Jones- Creator and writer
  • Jack Eagen- Writer
  • Art by- Garrie Gastonny
  • Color By- Rifan
  • IP House- WTFComicbooks.com
  • Art Studio- GS20 Studios

story:
All of the books in pristine condition are  SOLD OUT! 

We only have 55 discounted copies, with mild stretches or dents on the cover(examples down bellow).  If you want one you can order it by choosing an option on the right. 


Do you like spooky stories? 

If so, you might like "Welcome to Shipsgrave." This book is a Lovecraftian anthology of illustrated creepy short stories inspired by "The Shadow over Innsmouth", about a boy who moves with his father to a mysterious town with fishy locals and discovers its strange customs and dark secrets.

Below are 10 random short stories from the book.

In total there are 100 short stories in the book. And it's pretty big: 8.5″x9.5″.  And it has a hardcover! A great gift for yourself or others.

 

Age restrictions

Despite dark themes, there's no profanity, sexual content, excessive violence, or gore. I believe this book should be considered PG12 but different kids have different sensitivities, so ultimately if you are buying this book for a child I would suggest you personally make sure it's suited for them. 

 

The creator

This book is fully created by me, Nashotobi (twitter/instagram) a writer/artist from Ukraine.

story:
STILL MISSING THE BOOK

STILL MISSING   is a beautifully designed art book exploring the folk art of lost & found pet posters.  Featuring nearly 200 pages of high quality full-color images and illustrations. 

 

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP ?

  • we are a small print house with very limited funds 
  • we currently only have 2 prototypes of the book and would love to make more
  • printing hardcover art books is very expensive ($11k for a 1st run)
  • once the book is printed  100% of my proceeds from book sales will go to animal charities

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

STILL MISSING   is a curatorial voyage through the world of lost and found pet posters that combines graphic and visual arts, illustration, and photography in a poetic and cohesive collage of raw emotion. Art connoisseurs and casual observers of all backgrounds, interests, and ages will find their own deep resonance within its pages.

STILL MISSING   is a collection of art by everyone, for everyone. This book truly speaks worlds about the human condition. It’s strange, it's weird, it's funny, it's beautiful, it's creative and yes...it's also sad. From toucans to tortoises, roosters to ferrets and dragons to unicorns, it will always keep you guessing with what’s coming next.

QUESTIONS   What is the largest reward for a cat? What is the smallest reward for a turtle? What's the strangest pet name?  What's the most unique poster material? What's the biggest or the smallest poster I've ever found?  It's all in the details... STILL MISSING will answer all of these questions, while provoking even more.

 

 

 

  • EDITION:  Very Limited Pre-Order Edition
  • PAGE COUNT:  200 Pages of Folk Art
  • BOOK SIZE:  9in x 12in (22.86cm x 30.48cm)
  • COVER TYPE:  Hardcover
  • COVER DESIGN: Debossed Bright Red and Aqua Blue Foiling
  • COVER MATERIAL: Clothbound in Yellow Canvas
  • PAPER TYPE: Extremely High-Quality Archival Paper with Minimal Gloss

 

FRONT COVER of STILL MISSING

 

BACK COVER of STILL MISSING

 

 

 

 

THE BOOK (30$)

 

SIGNED BOOK by AUTHOR ($45)

 

HAVE YOUR PET'S NAME FEATURED in STILL MISSING ($75)

 

HANDMADE TELEPHONE POLE WOOD SLIPCASE ($100)

 

CUSTOM POSTER of YOUR PET by STARBURNS ARTIST ($200)​

 

  L.A. POSTER ADVENTURE with AUTHOR ($300)

 

TOUR OF STARBURNS STUDIOS and ASSOCIATE PUBLISHER CREDIT on FRONT PAGE of the BOOK ($600)

 

 

From 2010 to 2013, I drove around Los Angeles County collecting lost and found animal posters. 

Being a huge animal lover myself, I set a rule for my project… I had to see at least three identical posters in a one-block area in order to take one (to not defeat the owners quest of finding their animal). 

For three years, I drove tirelessly all over L.A. County, from South Central to Palmdale and from Venice to East L.A.in order to incorporate the many cultures of Los Angeles into the posters themselves. 

Back in 2010, I realized that I possessed a true form of Folk Art -- hand-drawn, hand-painted posters made by ordinary people. They were meditations on the mundane.  At this time I foresaw the rise of these posters becoming fully digitized templates and felt that the form of Folk Art displayed in these posters had every right to be preserved and viewed for years to come. 

If every piece of art has a story, some pieces of art have deeper and more meaningful stories than others. These posters tell the story about the times and places in which we are living. The posters use the combined artistic mediums of graphic and visual arts, illustration, and photography in a poetic and cohesive collage of raw emotion to tell their tale. 

I went on to find posters of dogs, cats, dragons, unicorns, clip-art bunnies, toucans, and many more. In total, I collected over 2,000 posters amassing the world’s largest collection of this form of Folk Art.

After my collection for this book came to a close. I started an Instagram account which is now getting submissions from around the world. Posters from such places as: Argentina, Chile, Japan, China, Russia, Mexico, Canada, all of the United States, and Europe.

The Instagram has even helped reconnect people with their lost and found animals.  

 

 

 

 

 

 

$ANY AMOUNT: THE LOVEBIRD

  • You love the project and would like to make a pledge without any reward.

(it's the pink button at the top right of this page that says "BACK IT")

 

$30: THE FLAMINGO (SUPER EARLY BIRD)

  • (1) Still Missing Book (limited pre-order edition/not signed)

 

$45: THE TOUCAN (SIGNED EARLY BIRD BOOK)

  • (1) Still Missing Book (limited pre-order edition/hand-numbered/ signed by author)

 

$50: 2 FLAMINGOS (SUPER EARLY BIRD)

  • (2) Still Missing Books (limited pre-order edition/not signed)

 

$70: 2 TOUCANS (SIGNED EARLY BIRD BOOK)

  • (2) Still Missing Books (limited pre-order edition/hand-numbered/ signed by author)

 

$75: THE HAMSTER (YOUR PET’S NAME IN THE BOOK)

  • (1) Still Missing Book (limited pre-order edition/hand-numbered/ signed by author)
  • (1) Your Pet’s Name Inside the Book *only available here*

 

$100: THE UNICORN (HANDMADE TELEPHONE POLE WOOD SLIPCASE)

  • (1) Still Missing Book (limited pre-order edition/hand-numbered/ signed by author)
  • (1) Your Pet’s Name Inside the Book *only available here*
  • (1) Handmade Telephone Pole Replica Wooden Box for Book

 

$200: THE DRAGON (CUSTOM PET POSTER BY STARBURNS ARTIST)

  • (1) Still Missing Book (limited pre-order edition/hand-numbered/ signed by author)
  • (1) Your Pet’s Name Inside the Book
  • (1) Handmade Telephone Pole Replica Wooden Box for Book
  • (1) Custom Hand-Made Pet Poster of Your Pet (past/present/real/imaginary) by Starburns Artist *only available here*

 

$300: DOG’S BEST FRIEND (L.A. POSTER ADVENTURE W/ AUTHOR)

  • (1) Still Missing Book (limited pre-order edition/hand-numbered/ signed by author)
  • (1) Your Pet’s Name Inside the Book *only available here*
  • (1) Handmade Telephone Pole Replica Wooden Box for Book
  • (1) Custom Hand-Made Pet Poster of Your Pet (past/present/real/imaginary) by Starburns Artist.
  • (1) Guided L.A. Poster Hunt & Stories w/ Author
  • *** travel to L.A. is not included ***

 

$600: THE JUMPING CAT (STARBURNS STUDIO TOUR & ASSOCIATE PUBLISHER CREDIT ON FRONT PAGE OF BOOK)

  • (1) Still Missing Book (limited pre-order edition/hand-numbered/ signed by author)
  • (1) Your Pet’s Name Inside the Book *only available here*
  • (1) Handmade Telephone Pole Replica Wooden Box for Book
  • (1) Custom Hand-Made Pet Poster of Your Pet (past/present/ real/imaginary) by Starburns Artist
  • (1) Tour of Starburns Animation Studios and Associate Publisher Credit on Front Page of Book 
  • *** travel to L.A. is not included ***

 

*** ALL SIGNED TIERS WILL BE SIGNED & HAND-NUMBERED ON BEAUTIFULLY DESIGNED BOOKPLATES ***     

 

 

 

HOW MUCH WILL IT COST TO PRINT THE 1st RUN OF STILL MISSING ? 

  • Printing = $11,000

 

THE 2nd RUN ?

  • Printing = $17,000

 

THE 3rd RUN ?

  • Printing = $23,000

 

IF MORE THAN $11,000 IS PLEDGED... WHAT WILL THE REMAINDER OF THE MONEY BE USED FOR ?

  • Printing More Books, Distributing, Advertising and Marketing the Book
  • Making Merch: Beanies, Tote Bags and Shirts (ie: poster shirts)

 

 

WHAT IS A STRETCH GOAL ?

  • STRETCH GOALS are financial targets set above a project creator's initial funding goal.
  • They're designed to make better use of excess funds raised in a campaign by offering improvements to projects or providing additional rewards to backers.
  • Once a given STRETCH GOAL amount is reached, the corresponding reward is "UNLOCKED".
  • All backers who pledged rewards over $30 (prior to shipping) receive the STRETCH GOAL.

 

$30k - (1) 8.5" x 11" Mystery Printable PDF Poster (not in book) --> LOCKED

 

$40k – (2) 1" STILL MISSING Buttons --> LOCKED

 

$50k – (1) STILL MISSING Enamel Pin --> LOCKED

 

$60k –  (1) Still Missing Canvas Tote Bag --> LOCKED

 

$70k - (1) Still Missing Postcard Print Pack (12 postcards) --> LOCKED

 

$100k - (1) Still Missing Embroidered Beanie --> LOCKED

 

$120k - (1) Still Missing Logo T-Shirt --> LOCKED

 

*** STRETCH GOALS ARE AVAILABLE FOR ALL TIERS $30 AND GREATER***

*** stretch goals may slightly affect the price of shipping ***

 

 

No risks or challenges are too big after facing many obstacles over the course of this project including but not limited to: 

LA drivers, LA summers, black mold, telephone pole toxins, cockroaches, celebrity wannabes, pincher bugs, black widows, torrential downpours, flat tires, car breakdowns and many many other car troubles.

However, the biggest challenge that we currently face with STILL MISSING is ensuring the beauty and quality of the book itself in order to properly represent and display the folk art within. We'll be working long hard hours to ensure the paper stocks, quality of inks, cover designs, layouts and textures within STILL MISSING are how we have imagined them and that the book will be printed on schedule to be sent out to all of our fantastic contributors. 

 

main video design/stop-motion animation​

 

EASY SHIPPING AROUND THE WORLD .
story_txt:
STILL MISSING THE BOOKSTILL MISSING   is a beautifully designed art book exploring the folk art of lost & found pet posters.  Featuring nearly 200 pages of high quality full-color images and illustrations.  WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP ?
we are a small print house with very limited funds 
we currently only have 2 prototypes of the book and would love to make more
printing hardcover art books is very expensive ($11k for a 1st run)
once the book is printed  100% of my proceeds from book sales will go to animal charities

            STILL MISSING   is a curatorial voyage through the world of lost and found pet posters that combines graphic and visual arts, illustration, and photography in a poetic and cohesive collage of raw emotion. Art connoisseurs and casual observers of all backgrounds, interests, and ages will find their own deep resonance within its pages.STILL MISSING   is a collection of art by everyone, for everyone. This book truly speaks worlds about the human condition. It’s strange, it's weird, it's funny, it's beautiful, it's creative and yes...it's also sad. From toucans to tortoises, roosters to ferrets and dragons to unicorns, it will always keep you guessing with what’s coming next.QUESTIONS   What is the largest reward for a cat? What is the smallest reward for a turtle? What's the strangest pet name?  What's the most unique poster material? What's the biggest or the smallest poster I've ever found?  It's all in the details... STILL MISSING will answer all of these questions, while provoking even more.   

EDITION:  Very Limited Pre-Order Edition

PAGE COUNT:  200 Pages of Folk Art

BOOK SIZE:  9in x 12in (22.86cm x 30.48cm)

COVER TYPE:  Hardcover

COVER DESIGN: Debossed Bright Red and Aqua Blue Foiling

COVER MATERIAL: Clothbound in Yellow Canvas

PAPER TYPE: Extremely High-Quality Archival Paper with Minimal Gloss
 FRONT COVER of STILL MISSING BACK COVER of STILL MISSING    THE BOOK (30$) SIGNED BOOK by AUTHOR ($45) HAVE YOUR PET'S NAME FEATURED in STILL MISSING ($75) HANDMADE TELEPHONE POLE WOOD SLIPCASE ($100) CUSTOM POSTER of YOUR PET by STARBURNS ARTIST ($200)​   L.A. POSTER ADVENTURE with AUTHOR ($300) TOUR OF STARBURNS STUDIOS and ASSOCIATE PUBLISHER CREDIT on FRONT PAGE of the BOOK ($600)  From 2010 to 2013, I drove around Los Angeles County collecting lost and found animal posters. Being a huge animal lover myself, I set a rule for my project… I had to see at least three identical posters in a one-block area in order to take one (to not defeat the owners quest of finding their animal). For three years, I drove tirelessly all over L.A. County, from South Central to Palmdale and from Venice to East L.A.in order to incorporate the many cultures of Los Angeles into the posters themselves. Back in 2010, I realized that I possessed a true form of Folk Art -- hand-drawn, hand-painted posters made by ordinary people. They were meditations on the mundane.  At this time I foresaw the rise of these posters becoming fully digitized templates and felt that the form of Folk Art displayed in these posters had every right to be preserved and viewed for years to come. If every piece of art has a story, some pieces of art have deeper and more meaningful stories than others. These posters tell the story about the times and places in which we are living. The posters use the combined artistic mediums of graphic and visual arts, illustration, and photography in a poetic and cohesive collage of raw emotion to tell their tale. I went on to find posters of dogs, cats, dragons, unicorns, clip-art bunnies, toucans, and many more. In total, I collected over 2,000 posters amassing the world’s largest collection of this form of Folk Art.After my collection for this book came to a close. I started an Instagram account which is now getting submissions from around the world. Posters from such places as: Argentina, Chile, Japan, China, Russia, Mexico, Canada, all of the United States, and Europe.The Instagram has even helped reconnect people with their lost and found animals.        $ANY AMOUNT: THE LOVEBIRDYou love the project and would like to make a pledge without any reward.(it's the pink button at the top right of this page that says "BACK IT") $30: THE FLAMINGO (SUPER EARLY BIRD)(1) Still Missing Book (limited pre-order edition/not signed) $45: THE TOUCAN (SIGNED EARLY BIRD BOOK)(1) Still Missing Book (limited pre-order edition/hand-numbered/ signed by author) $50: 2 FLAMINGOS (SUPER EARLY BIRD)(2) Still Missing Books (limited pre-order edition/not signed) $70: 2 TOUCANS (SIGNED EARLY BIRD BOOK)(2) Still Missing Books (limited pre-order edition/hand-numbered/ signed by author) $75: THE HAMSTER (YOUR PET’S NAME IN THE BOOK)
(1) Still Missing Book (limited pre-order edition/hand-numbered/ signed by author)
(1) Your Pet’s Name Inside the Book *only available here*
 $100: THE UNICORN (HANDMADE TELEPHONE POLE WOOD SLIPCASE)
(1) Still Missing Book (limited pre-order edition/hand-numbered/ signed by author)
(1) Your Pet’s Name Inside the Book *only available here*

WHAT WILL THE REMAINDER OF THE MONEY BE USED FOR ?
Printing More Books, Distributing, Advertising and Marketing the Book
Making Merch: Beanies, Tote Bags and Shirts (ie: poster shirts)
  WHAT IS A STRETCH GOAL ?
STRETCH GOALS are financial targets set above a project creator's initial funding goal.
They're designed to make better use of excess funds raised in a campaign by offering improvements to projects or providing additional rewards to backers.

story:
After a 30 year hiatus, Chuck Dixon has returned to write new issues of AIRBOY, to be published by IT'S ALIVE!  AIRBOY #51 has been published, and now we need everyone's help to publish AIRBOY #52!  The action on the first page of AIRBOY #51 picked right up where the last page of AIRBOY #50 left off over three decades ago! And AIRBOY #52 introduces us to David (Davy) Nelson IV...the new AIRBOY!

To celebrate the return of AIRBOY, we commissioned variant covers for AIRBOY #51 by Bret Blevins, Dalibor Talajic, Jim Steranko, Matt Kindt, Paul Gulacy, Sam Kieth

AIRBOY #52 has variant covers by Don Perlin, Emma Kubert, Russell Mark Olson, Jok, Stipe Kalajžić, and Graham Nolan!

Your support will help make this new issue of AIRBOY a reality! Thank you!

 

AIRBOY 51

 

AIRBOY #52 (not the final cover)

We recently ran a successful campaign for AIRBOY #51, but if you missed out on that campaign, you can pick up both AIRBOY #51 and AIRBOY #52 from this campaign.  You can also pick up a slew of incredible variant covers from both issues by (AIRBOY #51) Bret Blevins, Dalibor Talajic, Jim Steranko, Matt Kindt, Paul Gulacy, Sam Kieth, and (AIRBOY #52) Don Perlin, Emma Kubert, Brent McKee, Jok, Stipe Kalajžić, and Graham Nolan!

The first four issues of AIRBOY will deliver Dixon's new story entitled "Generations", where David (Davy) Nelson IV, grandson of the original Golden Age AIRBOY, and son of the more recent 1980's incarnation of AIRBOY created by Chuck Dixon, is introduced as the new AIRBOY.  Dixon has returned to this world and these characters with one hell of a story that is sure to blow your mind!

Dixon's new AIRBOY series has been brought to life visually by (AIRBOY #51) Brent McKee and Jok, and (AIRBOY #52) Stipe Kalajžić and Srdjan Stoiljkovic.  Enjoy this preview of both issues!

Page from AIRBOY #51

 

Page from AIRBOY #51

 

Page from AIRBOY #51

 

Page from AIRBOY #52

Page from AIRBOY #52

 

Page from AIRBOY #52

 

AIRBOY VARIANT COVERS

AIRBOY #51 & #52 both have six variants.  And each issue has one variant cover that you can ONLY purchase from this campaign!  AIRBOY #51 has Jim Steranko, Dalibor Talajic, Matt Kindt, Paul Gulacy, Sam Kieth, and Bret Blevins (INDIEGOGO ONLY).  AIRBOY #52 has Don Perlin, Emma Kubert, Jok, Russell Mark Olson (INDIEGOGO ONLY), Stipe Kalajzic, and Graham Nolan. 

Here they all are. . .

AIRBOY #51 variant cover by JIM STERANKO

 

AIRBOY #51 variant cover by DALIBOR TALAJIC

 

AIRBOY #51 variant cover by MATT KINDT

 

AIRBOY #51 variant cover by PAUL GULACY

 

AIRBOY #51 variant cover by SAM KIETH

 

AIRBOY #51 variant cover by BRET BLEVINS

 

AIRBOY #52 variant cover by DON PERLIN

 

AIRBOY #52 variant cover by EMMA KUBERT

 

AIRBOY #52 variant cover by JOK

 

AIRBOY #52 variant cover by RUSSELL MARK OLSON

 

AIRBOY #52 variant cover by STIPE KALAJZIC

 

AIRBOY #52 variant cover by GRAHAM NOLAN

story:
Issue 3 Available for Pre-Order, Shipping in August

Issue 3 has completely funded on another platform, but I am not going to leave the Indiegogo Backers out. 

The InDemand Store has been converted to PreOrder Issue #3, or get Issues 1 and 2 if you missed them also. 

 

I am currently finishing up the Coloring and Lettering for Issue #3 and will have them going out to Contributors/Backers in August. 

 

 

 

 

 

Imagine an alternate reality where Dorothy Gale returned from her adventures in OZ and her family thought she was insane, so they had her committed to a mental institution. Now, throw in a whole bunch of Zombies.

I funded the first issue in April 2019. We funded in 7 days and the rewards were shipped out a month ahead of schedule. Now we return to OZ again for the SECOND ISSUE. 40 Pages of Exciting Adventure and continuing right where Issue 1 left off. And don't worry, if you missed out on Issue 1, it is available through this campaign as well.

I am the Writer, Penciler, Inker, Colorist, and Letterer of The Zombieful World of OZ.

All Books will be mailed Bag and Boarded in Gemini Mailers.

Now I am looking for help to get the Second Issue of The Zombieful World of OZ printed and into the hands of the fans of everything OZ.

 

Kansas 1914

Ten years after Dorothy Gales’s fantastic adventure, she is now 24 and is being released from a mental hospital. The years following the cyclone, people could not comprehend her tales of adventures and wonder in the Land of Oz, and thought her crazy. Years of therapy and rehabilitation followed. Now she is being released and her will and new resolve are going to be tested like never before.

In the years after Dorothy’s arrival in Oz, a mysterious plague has swept the land. The Winkie Country was the first to fall. The Great Winkie Army is now  under the control of Nikko the Great Winged Ape. Along with his army of flying primates, Nikko has been using the Winkies to infect and take control of The Land of Oz.

The Emerald City is one of the last areas remaining to survive the plague. The City also holds one of the few known Cyclone Portals that can transport occupants to Kansas. Nikko and his army hold siege to the City and plan to invade Kansas to exact revenge on Dorothy for killing the Wicked Witch all those years ago.

Dorothy, The Cowardly Lion, The Tin Woodman and The Scarecrow return to OZ after an encounter with The Zombie Winkies in Kansas. They find the Emerald City has been taken over and the Ozma is missing.

Your favorite characters have returned, and they are all grown up now!

Dorothy Gale

The Cowardly Lion

The Scarecrow

The Tin Woodman

The Nightmarish Flying Monkeys!

And The Winkie Guard...The Zombie Winkie Guard

The Hungry Tiger, Jack Pumpkin Head, The Wizard and more

 

I am Eric S. Hawkins. I've had a passion for drawing and comics since I was a kid. Like many other Indie Creators, I have a full time job and spend my evenings working on comics.

Last year I crowdfunded The Zombieful World of OZ #1 here on Kickstarter. We funded in a week and fulfilled the campaign a month early.

In November 2019 I converted The Zombieful World of OZ #1 to a Webtoon format. Which won me the Independent Creator Awards for Web Comic of the Year 2019

Some of my other works include:

Celebration Comics #1 : Nature Boy A Celebration of Evil (Penciler and Inker)

The Ghostly Tales of Spencer Spook #1 (Penciler, Inker, Colorist and Letterer)

Miss Vicky and Her Cutie Commandos #1 (Cover Colorist)

The Advocator Presents Summer and Winter Editions 2019

Celebrity Ghost Hunters (Penciler, Inker, Colorist and Letterer)

The Zombieful World of OZ #1

story:
Galvin Fry is a normal 20 year old retail stock boy, who encounters a crashed spaceship. Suddenly he found himself face-to-face with an alien being that called himself "Lycon" from the planet called "Macron".

Lycon informed Galvin that his planet was invaded and earth will face the great dangers of the invasion as well. Earth will also face a great evil nemesis called 'Lord Versa'. Galvin is told he's the only one who can stop the invasion. However, the perishing alien gives his "Gadget tron" gauntlet glove to him. (The Gadget tron is a symbiotic bio-armor that merges with it's host.)

The symbiotic weapon has bonded with Galvin and can not be removed. However, he becomes a cosmic hero called "Guytron". He will have more to worry about, than every day personal life issues. Now it appears that the fate of the universe rests on his shoulders. This is a superhero - romance - action - sitcom where anything and everything can happen

story:
Stretch Goal Time! 135 Backers!

Now that TILT 2 has hit its funding goal, let's shoot for the stretch goal!  Instead of a money goal, we're going to do one based on number of backers!  So, if we reach 135 backers, then everyone will receive the below two pin-ups!  So spread the word, and let's make this happen!

 

 

Welcome!

Hello and Welcome to the campaign to fund TILT 2!

Important Note: For first time backers of TILT who did not get in on the first campaign, you will have the option of purchasing TILT Part 1 as an "add-on". Just select the perk you want and at the next page you will see the add-ons.

Jennifer Polar is in danger. The mobsters who murdered her dad are out to get her! A spirit gives her the power to make the Kings, Queen and Jacks in a deck of cards come alive. They'll protect her, but only if she kills the mobsters who murdered her dad! Jennifer reluctantly agrees.

In Issue 2, Jennifer has barely begun, and and already the police are closing in. Despite that, she must persist. It is time for the mobsters to face the music. But what price will Jennifer pay? Will her recklessness catch up with her? Find out in TILT 2!

The same great team that worked on TILT 1 returns for Issue 2! Written by David "Doc Hog" Hogberg, illustrated by Marcos Lima, colored by Leanore King, lettered by D. Jason Meadows, and edited by Jeremy Lott.

All comics will be signed by David "Doc Hog" Hogberg. In addition, Leanore King and LahKem Amiyr will sign their pin-ups.

Page 1:

Page 2:

Page 20:

 

Page 28:

Perk and Add-Ons!

PERKS: Just like last time, you will be able to buy a digital copy, or physical copies with just the standard cover, or just the variant cover, or both covers! All physical copies come with a digital copy.

You will also have four opportunities to be drawn into TILT 3! You can be drawn in as: 1) A thug who plays cards with Jennifer and then gets whacked! 2) A thug who is friends with the mobster who attacks Jennifer. You'll give up information to Jennifer and then get whacked! 3) The friend or girlfriend of mob hitman Marco Tessio. You'll also give Jennifer information and you just might survive! Maybe. 4) The Spirit of Chaos! This character will be integral in moving the plot along to the second story arc. Not only will you get drawn into Issue 3, you'll be drawn into any issue that includes the Spirit if Chaos!

You can also purchase TILT Original Art. Check out all of the original art for purchase below, including the art for the Variant Cover, Deck of Cards, Reissue Cover and Vic King's special tribute to Graveyard Shift!

ADD-ONS:  -Pin-ups: There will be two pin-ups for the price of one:. The first is Jiggities by LahKem Amiyr:

The second is Sexy Jennifer (aka Jennifer With Junk In The Trunk) by Archsider:

 

-Deck of Cards: A 54 card poker deck with art on the back of the cards by Vic King and Rosetta Allen:

Plus, the Kings, Queens and Jacks will be custom! The Kings are designed by LahKem Amiyr, the Queens by Leanore King, and the Jacks by Jeff Kraven! Scroll down to view them.

-Posters, Not Pin-Ups: Get all of the pinup images as posters--that is, they won't be folded. Shipped in a 11x17 plastic sleeve. All of the pinups from TILT 2, including the ones in the stretch goal, and all three from TILT 1! Limited supply!

-Reissue of TILT 1: Didn't get a physical copy of TILT 1? No problem! It is being reissued with a special cover by Alan D. Gray, Jr.!

STRETCH GOALS: -At $6,000, everybody will receive two pin-ups: the virgin version of the standard cover and all the ladies of TILT by Leanore King.

-At $8,000 everyone will get two trading cards  of Jennifer Polar and the Jack of Hearts. Designed by LahKem Amiyr and Luke Stone.

-At $10,000 everyone will get two more trading cards, the Queen of Hearts and the King of Hearts. Designed by LahKem Amiyr and Luke Stone.

story_txt:
Stretch Goal Time! 135 Backers!
Now that TILT 2 has hit its funding goal, let's shoot for the stretch goal!  Instead of a money goal, we're going to do one based on number of backers!  So, if we reach 135 backers, then everyone will receive the below two pin-ups!  So spread the word, and let's make this happen!
 

 

Welcome!
Hello and Welcome to the campaign to fund TILT 2!
Important Note: For first time backers of TILT who did not get in on the first campaign, you will have the option of purchasing TILT Part 1 as an "add-on". Just select the perk you want and at the next page you will see the add-ons.

Jennifer Polar is in danger. The mobsters who murdered her dad are out to get her! A spirit gives her the power to make the Kings, Queen and Jacks in a deck of cards come alive. They'll protect her, but only if she kills the mobsters who murdered her dad! Jennifer reluctantly agrees.
In Issue 2, Jennifer has barely begun, and and already the police are closing in. Despite that, she must persist. It is time for the mobsters to face the music. But what price will Jennifer pay? Will her recklessness catch up with her? Find out in TILT 2!

The same great team that worked on TILT 1 returns for Issue 2! Written by David "Doc Hog" Hogberg, illustrated by Marcos Lima, colored by Leanore King, lettered by D. Jason Meadows, and edited by Jeremy Lott.
All comics will be signed by David "Doc Hog" Hogberg. In addition, Leanore King and LahKem Amiyr will sign their pin-ups.
Page 1:

Page 2:


Page 20:

 
Page 28:

Perk and Add-Ons!
PERKS: Just like last time, you will be able to buy a digital copy, or physical copies with just the standard cover, or just the variant cover, or both covers! All physical copies come with a digital copy.
You will also have four opportunities to be drawn into TILT 3! You can be drawn in as: 1) A thug who plays cards with Jennifer and then gets whacked! 2) A thug who is friends with the mobster who attacks Jennifer. You'll give up information to Jennifer and then get whacked! 3) The friend or girlfriend of mob hitman Marco Tessio. You'll also give Jennifer information and you just might survive! Maybe. 4) The Spirit of Chaos! This character will be integral in moving the plot along to the second story arc. Not only will you get drawn into Issue 3, you'll be drawn into any issue that includes the Spirit if Chaos!
You can also purchase TILT Original Art. Check out all of the original art for purchase below, including the art for the Variant Cover, Deck of Cards, Reissue Cover and Vic King's special tribute to Graveyard Shift!
ADD-ONS:  -Pin-ups: There will be two pin-ups for the price of one:. The first is Jiggities by LahKem Amiyr:

The second is Sexy Jennifer (aka Jennifer With Junk In The Trunk) by Archsider:

 
-Deck of Cards: A 54 card poker deck with art on the back of the cards by Vic King and Rosetta Allen:

Plus, the Kings, Queens and Jacks will be custom! The Kings are designed by LahKem Amiyr, the Queens by Leanore King, and the Jacks by Jeff Kraven! Scroll down to view them.

-Reissue of TILT 1: Didn't get a physical copy of TILT 1? No problem! It is being reissued with a special cover by Alan D. Gray, Jr.!

-At $10,000 everyone will get two more trading cards, the Queen of Hearts and the King of Hearts. Designed by LahKem Amiyr and Luke Stone.

story:
Dear, people. I closed this campaign - because it doesn't seem to captivate the audience. So, I'm going back behind my draft table and work on it. 


Please don't contribute. 



________________________________________________________

My name is Karine, friends call me: "Kay" - because I always respond quickly with: "Kay" - win - win.

I've been trying to become a comic artist ever since I was a kid, I'm not popular, I'm not the most awesome person ever, but I'm a dreamer. Life is meant to fallow your dreams and that's what I'm trying to do.

To become a comic artist you need a lot of supplies and help - a lot of help ...

I already started a Patreon (http://www.patreon.com/sahtori ) - to start my comic. But it's not easy, I need help. I have carpel tunnel syndrome; there are days that I can't draw at all. Everything blocks. So I need help from other artists to 'tell my stories' they are my friends, but of course, it's not for free. They need to make a living as well - I realized over the course of many years, making a comic on your own is close to impossible. Especially to maintain it. Also, the fact that it's difficult to do it on your own. I got in a huge depression because of my hand not wanting to draw like it used too. I've been declined 4 times, because of 'plot' reasons or simply being 'to slow'. Hence my friends want to help me, but with a price ...

Now it's time to take the next step. I want to publish a comic. The comic is called: 'The heart of a Star' - a comic about a young Deity named: "Sahtori" - she goes on many adventures in worlds that are created by mankind. Though while fighting nightmares she can't seem to control her own nightmares.

Here's a video of the two main characters - a work in progress of the couple who are separated by dreams ...

The comic has been postponed for over 4 years. Trying to find budget and time. I've worked on many drawings for clients but the biggest problem was getting the TIME for the comic. I had simply no time to work on it. All my drawings are worked with love and care. So after a long discussion, my friends agreed to help me. I don't have the money to support them of course. That is why I need your help.

This is why I'm starting the campaign. To be able to work full-time on it. As I said above, I have a Patreon, if you feel like sponsering me on Patreon, I'd be thrilled. It's a monthly contribution and I can get you guys some amazing treats during the months. Wallpapers, fanart and I'll even select one person a month to draw a free drawing for, to show my big gratitude, this is after all, all I ever wanted ...

Preview of the comics, preview of stories, because I'm not staying with just one comic; oh no, the web-comic is just the start. I want to build this out to one of the most spectacular things I want to achieve in my life...

Only, I need help, are you willing to help me? To get closer to my dreams? I will share my dream, this comic is for everyone for viewing in public and one day I hope to publish it in volumes. That's kind of the idea.

Thank you for reading and I'll update frequently my process. 

Right now on Ethereal Worlds we are showing a comic that's  NONE-Profit, we are introducing the main character of the future comic I've been talking about. But the only way we thought we could do it, is using the "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles". Again, this comic is not for profit. But to show what WE are capable of. Think of it as a test comic (which kind of is) to be able to 'fly' into the next issue, which is with our own characters. 

As sooner we get the budget, the sooner we can start this dream.

(The reason I chose TMNT was kind of to show it to the creators and hopefully get a job, but so many people are making so many better fan comics. This is why the plot had a drastic change, which you'll see ;) )

The budget isn't only to pay my friends for helping me (Ink - flats are mines - for the moment) Because I'm saving up to fallow 3D school. There are two schools so far that interests me. But one is 1600EUR the other 695EUR. So this Indiegogo is also to support my classes to learn 3D and get my diploma.

I couldn't finish my school because of family issue's. Mostly bullies and becoming very sick. Now I'm ready to do it ...

Would you like to read the TMNT - Fan comic? - "Once Upon a Blue Moon"

Would you like to see examples of my work? Then the Archives would be a great place to start.

The Archives of Ethereal Worlds

Sahtori's FaceBook

I'll update this page often with new works. For example the TMNT Fan Comic

story:
Short Summary

My name is Nikki Constantino and I am the writer of the original script. I am a graduate from a vocational school called The Berkeley Digital Film  Institute. My main focus in school was writing and directing and this was where "kimber" was born. 

This campaign is to raise money to create a quality comic book/graphic novel version of my script. I would like to then utilize this book to help raise money for the actual production of "kimber" the pilot. This is by far my most favorite piece that I have written. To see it come to life in both a comic and a pilot would be a dream come true for me. 

Your contributions will help make this dream happen. To have others involved with my art is so special to me and my gratitude for all of the love and support is to no end. 

What I need and what you'll get

I am trying to raise $3,000 to get the best possible artist to execute this book. I want this project to be powerful enough to get everyone really excited for the pilot I want to shoot. 
I have some really great Perks too!! I really want to show all of you how much I appreciate your help and support by sending you some fun and awesome "kimber" accessories! I will have stuff like custom stickers, tote bags, a framed image of the cast and more! 
If I don't end up reaching the $3000, I will still use the money I do get to put towards the beginning stages of the book. I am going to keep going until it is finished! 

The Impact

I think there is always something that can be taught in any story. I have developed a storyline about life in high school and the pressures that sex can bring to young life. It is told in a very comedic and light hearted way with a great educational undertone. 

Risks & Challenges

I feel like my biggest challenge thus far has been getting enough of the funds to make this project come to life! With everyones help I know I will be able to achieve my end goal. I am so excited to get started! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word in any way you can! You can use the tools on this website to help share and get others involved to be apart of this on going series! 

Oh yes… there will be more to come!

story:
Update for those who contributed to the cause:
If you are looking on here to wonder what happens next,
Check your email!  :)
I just sent you all a long email that hopefull answers all questions...

Hello there everyone else!
Over 6,000 people checked out this page but only a few contributed.  If you are curious about this going forward (WHICH IT IS) you can follow me on Twitter @trilogycomesin3 or on Facebook on the "The Supers: 3rd Best SuperTeam in the World" page.  I will be launching a Supers website at some point soon, so look for "TheSuperscomic.com".  Here's to the future!

Chris Morris
creator of The Supers: 3rd Best SuperTeam in the World

-------------------------

DON'T LEAVE THE PAGE BEFORE YOU CHECK OUT THE GALLERY!  OVER 75 IMAGES TO LOOK AT!  AND MORE ON THE WAY!

Update: This is an amazing video that my great friend Alejandro Castro made for the campaign!  Take a look, then Like, Share, Contribute...


CHECK OUT THE GALLERY!!! LOTS OF UPDATES SINCE THE CAMPAIGN ENDED!!!!

Update: All you $20 donors will be getting this! Kaiju pinup by guest artist Max Henriquez

Update: Page 6 pencils are in!


Update: Page 5 is DONE!


Update: A cool write-up for us from the "They Stand on Guard" blog!  Take a gander!

http://theystandonguard.blogspot.ca/

Update: Page #4 finished!


Update: Page #3 finished (yes there is a reason we skipped Page #2)


Update: Page #1 finished!


Update: Found this article online: IF YOU ARE AFRAID TO CONTRIBUTE, DON'T WORRY I WON'T BECOME THIS GUY...
http://www.bleedingcool.com/2014/02/28/kickstarter-fail-john-campbell-burns-comics-rather-than-sending-them-to-donors/
or maybe I will...I don't think so...I guess we'll see come Aprilish of next year!  :)

"Daddy, how come no one makes good super hero comics anymore?"
Please forgive my fake daughter and this made up question...but she kinda does have a good point, despite not actually existing.  Other than Gail Simone, Mark Waid, Matt Fraction, Dan Slott and a few others I can't think of at the moment, super hero comics have gone downhill.  Some comic book studios don't even publish anything spandex related.  At times it seems DC and Marvel have the exclusive on capes and their adventures.  Search Indiegogo or any other crowdfunding sites and see how many people are trying to fund their very-own super hero comic books.  I think it's time for us to take back the term "Comic books" and again make it synonymous with people wearing multi-coloured tights and their underwear on the outside.  Who's with me?

BWAHAHAHAHAHA!!!!

My name is Chris Morris and to me, "Bwahahaha" used to be, as Billy Idol would say, a "Rebel Yell", to a generation of comic book fans.  "Bwahahaha" meant you had a comic book in your hands that included action, superheroics, drama, great characters, but most importantly, HUMOUR!  AND FUN TOO!  Is this even TRUE?  Am I misquoting Billy Idol?  Am I OVERSTATING things to create CONTROVERSY and GET ATTENTION?  Am I using NOSTALGIA to get YOUR attention?  Am I simply abusing the CAPS LOCK button?

The Supers team selfie; art by Ricky Gunawan; characters created by Chris Morris

But anyways, we were talking about comic books right?

When I think of BWAHAHAHA I think of "Justice League International", "The Marvel Cinematic Universe", "The Justice League Unlimited" animated show, "The Flash" TV show but not much else.  Too few in my opinion.

BUT WE CAN CHANGE THAT AND BRING BWAHAHAHA BACK!

But let's get back to why we are here....

WELCOME TO OUR CORNER OF THE COMICS-VERSE...
"The Supers" or "The Super-Freaks", as some call them behind their backs, are a team of International Superheroes that fight bad guys but also fight amongst themselves over who left the toilet seat up.  The heroes, representing Canada, Australia, Sweden, South Africa (specifically Kenya), Ireland, Japan and the United States, wear colourful costumes that are designed by focus groups, tweet while they are on adventures, and make money on the side. They make appearances at Fan Expos and Comic Conventions, all the while doing their best to protect their 'brand", their "image", and continue to climb the Superhero Team rankings.  Did I mention they also save the world?  Cause they do that too, although it doesn't come up as often as you'd think…

The Boys "Brokebacking" for a change...page 2, 1st draft version
*since this picture was originally taken, Banshee, due to legal reasons, has had to change her name to The Wisp.  Legally, we can't say why.  We'll let you speculate freely on the internet...you're welcome.

This campaign is to get issue #1 into production.  It will be 36 pages long (possibly longer if we hit stretch goals), full colour with the opening chapter of our story that will hopefully last for years to come.  There will also be a few fun things thrown in as well, such as a parody of old school Hostess ads and Who's Who style character bios.  The plan is for the adventures of Celsius, Inferno, Starka, Ace and the rest of The Supers to be a monthly series....IF everything goes according to plan, of course...

The story begins with our team of International heroes having just lost their leader, The Eagle, and getting a sympathy bump in the ratings to #3 in the overall listings.  This ignites (sort-of) friendly rivalries with other super-teams and a whole new set of responsibilities for this rag tag group.  They aren't your typical super-heroes.  Outback has anger issues.  The Wisp suffers from lack of confidence and depression.  Kaiju is the most kick-ass member of the group but also trying to be a super-mommy at the same time to little Lian.  Celsius is trying to cope with being team leader and also OCD when it comes to things being clean.  Starka has ADHD and can't stop tweeting and taking selfies, even during missions.  Inferno has severe anxiety once her powers are "turned on" as she doesn't want to really hurt anyone, especially her friends and teammates.  The Doc, their inventor and team physician, writes prescriptions with backwards letters.  Ace is the team pilot and frankly the most emotionally balanced person on the team but she is in a wheelchair.  They all have their problems and they deal with them the best they can, all while fighting of villains and alien invasions.  But don't expect alot of that...it's not that kind of comic book...

WHY DO I NEED TO TELL THIS STORY?
For the past few years, since DC Comics launched the New 52 (coincidentally), I've had less and less motivation to buy comics.  Comic books have brought joy to my life ever since I was a child and these past few years, I have felt the need for change.  But instead of just complaining about it online, I decided to try to be part of the solution.  It's taken two years but finally Ricky and I have enough material put together to properly show what I intend to do with this comic book.  And what is that?  Despite being a white guy named Chris, I believe in the need for diversity in comics.  Why can't we have strong female characters?  Why can't we have superheroes that have skin colour other than caucasian?  Why can't there be fat superheroes, superheroes with disabilities, superheroes with alopecia, LGBT superheroes...hell, why not left-handed superheroes...no sorry that's too far, I lost myself a bit...sorry
Why can't there be superheroes for everyone?  There should be.  I want everyone to have their own superhero.  Starting with this comic...

We Need Money to Make This Happen!
If we reach our Goal, we will make comic books and then give them to you to read!  For Keepzies!  It's really that simple...

And in this modern world where we no longer have to go down the yellow brick road and beg the Wizard for permission to publish a comic book anymore, there are still limitations.  That's why I am here.  To raise money and to also share my dreams to bring this comic book (and potentially a series of them) to reality.

This is how we deal with "Fridging" around here...

How You Can Help

A donation to the cause would be awesome, of course!  But sharing this link on Facebook, Twitter, or whatever social media outlet you prefer would also be great and help us get closer to our goal!  After all, if we don't make enough money to complete the goal, you won't get to read this comic book....  :)

#TheSupers
#BWAHAHAHA
#funnybooks
#weretakingitback
#3rdbest
#everyonedeservesasuperhero
