My name is Chris Morris and to me, "Bwahahaha" used to be, as Billy Idol would say, a "Rebel Yell", to a generation of comic book fans.  "Bwahahaha" meant you had a comic book in your hands that included action, superheroics, drama, great characters, but most importantly, HUMOUR!  AND FUN TOO!  Is this even TRUE?  Am I misquoting Billy Idol?  Am I OVERSTATING things to create CONTROVERSY and GET ATTENTION?  Am I using NOSTALGIA to get YOUR attention?  Am I simply abusing the CAPS LOCK button?


The Supers team selfie; art by Ricky Gunawan; characters created by Chris MorrisBut anyways, we were talking about comic books right?When I think of BWAHAHAHA I think of "Justice League International", "The Marvel Cinematic Universe", "The Justice League Unlimited" animated show, "The Flash" TV show but not much else.  Too few in my opinion.BUT WE CAN CHANGE THAT AND BRING BWAHAHAHA BACK!But let's get back to why we are here....WELCOME TO OUR CORNER OF THE COMICS-VERSE..."The Supers" or "The Super-Freaks", as some call them behind their backs, are a team of International Superheroes that fight bad guys but also fight amongst themselves over who left the toilet seat up.  The heroes, representing Canada, Australia, Sweden, South Africa (specifically Kenya), Ireland, Japan and the United States, wear colourful costumes that are designed by focus groups, tweet while they are on adventures, and make money on the side. They make appearances at Fan Expos and Comic Conventions, all the while doing their best to protect their 'brand", their "image", and continue to climb the Superhero Team rankings.  Did I mention they also save the world?  Cause they do that too, although it doesn't come up as often as you'd think…
The Boys "Brokebacking" for a change...page 2, 1st draft version*since this picture was originally taken, Banshee, due to legal reasons, has had to change her name to The Wisp.  Legally, we can't say why.  We'll let you speculate freely on the internet...you're welcome. This campaign is to get issue #1 into production.  It will be 36 pages long (possibly longer if we hit stretch goals), full colour with the opening chapter of our story that will hopefully last for years to come.  There will also be a few fun things thrown in as well, such as a parody of old school Hostess ads and Who's Who style character bios.  The plan is for the adventures of Celsius, Inferno, Starka, Ace and the rest of The Supers to be a monthly series....IF everything goes according to plan, of course...The story begins with our team of International heroes having just lost their leader, The Eagle, and getting a sympathy bump in the ratings to #3 in the overall listings.  This ignites (sort-of) friendly rivalries with other super-teams and a whole new set of responsibilities for this rag tag group.  They aren't your typical super-heroes.  Outback has anger issues.  The Wisp suffers from lack of confidence and depression.  Kaiju is the most kick-ass member of the group but also trying to be a super-mommy at the same time to little Lian.  Celsius is trying to cope with being team leader and also OCD when it comes to things being clean.  Starka has ADHD and can't stop tweeting and taking selfies, even during missions.  Inferno has severe anxiety once her powers are "turned on" as she doesn't want to really hurt anyone, especially her friends and teammates.  The Doc, their inventor and team physician, writes prescriptions with backwards letters.  Ace is the team pilot and frankly the most emotionally balanced person on the team but she is in a wheelchair.  They all have their problems and they deal with them the best they can, all while fighting of villains and alien invasions.  But don't expect alot of that...it's not that kind of comic book...WHY DO I NEED TO TELL THIS STORY?For the past few years, since DC Comics launched the New 52 (coincidentally), I've had less and less motivation to buy comics.  Comic books have brought joy to my life ever since I was a child and these past few years, I have felt the need for change.  But instead of just complaining about it online, I decided to try to be part of the solution.  It's taken two years but finally Ricky and I have enough material put together to properly show what I intend to do with this comic book.  And what is that?  Despite being a white guy named Chris, I believe in the need for diversity in comics.  Why can't we have strong female characters?  Why can't we have superheroes that have skin colour other than caucasian?  Why can't there be fat superheroes, superheroes with disabilities, superheroes with alopecia, LGBT superheroes...hell, why not left-handed superheroes...no sorry that's too far, I lost myself a bit...sorryWhy can't there be superheroes for everyone?  There should be.  I want everyone to have their own superhero.  Starting with this comic...We Need Money to Make This Happen!If we reach our Goal, we will make comic books and then give them to you to read!  For Keepzies!  It's really that simple...And in this modern world where we no longer have to go down the yellow brick road and beg the Wizard for permission to publish a comic book anymore, there are still limitations.  That's why I am here.  To raise money and to also share my dreams to bring this comic book (and potentially a series of them) to reality.This is how we deal with "Fridging" around here... How You Can HelpA donation to the cause would be awesome, of course!  But sharing this link on Facebook, Twitter, or whatever social media outlet you prefer would also be great and help us get closer to our goal!  After all, if we don't make enough money to complete the goal, you won't get to read this comic book....  :)#TheSupers#BWAHAHAHA#funnybooks#weretakingitback#3rdbest#everyonedeservesasuperhero

story:
Summary

The Commander is about survival and the tough decisions a man has to make who is by the circumstances and severity of the crisis forced to take on a leadership role accepting the arduous task of trying to save as many lives as they possibly can.

In Russia, a highly dangerous pathogen breaks out.


In the first stages of the disease the individual becomes  psychotically hostile.



This quickly results in mayhem in the streets.



Making matters worse is the discovery that the last stage of the disease is irreversible genetic damage.  Victims of the disease slowly descend into complete madness and in the final stages lose their very humanity becoming the stuff of nightmares.


In this darkest hour one military leader manages to hold parts of Moscow with his troops restoring some stability. 


As the deadly disease spreads throughout the world, the city under his control becomes a rallying point for the remaining resistance. 

The Commander is beautifully illustrated comic book project produced by the hard-working, talented people working for Red King Press, an up and coming Indy comic book company which prides itself on being innovative and as resourceful as they can possibly be with the tools at their disposal.  They truly believe the Commander # 1 is a project for which print copies should be made readily available and to do that they are asking for your support.

What we need & what you get

We are wanting to have printed physical copies of the Commander # 1 made available. A full-color full-sized comic that reflects the level of quality that has been a mainstay of this project from the beginning.  To carry this out we are wanting to start with a first print run of a 1,000 copies which will require $2,300 plus an extra $700 for shipping.  We also have a marketing team in place which requires $500 to properly promote and market such a deserving comic.


Other Ways you can Help.

We at Red King fully understand that some people out there just aren't able to give their financial support to get this print run of the Commander # 1 accomplished, but with that said we would still very much appreciate your support and any help you can give helping to get the word out about this project and funding attempt.

story:
PRESENTAZIONE DEL PROGETTO

Realizzare un fumetto non è una cosa semplice. Dietro ad ogni storia c'è il lavoro, il sudore e la passione di più persone.

Un fumetto o graphic novel, come amano chiamarle adesso, è il frutto del lavoro di ingegno e dell'arte. Shakespeare's Wine ha avuto una lunga gestazione.

Per pensarlo e scriverlo ci sono voluti anni, tra lo studio delle teorie storiche e la riscrittura delle diverse versioni. Fino a quella finale.

La storia ufficiale ci narra che Wiliam Shakespeare, nonostante le molte opere ambientate in Italia, non abbia mai messo veramente piede nel bel paese. Ora però, grazie alle scoperte di due studiosi e a un ritrovamento importantissimo, tutte le teorie del passato rischiano di essere spazzate via. In un antico casolare nella Contea di Staffordshire è stata ritrovata una antichissima bottiglia di vino veronese, appartenuta al Bardo inglese.

Gli studi dell’archeologa Laura Fazi, grazie anche alle carte ritrovate la fanno risalire ad un dono di due “Mercanti di Verona”. Questa incredibile scoperta merita di essere mostrata al mondo e quale migliore occasione del Vinitaly; la più grande fiera enologica, conosciuta in tutto il mondo.

A pochi giorni della presentazione ufficiale la bottiglia viene rubata e una serie di omicidi sconvolge la manifestazione. Tutto sembra perduto, la Fiera ha perso la sua principale attrazione e dottoressa Fazi il lavoro di una vita intera.

I ladri però, non hanno fatto i conti con un uomo. Un giovane critico enogastronomico dallo spirito indomito oltre che alcolico: il suo nome è Howard Sterling. La sua presenza a Verona è molto semplice, per lavoro deve recensire la qualità delle nuove annate e soprattutto raccontare ai lettori d’oltre oceano di “Good Wine” (la rivista di cui è collaboratore), della bottiglia di Shakespeare. 

Sarà proprio lui, tra un assaggio e l’altro, tra una ricetta e un disastro a recuperare il prezioso manufatto. Scoprendo così un complotto molto più grande e soprattutto, il mistero del drammaturgo inglese e la sua passione per gli indovinelli.

ENGLISH VERSION

To realize a Graphic novel is not a simple task. Behind every story, we find the effort and the passion of many people, their sweat and tears. Between the study of historical theories and rewriting repeatedly a different version of the subject, it took years to think and put down the final text of “Shakespeare’s wine”.

The official history tells us that Shakespeare, despite many of his works are settled in Italy, never actually set foot in this beautiful country.

Now, the disclosures of two scholars and a very important discovery are likely to sweep away all the theories of the past. In an old farmhouse in the Staffordshire’s county, was found a very old bottle of wine from Verona, belonged to the Immortal Bard.

Thanks to archeologist Laura Fazi, and the papers she’s found in her studies, the precious bottle is now regarded as a gift, made from two “Merchants of Verona” to the playwright.


This incredible discovery deserves to be shout out to the world, and what better occasion than Vinality!!! The largest wine fair, known throughout this planet!

However, a few days before its official presentation, the bottle was stolen; and a series of mysterious murders turns upside down the event. All seems lost. Dr. Fazi’s work of a lifetime, and Vinality’s main attraction were gone. The thieves, however, have not deal with a man. A young wine critic, indomitable of spirit, as well as fond of spirits. His name: Howard Sterling. Working for “Good Wine”, a magazine of which is a collaborator, Howard’s came to Verona to review the quality of new vintages, but most of all to tell the readers overseas about Shakespeare’s bottle.

It will be him, between a taste of wine and the other, a recipe and a disaster, to recover the precious artifact, discovering a conspiracy much extended than he thought, and finally reveal the mystery that surround the English Playwright and his passion for riddles.

PERCHE' ABBIAMO BISOGNO DI VOI

La quota che a voi permetterà a voi di portarvi la copia della nostra graphic novel, a cui noi crediamo molto, ci permetterà di coprire i costi di disegno, impaginazioni e tutto ci che concerne la grafica. Costi di stampa di copie cartacea che oltre a quelle della vendita ci permetterà di presentare Shakespeare's wine a fiere e eventi sul mondo del fumetto.

Inoltre, per la realizzazione dei diversi gadget e la traduzione in inglese professionale per il mercato estero.

Abbiamo cercato di ridurre i costi al minimo per offrire il prodotto migliore.

Coloro che decideranno di acquistare almeno una copia cartacea, avranno diritto ad uno sconto su quella della prossima avventura di Howard Sterling che verrà realizzata in caso di successo di Shakespeare's wine. 

WHY 'WE NEED YOU

The fee that you will allow you to bring a copy of our graphic novel, to which we very much believe, will allow us to cover the costs of design, layouts and all that concerns the graphic. Costs of printing paper copies that in addition to those of the sale will allow us to present Shakespeare's wine fairs and events in the world of comics.

In addition, for the realization of the different gadgets and professional English translation for the foreign market.

We tried to reduce costs to a minimum in order to offer the best product.

Those who decide to buy at least one copy, will be entitled to a discount on the next adventure of Howard Sterling will be made in case of success of Shakespeare's wine.


I DUE AUTORI

MATTIA CAGALLI

32 anni con la passione del cinema, la scrittura e il fumetto. Qualche corso di scrittura creativa e corsi di regia ma alla fine l’esperienza di autodidatta è stata la mia vera scuola.

Come dice Quentin Tarantino: per fare film bisogna vederne il più possibile e carpire il lavoro, cosa c’è dietro quelle immagini. Dopo qualche sceneggiatura, dei romanzi (Grado alcolico 45° - storia senza senso con poco sesso e molto alcol su tutti. Pubblicato nel 2007) e dei cortometraggi, arriva l’idea di Shakespeare’s wine.

Nata come sceneggiatura per il cinema, con John Belushi come ipotetico protagonista nella testa, si è trasformata con il tempo in una graphic novel.

Da qui la ricerca di una collaborazione alla matita, le mie capacità “disegnatorie” sono infatti un insulto a quest’arte e quindi l’incontro con Davide Bozza. Qualche disegno di esempio, qualche tavola prove e… Il resto è storia. 

DAVIDE BOZZA

Ciao a tutti, sono Davide, ho 28 anni, sono napoletano e sono 8 mesi che ho ripreso a disegnare dopo una lunga astinenza. Premetto subito che sono autodidatta, non ho mai frequentato, nemmeno per sbaglio, scuole, corsi, centri di recupero che riguardassero il disegno o l'arte in generale. Per cause di forza maggiore (disoccupazione) sono ritornato a riprendere molto più frequentemente penne e matite, ho aperto una prima pagina facebook e ho subito avuto le prime collaborazioni.

La mia pagina David Draft (Davide Bozza in inglese) raccolgo tutti i miei lavori che, variano per stili e soggetti. Vado dalle caricature per le pergamene di laurea ai fumetti veri e propri. Insieme a una mia ex collega di call center, abbiamo deciso di raccogliere tutte le assurde ma vere telefonate che lei attualmente oggi riceve, per creare un personaggio che le condividesse sotto forma di fumetto.

Così nasce "Pronto?Soccorso!!", la mia prima webcomic! In cantiere, per il 2015, ho anche altre idee che seguono il filo del fumetto/comic-strip ma intanto lungo il mio nuovo percorso ho conosciuto Mattia, lo sceneggiatore di Shakspeares' Wine con il quale abbiamo dato vita a una collaborazione.

Il frutto di questo sodalizio è proprio l’avventura del giornalista enogastronomico Howard Sterling.

ATTENZIONE INFO SPEDIZIONI / INFO SHIPMENT

I costi di spedizione per l'Italia sono già compresi nelle varie ricompense (anche con gadget) . 
Per tutti i finanziatori residenti in Unione Europea e extra Europa, è consigliato contattarci a shakespearewine@gmail.com per definire, caso per caso, i costi di spedizione che possono variare dal paese.

Per ogni altra info non esitate a contattateci via mail: shakespearewine@gmail.com
Tutti i contenuti digitali e cartacei sono disponibili in italiano o inglese.

Shipping cost are included for Italy (also with gadget). For all
backer resident within the European Union and outside Europe is
recommended contact us at shakespearewine@gmail.com for define
case-by-case basis the shipping cost that may vary depending on the
country. For any other information, please don't hesitate to contact
us via mail: shakespearewine@gmail.com.
All digital and paper content are available in italian or in english version.

story:
UPDATE!!! - LEGION OF THE UNDEAD SNEAK PEEK: 

After some re-drafts, we're finally finishing up the last few pages of art in the 64-page book. If you contributed at the Legion of the Undead perk level, there's a good chance you might see a zombie that looks familiar. See if you can spot yourself.

 

(Cover page)

Zombiraq: War of the Undead

Some of the oldest accounts of the dead raising from their graves to feast on human flesh can be traced back to the Middle East. During the Golden Age of Islam, a collection of tales called One Thousand and One Nights (sometimes known as Arabian Nights) was compiled. In the early 1700's, those stories were translated and captivated English-speaking audiences for the first time.  

Centuries later, Zombiraq (Pronounced "Zomb-ee-rok") tells the story of a specialized Air Force detachment sent to Northern Iraq as reinforcements for a strained infantry company to combat a rising insurgency. When they arrive, they discover the ruthless militant group that they came to eradicate may be the least of their worries. 

Behind the Comic Book

In 2007, Dylan Park spent a life-changing year in Iraq. It was there that he witnessed both the beauty of the human spirit and the horrors of war. The time spent overseas, in some of the most deplorable conditions imaginable, would be the catalyst for his budding writing career. 

One night during a patrol, while seeking shelter within the walls of an ancient cemetery, he pondered to himself how a graveyard could feel like the safest place in that country. It was an eye-opening epiphany that highlighted how atrocious one's circumstances really could be--admittedly, conditions that were previously foreign to Dylan. With the right combination of imagination, fatigue, and fear, it was there, in that graveyard, where the idea for Zombiraq was dreamt up. 

After completing his 6-year stint in the military, graduating from film school, and gaining real world experience in Los Angeles, Dylan decided he wanted to put his story on paper.  He developed a colorful universe, wrote the manuscript, and sought to find the right artist for the job. Following countless hours of research, he finally found an illustrator who fit perfectly with the project--Daniel Reneau. Not only is Dan a phenomenal artist, he shared an excitement for the project that was integral.  

The two exchanged hundreds of emails--story ideas, concept art, everything--and after reviewing some offers from publishers, ultimately decided that crowdfunding the first two issues of their new comic series would be the best route... 

 

 

 

The Mission

The 732nd has one mission: to save humanity by defeating the hordes of undead. The creators of Zombiraq:War of the Undead have another: to entertain the audience with beautiful artwork, original storylines, and rich character development. That should be the goal of any comic book or graphic novel, right? 

Today, the average American can't turn on the TV or browse the web without seeing images of death and destruction--some of which is obvious fear mongering  from politicians and the media. Zombiraq merges Middle America's topical fear of a violent terrorist organization with the nightmare-inducing images of the dead rising from the graves to feast on the living. 

Honestly, what could be more frightening than a zombie wearing a suicide vest?

Using his firsthand experience of combat, Dylan employs the drama and intensity of warfare with the horror of an impending zombie apocalypse.  But no comic is complete without artwork that evokes emotion. Dan's attention to detail and vibrant coloring brings the words to life--or death, if you will. 

Zombiraq seeks to provide comic book fans with a unique take on the ever popular horror narrative.  

The Creative Team 

Dylan Park - Creator, Writer - Dylan currently lives in Santa Monica, CA, where he is participating in a fellowship at AMC Networks (note: he is a self-proclaimed Walking Dead fanboy, and this is his dream gig) and learning the intricacies of the television writing and development process. After serving in the military for 6 years,  he graduated from Arizona State with a BA in Film and Media, and is currently finishing grad school at the University of Southern California. 
Daniel Reneau - Artist, Letterer, and Colorist - Daniel is a Denver-based illustrator who is skilled in a variety of artistic disciplines and genres, using both traditional and digital mediums, with a focus on comic book art along with sci-fi and fantasy illustration. He is a winner of the 2013 L. Ron Hubbard Illustrators of the Future award, as well as the first place winner of the ‘Super 8 Comic Contest’, which was sponsored and juried by Paramount Pictures and DC Comics.

 

Why We Need Your Help...

Simply put, producing and releasing quality work is expensive. And publishers often take advantage of first-time authors because of this. Without going into too much detail, a lot of book publishers offer new writers contracts that leave them at a severe disadvantage--small advances, low royalty percentages, and perhaps most importantly, the author often loses the rights to their own work. 
At first glance, one might ask, "Why do you need $10k to produce a comic series?" Here's the answer: $10k isn't even for the entire comic series, it's simply to produce the first double-issue. 
The breakdown: Before printing fees and shipping fees, the artist needs to be paid first. The current market rate for a professional comic book illustrator is $200-300/page. So, for two 30-page issues, you're already looking at $12,000--on the low end. Add another $2,000 for printing costs, $1,000 for shipping, and you can see that we're not in this to "get rich quick." We really just want the world to see and enjoy our work without having to sell our souls (and rights) to a giant corporation.  

We have plans to release an original 6-issue comic book series. But that doesn't happen without a tremendous start. With your help, we can/will do that.

 

 

Now The Fun(d) Part

We're offering several amazing perks for different levels of contribution, starting with high resolution digital copies of our special edition double-issue debut. Rewards also include: signed printed hard copies of the comic, contributor names in the back of the comic, signed art prints, custom art (send us a portrait and we'll make you a zombie), and we even have a perk where you have a chance to become a character in the comic. 

Due to cost, the initial offering of the comic will be a color cover and black and white interior. If we're fortunate enough to make 150% of our goal, we'll offer the comic with a full color cover and interior. 

On the flip side, even if we don't meet our goal, we will still try and fill all of the orders to the best of our abilities. If not, we'll offer refunds.  We'll take a  loss before we'll cancel an order, but we don't anticipate that happening.   

 

 

Concept Art

(Zombie portrait perk sketches)

 

 

The Teaser From the Original Pilot 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that everyone's financial situation is different. If you're low on funds but dig the Zombiraq project, sharing this page on your social media platforms like  Facebook, Twitter, and Reddit are all amazing ways to help! We appreciate everything you do to help our dreams become reality. 

 

Thank you in advance for your support. Salute!
story_txt:
UPDATE!!! - LEGION OF THE UNDEAD SNEAK PEEK: 
After some re-drafts, we're finally finishing up the last few pages of art in the 64-page book. If you contributed at the Legion of the Undead perk level, there's a good chance you might see a zombie that looks familiar. See if you can spot yourself.

 

(Cover page)
Zombiraq: War of the Undead
Some of the oldest accounts of the dead raising from their graves to feast on human flesh can be traced back to the Middle East. During the Golden Age of Islam, a collection of tales called One Thousand and One Nights (sometimes known as Arabian Nights) was compiled. In the early 1700's, those stories were translated and captivated English-speaking audiences for the first time.  
Centuries later, Zombiraq (Pronounced "Zomb-ee-rok") tells the story of a specialized Air Force detachment sent to Northern Iraq as reinforcements for a strained infantry company to combat a rising insurgency. When they arrive, they discover the ruthless militant group that they came to eradicate may be the least of their worries. 
Behind the Comic Book

story:
DJ Dirty Brown, a woman of mixed race (African-American/Caucasian) in her early 20s, is one of the hottest DJs in town.  She is sexy, sharp and bursting with charisma -- a club queen who drives around the city in a cement truck. She has modified it to serve as both home and recording studio.  This is also the story of an ancient, magical green stone "Dirty’s inspiration" which she wears around her neck.  At first, Dirty is unaware of the stone’s power, imbued by a shaman with jungle sounds and African rhythms as part of a plan to preserve African musical heritage.

 

               I was born in Nigeria, but my family moved to Israel when I was eight years old. I live in Tel Aviv with my husband, Miki, a photographer and documentary director and our two boys. Writing children’s books has been my passion ever since I became a mother. Children are an endless source of inspiration and joy, and they can teach adults so much about life. Our children are our true spiritual guides. Being a staunch optimist, I believe that we have the power to influence reality and shape our own lives, and I wish to convey this through my writing. 

Afro-American music consists of numerous rhythms like  funk, soul, reggae, hip-hop, and rock and roll. In their tradition, there is a heavy emphasis on the drum for producing really amazing sounds. Marabi music is played on pianos. The specialty of this traditional music is that it is passed down orally (or aurally) and not written anywhere. This Music has inspired this comic, and the lady DJ and Superheroine. 

Who I am and Why I made this

           I am Tammy Elkeles, a young Woman who wants to realize her dream of writing books and comics.  Ever since I was a kid, I've believed that the best part of anything is laughter, that most pure sense of happiness.  My goal is to create this comic and more, all to bring people happiness and spread the joy I've felt in reading stories that have helped me through rough times.  All I need is the equipment and a chance.

I love to write delightful short stories for children.  I started to write these when I gave birth to my first child.  I believe that small kids are a never-ending origin of encouragement and humor as they provide us valuable lessons about life and nature. I have already published seven children books that are available on kindle others are still to come.

I have already spent a lot on this project, but I don’t have the budget to fund full development. I will need to improve the first one, again.

The Campaign Idea

            The entire point of this is to share my stories with people, to entertain them.  After this comic, if the equipment holds and people want more, I'll keep writing. This is going to be initial funding, and I won't need anything beyond basic equipment. So, unless I've been run out of the country, I'll keep making comics for you, even bigger and better than before.

The Comic

             The world where magic never died and wondrous creatures roam, enjoying the ease of technology. A Woman simply known as The DJ of her Town wields immense power. Its target audience is teenagers, as well as adults who are young at heart. This adventure draws from elements of contemporary dance music, suspense, investigation, African folklore, time travel, computerized virtual worlds, magic, love, and humor.

     

                     Inspiration stems from a character established in my mind, and then I began to figure out and analyze her. Dirty Brown is the lead and heroine of the comic. I’ve drawn upon my love of music, movies, and theater, to make this character more creative. Firstly, I thought to make her a rocking magnum opus, but after that to make her more special and the series interesting, I add a twist to it.  She is blessed with a miraculous stone having natural powers of musical sounds and rhythms that she applies in remixes to make unique and melodious songs, but she is unaware of the stone’s power.

Storyboard Sample....................

        DJ Dirty Brown, You’re making a lot of awesome things happen! Firstly, you are approaching a genuine, lively, entertaining, and expressive comic series.  Secondly, you’re blazing the path for more comics like this one, proclaiming to the world that it is just the style we need to see more of.

Undoubtedly, you are supporting a dream come true for those who most need and want to see the growth of this project.  We believe that difference in this comic production will make it superior, and we hope you do, too.  By encouraging me and my team, you are also helping the growth of women’s interests in the comic world.

     

                    This is a story series about a mysterious stone and a Lady DJ searching for her self-esteem.  As every magical story gets complete with only magical twists, such is this series: a fusion of science and fiction that you will love to read.  This series is all about a Lady DJ who loves her life, and her recording studio.  This is also a story about a green stone that has hidden powers to control rhythm and can produce rare jungle sounds imbued upon it for the preservation of ancient music and customs.

 

         I've already printed samples out of pocket, This is a comic of 13 issues but we are asking funds for printing 6 issues, marketing, and transportation at this inital stage. I will be dearly grateful to our crowd for their help towards continuing the process of this exclusive comic without pause. We want everything related to this comic completed soon so that it can be shared with everyone.

If we reach our targeted goal in this campaign, we will have sufficient funds to take DJ Dirty Brown to more conferences- a crucial task for a comic’s advancement.  In exchange for your valuable support, you'll be able to select some basic rewards and some really surprising packages.

Right now! We need more funds to keep our DJ Dirty Brown series alive.If you still have queries, feel free to ask us, we are always here to provide you the best details.

 

For the Upcoming Issues we need $35,000  to cover expenses:

 

About Perks:

We will able to fulfill perks if we received $15K at least. If we get 5k, then First two issues printed PDF can be delivered, If we get 10k, then we can deliver printed copies of first 2 issues. and so on...
 

Help Us Make More!

 

We love DJ Dirty Brown, and we think you will too.  We've made the first comic "DJ Dirty Brown" with stunning art by Yishan Li and our second is ready to print. We need your help to print and distribute the first two issues.  If this Indiegogo campaign is a success, we'll be able to make more DJ Dirty Brown comics!                                                          

                        IN THE END

This fundraiser is about breathing life into characters that demand it, and giving art a chance to shine on its own. If you cannot contribute, please share and help it find its audience.

story:
What is Plume Snake?


Coming February, 29th, 2016! Plume Snake is a membership-based digital archive of creator-owned comics and graphic novels. For $5 a month, members will have access to all of the titles Plume Snake distributes, as well as exclusive content, like:

  • Ask me anythings with Plume Snake creators
  • Craft tips from Plume Snake writers and illustrators
  • Creator interviews
  • And titles found no where else!

The Preview Issue


My name is Alex Odom, I'm a comic book creator and the president of Plume Snake.  I'm trying to build a better way for comic fans to find great titles and a better market for independent creators to distribute their work. But I need your help raising the rest of the money to hire a company to develop and host a website that will keep members' information secure, and provide them with a user-friendly platform to read comic books and graphic novels. Plume Snake is offering a preview issue (48 pages of illustrations), pre-order memberships, and other great perks to contributors of the campaign.

Here are some pages from the preview issue (see more in the gallery):


Update: An 8-page preview of Tales of Aethera will now be included with the preview issue! See more Aethera pages in the gallery.



Join Our Community!

Plume Snake is dedicated to putting our comic book and graphic novel creators first; that's why Plume Snake's network of creators will receive 60% of net profits from membership sales, and retain the rights to their work. It's my sincere hope that Plume Snake will become a vehicle for many creative people to have the freedom to earn a living doing the work they are most passionate about. Plume Snake has the potential to connect more people with a wide range of different perspectives and illustration styles.

Your contribution will help make that a reality!

  • Our network of creators will be paid 60% of net profits!
  • Our creators retain ALL rights to their work!
  • Plume Snake is focused on creating a platform for people in all communities to tell the stories they are most passionate about!
  • Plume Snake is committed to keeping costs low to connect more fans with the work!

Contributor Perks:

Every Patron of the Comic Arts who contributes $5 to this campaign will receive a PDF file of our exclusive preview issue.


If you would like to pre-order a Plume Snake membership, add:

$9 for a 2 Month Membership

$50 for a 1 Year Membership and Founding Patron Status. Founding Patrons will have early access to titles, and will be asked for input on new titles.


If you’re looking for Plume Snake gear, add:

$25 for a Plume Snake Logo t-shirt and a logo sticker

$25 for 1 of 4 cover design posters of your choice and a logo sticker

1). Last Stop 'til Earth


2). Blanky Bot


3). Pigantula

4). The Lioness


And if you're looking for something special, a $100 will get you 1 of 5 limited edition Plume Snake Dragonling Ornaments made by Emily Zampetti. See some of her other dragonlings:   http://www.emizart.com

And if you’ve had just the right amount to drink, add $250 to have a character in a future issue of Lioness named after you.


In the event that this campaign does not reach the entire goal, each contributor will will still receive the PDF Preview Issue, t-shirt, poster, sticker, and character name rights perks. Each contributor who signs up for one of the pre-order perks will still receive their membership access on Feb. 29th, 2016. In the unlikely event that the website doesn't launch on that date—we'll have bake sales every day, if that's what it takes—each pre-order perk contributor will receive an email packed full of Plume Snake titles for each month they pre-ordered. And when the website launches, Plume Snake will still honor each pre-order membership to the full extent.

In the event that this campaign surpasses the goal, Plume Snake will put the entirety of the surplus toward the production of new titles. Plus, the contributors of this campaign will cast the deciding votes on the new titles Plume Snake will produce!


If You Can't Contribute, You Can Still Help!

We think people want to know about Plume Snake, so even if you can't contribute, you can still help by sharing this with people you know. Drop this link on all the comic book enthusiasts in your life; they'll think you're super thoughtful, and we'll think you're super thoughtful!

You can also help by sharing this campaign, sharing our website:

www.plumesnake.com

And by liking and following us on: 

Facebook.com/PlumeSnakeComics  

Twitter.com/PlumeSnake

www.instagram.com/plumesnakecomics/

But I need your help raising the rest of the money to hire a company to develop and host a website that will keep members' information secure, and provide them with a user-friendly platform to read comic books and graphic novels. Plume Snake is offering a preview issue (48 pages of illustrations), pre-order memberships, and other great perks to contributors of the campaign.


Here are some pages from the preview issue (see more in the gallery):











Update: An 8-page preview of Tales of Aethera will now be included with the preview issue! See more Aethera pages in the gallery.





Join Our Community!
Plume Snake is dedicated to putting our comic book and graphic novel creators first; that's why Plume Snake's network of creators will receive 60% of net profits from membership sales, and retain the rights to their work. It's my sincere hope that Plume Snake will become a vehicle for many creative people to have the freedom to earn a living doing the work they are most passionate about. Plume Snake has the potential to connect more people with a wide range of different perspectives and illustration styles.
Your contribution will help make that a reality!


Our network of creators will be paid 60% of net profits!
Our creators retain ALL rights to their work!
Plume Snake is focused on creating a platform for people in all communities to tell the stories they are most passionate about!
Plume Snake is committed to keeping costs low to connect more fans with the work!


   Contributor Perks:
Every Patron of the Comic Arts who
contributes $5 to this campaign will receive a PDF file of our
exclusive preview issue.

If you would like to pre-order a Plume Snake
membership, add:
$9 for a 2 Month Membership
$50 for a 1 Year Membership and Founding
Patron Status. Founding Patrons will have early access to titles, and will be asked for input on new titles.


If you’re looking for Plume Snake gear, add:
$25 for a Plume Snake Logo t-shirt
and a logo sticker
$25 for 1
of 4 cover design posters of your choice and a logo sticker
1). Last Stop 'til Earth

2). Blanky Bot



3). Pigantula


4). The Lioness


And if you're looking for something special, a $100 will get you 1 of 5 limited edition Plume Snake Dragonling Ornaments made by Emily Zampetti. See some of her other dragonlings:   http://www.emizart.com
And if you’ve had just the right amount to
drink, add $250 to have a character in a future
issue of Lioness named after you.In the event that this campaign does not reach the entire goal, each contributor will will still receive the PDF Preview Issue, t-shirt, poster, sticker, and character name rights perks. Each contributor who signs up for one of the pre-order perks will still receive their membership access on Feb. 29th, 2016. In the unlikely event that the website doesn't launch on that date—we'll have bake sales every day, if that's what it takes—each pre-order perk contributor will receive an email packed full of Plume Snake titles for each month they pre-ordered. And when the website launches, Plume Snake will still honor each pre-order membership to the full extent.
In the event that this campaign surpasses the goal, Plume Snake will put the entirety of the surplus toward the production of new titles. Plus, the contributors of this campaign will cast the deciding votes on the new titles Plume Snake will produce!



If You Can't Contribute, You Can Still Help!

 We think people want to know about Plume Snake, so even if you can't contribute, you can still help by sharing this with people you know. Drop this link on all the comic book enthusiasts in your life; they'll think you're super thoughtful, and we'll think you're super thoughtful!
You can also help by sharing this campaign, sharing our website:
www.plumesnake.com
And by liking and following us on: 
Facebook.com/PlumeSnakeComics  
Twitter.com/PlumeSnake
www.instagram.com/plumesnakecomics/

story:
About this project

The goal of this project is to create a book to present a selection of the very best Doodle artwork in an exclusive production. As additional content, many images are presented with background information, comments by the editor and in-depht stories from the artists themselves.

The Doodle graphics that emerged in the late the 90's beginning has inspired and created a sub-cultural era of Doodling art. This book is an attempt to capture the style and soul from that period of non-profit fellow creativity. 

My name is Nayla Mikayla - also known as Doodle artist . I have been creating Doodle art for over 10 years. My love of illustrations, art and computer graphics are reflected into this book, where my aim has been to elevate pixel art in a stylish format. 

There has been a lack of designed books where doodle art is properly presented. This will be the book that can be presented along other art- or photo books, helping to show off the real potential of Doodle art as well as inspire, impress and inform.

By self-publishing the Masters of doodle Art book I am able to keep the retail cost of the book down, while still producing a book of the highest quality. The only catch of self-publishing is that it is necessary for me to raise the money to print the book and finance shipment of the book. I am turning to the Indiegogo community to help fund the expense involved in producing this book. 

The Masters of Pixel Art book specs:

  • 90 pages, covering 6 great doodle artists.
  • Dimensions: 24 x 30.5 cm (9.5 x 12 inch).
  • Quality product: durable hardback cover with textile finish, highest quality paper.
  • Indiegogo acknowledgement - get your name in the book as an official backer!
  • Clean design and layout.


Price & Time info 

The prize of the book and packages are based on a calculation of:

  • printing cost (production)
  • shipping box and wrapping materials
  • transportation and travels
  • printing of books for the participating artists (their reward for participating in this book!)
  • basic living expenses for me and our team during the project (time spent to complete the project)

It's the most realistic estimate at the current moment to realize this project, with a small amount of wiggle room to account for the unknown.

The book will be bound in march 2016, and the signed copies and other rewards will be shipped directly! (at latests in april 2016)

Doodle Gallery

story:
Summary

Hello and thank you for stopping by! I'm James Bowers and I'm the writer of My Dad, Death. I've been writing for a number of years now and have published two novels. I've always wanted to venture into the world of comic books and have had a very healthy pull list for nearly as long as I've been writing. The idea of My Dad, Death has been gestating since I myself was at high school. I always knew I wanted to bring the supernatural to the real weirdness of growing up but until February of 2016 I didn't know the best way to bring it to life. Then I came across Michelle. Her artwork was very unique and I thought it matched the quirky theme of the story rather well. I chanced my arm and approached her. A funny thing happened. She believed in the project too! A budding collaboration blossomed. 

Michelle Henderson is a Scottish based professional artist and like me, this is her first time working on a full comic book series this involved. She's worked as an artist for a number of years under her Tengu Arts umbrella and can be found working diligently through DeviantArt, Facebook and Twitter. She's awesome and is available for commission.

Our editor is none other than my awesome and supportive wife Natalie who is qualified to do so because she can be painfully straight up about critiques (which as much as they sting we need to make it as good as it can be), has an English Degree and used to write for a magazine publication. 

This Indiegogo campaign is to get the series onto it's feet by raising enough money to get the first issue into production and into your hands. We have four issues scripted and nearly two years of episodic storytelling to get underway and we'd love for you to experience it from the start. So, what is My Dad, Death and why should you care?

The Story

Orion Grymm is just an average, nerdy high school kid who learns his father is the Grim Reaper. Unfortunately for Orion, the role of Grim Reaper is hereditary and now he must train to take over the mantle. The downside; he's not a quick learner and he hasn't got the best teacher. Orion's been given just 6 months to be up to scratch. This could be a problem, especially when his new boss Satan is keeping a close eye on him. Should Isaac and Orion Grymm begin to miss souls, even whilst training, the wayward ones could open up a seam that allows the tormented creatures of hell to leak back into the mortal realm. My Dad, Death is a comic series set in a not too distant future, in a fictional city. It is a dark comedy, dimension hopping adventure that never takes itself too seriously but that won't come at the cost of telling a good story. The project was influenced by the Discworld series, Dan Slott's Spider-Man, Deadpool, I Hate Fairyland, Paper Girls, Gwenpool, Game of Thrones and Black Adder. The series will be a commentary on the real weirdness of the world we live in, how not too distant future technology could affect our lives and how death doesn't have to be the end.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need is your support, trust and anticipation. The target we are aiming for will raise enough money to pay for the artwork and printing costs (and perk fulfilment). My day job is working social media and website literature for a quirky print company so the printing costs are pretty fair because of staff discount (woohoo). 

The perks you'll get for supporting us range from digital issues of the comic to printed and signed issues, exclusive artwork, exclusive Q&A videos, you getting to be a character in the series, exclusive progress updates, unique custom artwork and your name at the back of each issue.

If we don't reach our full goal we will do our best to still bring My Dad, Death to you. Dependent on the costs involved and the amount we receive there is a few different ways we can go. We could go digital only, so no print run, or shorten the size of the issue to try and tell a one shot engaging story. So no matter how well we do, you'll still be getting a My Dad, Death, independent comic, shaped fix in your life.

The Impact

The impact you'll make by helping us reach our goal will be almost unexplainable for us. You'll make this old comic book nerd's dream come true of actually bringing one to life. Indiegogo actually state for this section that I have to 'explain how this project will be valuable to the contributor and the world'. Well, I'm no megalomaniac but I would love to share our stories with the world and Michelle's artwork too. She deserves more exposure. I hope, if we are fortunate enough to pull this off, that it will inspire other independent writers and artists to do the same and chase their dream. Hey if we can do it then, there is no magic formula, anyone can! The dream would be to write comics for a living and getting this comic published would be a HUGE step in that direction and it would get our foot in the door. Down the line we could add more titles to our back catalogue and then eventually be welcoming other creative teams to join us in founding a publishing house (but that's way down the line in fantasy land). At least you know we're not short on ambition.

 

Risks & Challenges

The challenge with raising funds via Indiegogo means that if we reach our goal, once that money is gone it is gone and it will only cover producing the first issue. We do have a plan (you'll be pleased to hear) to keep the series going. If we reach our target then we will approach Indie Publisher Alterna who specialise in supporting Indie comics. It's the best of both worlds as we'll retain the freedom of an Indie venture but with the exposure and backing of a publisher. With Alterna we will still need to fund the series and we plan to do this through the monthly crowdfunding subscription service Patreon (after issue one is already in your hands). 

We are already getting good feedback through social media and have even been recognised (surprisingly) by people within the comic book industry. It's a weird world we live in and it's about to get weirder. Should the first few issues require additional funding I am prepared to put in all I can to make this a success.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, you don't have to contribute at all. The fact you've read this far is awesome enough. Even if you can't or would rather not contribute, we would greatly appreciate you sharing this campaign with friends and family who may be interested. Spreading the world would be assistance enough and we'd send good vibes and warm hugs your way.

story:
Greetings, I am the artist TimeBomb100 and my project, Amerikkkan Slaughterhouse(ASH), is a great fictional tale of a post Apocalyptic Civil war in which the fate of an egalitarian world rest on the shoulders of two children, Prince A'tu, and Princess Genisis. Each page of ASH is a sci-fi adventure into the highly unexplored world of AFRO-STEAMPUNK.

This story involves a Post-Apocalyptic America approximately 1,000 yrs from now.  A nuclear storm has devastated the Earth and was brought about by a global war and an American leader who promised to “MAKE AMRICA GREAT AGAIN”! 

The remaining survivors of the 3rd world attempt to enter America, as it stands as the only bastion of the old world. A “Great Wall” prevents any foreign “Mongrels” from doing so.

America’s elite (those with an abundance of wealth and resources) flee to the Arctic, and into an 80 ton fire, bomb, gas, and radiation proof vault called “Valhalla”.  While there, they genetically graft new bodies for themselves in order to survive the environmental crisis.

Emerging 600 yrs. Later, the IP’s (Ice People) are the new ruling class. Taller, faster, and stronger than the rest of humanity, these highly enhanced meta-beings, along with their advanced senses, animal instincts, nocturnal eyesight, and elemental capabilities are the new predators of the Earth. 

After establishing the N.A.U. (New American Union), The I.P’s (Ice People) create a cast system in order to categorize and rule all others. The cast system consist of Class 1(the Gifted), Class 2(General Laborers), Class 3(The "Jesters"-people who provide sports, entertainment, and work dead-end jobs), Class 4(Slaves), and finally, those who live outside of America's "Great Wall" and have been purged from the caste system..."The MONGRELITES!"

 

Scouting the Outlands(the lands outside of American borders),  two wealthy tycoons by the names of Lord Sirus J. Wingate and Lord Chester O’Malley, come into possession of the two surviving children  of a purged group,..Prince A’tuu and Princess Genisis.  The two tycoons develop plans to breed the pair into an exploited species and used as “pets” for the elite, or as fighters in grueling blood sports. It is completely forbidden to allow “purged” groups into the N.A.U., as they may pose a security threat to the new order.

Out of nowhere, a small band of Mercenaries and assassins emerge from the shadows of the underground to rescue he two children. Known as “the Final Kut (FK)”, this miniature army are the final decadence of a condemned group!

Ruthless and vengeful, the “FK” consist of the highly skilled Lady Kmaat Fatale, the genius Professor Dunbar (Banneker-II), the comedic Coon-C, Doobie, Jamie Turquoise, Phoenix Blak, General Ezra El Marcos, Termite, and the most indestructible being known to man… DOC WOMACK!

A national emergency is declared as a great showdown is pending between America’s past (the “FK”) and America’s future (the IP’s). The entire fate of humanity lay on the prophesized transition of power foretold of TWO YOUNG CHILDREN.

 

This campaign is important due to its level of diversity it conveys as well as its accurate depiction of unapologetic African-American experiences in future decades. ASH serves as both an entity of entertainment as well as a great moment of reflection as it parodies society's imperfections. Contributors will receive the first 12 copies based on the amount of donations, as well as t-shirts, banners and other merchandise from Black Death World Media. I'm currently looking for $1500 in funding. These funds are needed to offset expenses for professional pencilers, inkers, colorist, page editors, publishing and mass distribution.  Although subject matter is edgy due to its ambitious goal of taking on social issues that have plagued this society from its inception, it is import in human evolution to address these matters in order to grow beyond them. This epic sci-fi/social parody follows the same tradition in story telling as The Matrix, Planet of the Apes, and Avatar.

story:
Welcome

December 2016, while enduring the harsh Nebraska winter, I began writing a story. This story is much like the stories and shows we grew up watching on Toonami. However, this story differs from those in many ways:

  • My name is Aaron, but some may also know me as Phelps Vigier. I'm originally from Houston, TX, but I've spent some time dwelling in several other places on this earth: Florida, Kuwait, Nebraska, but for now, I'm back in Texas.
  • If you're anything like me, you grew up watching several animes including super-human beings achieving peace thru several random ballads of terror. DBZ, Yu Yu Hakusho, Pokemon, Sailormoon, Ronin Warriors.. But have you ever had the urge to create an anime of your own?  Problem is, I'm not Japanese. I'm just a half Black, half Mexican American citizen with a hyperactive imagination. But why would I let that stop me? I would like to introduce to you, my friends, XX Zonbi , the graphic novel.
  • Every cent contributed is a cent closer to the completion of this graphic novel, which in good time, will be pitched as an animated series. And honestly guys, I cant do it without you...

Help me make history..

 

  • I'm hoping to raise at least $5,000... That will be enough to illustrate, build a following through marketing strategy, and ensure XX Zonbi is completed in its entirety!
  • Once we establish a solid fan base, I'll launch an assault-style campaign to acquiring funding from a major anime studio such as Funimation 
  • But with your contribution, you deserve some token of appreciation. Therefore, I have established a tier system that rewards you based on your contribution. They will range between $5 - $250... For $5, I can assure you that I deeply appreciate you. For $250 you can become a character in the story line! All this and much more, check the Perks section for more information!
  • An in the event that I do not reach my $5,000 goal, I will still invest whatever I have raised towards this book and do everything I can to stay on schedule. All perks are still promised and will be delivered when available. I will not fail.  

The Impact

This is a vital step to realizing my ultimate dream:

  • An average 25min anime episode costs approximately $200,000... And honestly, I don't have that type of money. But if i can achieve this initial goal, urban and Japanese hybrid animated programs could become the future of television. Imagine having more than just The Boondocks... 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share, and spread the word... help bring XX Zonbi into the light

If you're anything like me, you grew up watching several animes including super-human beings achieving peace thru several random ballads of terror. DBZ, Yu Yu Hakusho, Pokemon, Sailormoon, Ronin Warriors.. But have you ever had the urge to create an anime of your own?  Problem is, I'm not Japanese. I'm just a half Black, half Mexican American citizen with a hyperactive imagination. But why would I let that stop me? I would like to introduce to you, my friends, XX Zonbi , the graphic novel.
Every cent contributed is a cent closer to the completion of this graphic novel, which in good time, will be pitched as an animated series. And honestly guys, I cant do it without you...


Help me make history..
 

I'm hoping to raise at least $5,000... That will be enough to illustrate, build a following through marketing strategy, and ensure XX Zonbi is completed in its entirety!
Once we establish a solid fan base, I'll launch an assault-style campaign to acquiring funding from a major anime studio such as Funimation 
But with your contribution, you deserve some token of appreciation. Therefore, I have established a tier system that rewards you based on your contribution. They will range between $5 - $250... For $5, I can assure you that I deeply appreciate you. For $250 you can become a character in the story line! All this and much more, check the Perks section for more information!
An in the event that I do not reach my $5,000 goal, I will still invest whatever I have raised towards this book and do everything I can to stay on schedule. All perks are still promised and will be delivered when available. I will not fail.  


The Impact
This is a vital step to realizing my ultimate dream:
An average 25min anime episode costs approximately $200,000... And honestly, I don't have that type of money. But if i can achieve this initial goal, urban and Japanese hybrid animated programs could become the future of television. Imagine having more than just The Boondocks... 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please share, and spread the word... help bring XX Zonbi into the light

story:
Short Summary

The Legacy of The View Is about a Teenager who is gifted powers to save his city from an evil force that wants use humanity as a power source. The View really doesn't like being a Hero but he knows  he has to do what has to be done. This Issue is not an origin story one shot, this is just part one out of a 5 part story arc titled "The Pilot". This story will introduce to the characters so you will have more knowledge going into the origin story and the rest of the story which is will 20 plus issues. The Rest of the story is already written just need to made and shipped. 

What We Need & What You Get

What I Need

  • Is Fans & Money to Print and Ship The Book With Extra Perks

What You Get

  • An Exclusive Comic For Indie Go Go Funders Only
  • Excess To The Comic and Items Before Anyone Else
  • Perk Items At A Cheaper Rate than Non-Funders

The Impact 

This Comic is a blend between American Comics and Anime Style Pacing and Theme. This Is My Own Take on The Comic Book Genre. This Comic Also Incorporates The Lifestyle of The Music Industry with The Lifestyle of Being SuperHero. This Comic Will Have Major Impact Because It Be Blending Two Huge Cultures Into One. 

Risks & Challenges

The Only Risks is if the campaign is not completely the extra perks and the exclusive comic won't be made but the comic will still be made and i'll have to come out of pocket for the next issues, but none of that will the story from being told to the fullest. 

The Challenges will be getting Fans and Supporters For a First Time Comic Creator 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You Can Share On Social Media
  • Talk About This To Your Friends and Family
  • Write About On a Blog Site or Comic Forums
  • Offer Me An Interview on Your Internet Show

And that's all there is to it.

 

Sample of The Comic

story:
Tripwire Print Magazine Campaign

Welcome to the Tripwire Print Magazine Campaign. In terms of my background, I am an experienced journalist and editor, who has worked for the world’s best-known magazines, websites and newspapers, covering comics and genre for places like The Times, Variety, Time Magazine, Evening Standard, SFX, Total Film, Digital Spy and many others.

From 1992 to 2013, we published Tripwire as a print magazine. Publishing more than 55 issues in print including annuals in the summer, plus two anniversary books (Tripwirex10 in 2002 and Tripwire at 21 in 2013), Tripwire covered every major comics and genre writer, producer, artist and mover and shaker. From Guillermo del Toro to Frank Miller, Joss Whedon to Matt Groening, Mike Mignola to Alan Moore, Tripwire was there to cover their work and their career.

It started life as a black and white fanzine but became a full colour magazine in 2003. We were the first people to cover DC’s influential Vertigo imprint, interviewing seminal creators like Grant Morrison, Peter Milligan, Frank Quitely, Jamie Delano and many more. We dropped music which we introduced back in 1992 and replaced it with film and TV in 1999.

We built it up into arguably the UK’s premiere magazine that covered comics and its related media with a sizeable international following. Then the market changed in 2013 and we made the decision to switch to the web.

 

The website launched in 2015 and since then our traffic has increased an amazing 4000%.

We are very proud of what we have achieved in five years on the site, becoming the UK’s pre-eminent comics, film and TV site but we have missed producing a print magazine. So over the past year, we have begun to look at doing something new in print with the help of crowdfunding. Indiegogo is the perfect place to help us achieve our goals and so you are reading this now.

Tripwire Magazine Spring Special will be a glossy 144 page A4 squarebound magazine chock full of all manner of great, unique material:

Under two covers (A Flash 80th anniversary cover exclusively created by illustrator David Michael Beck for the direct market and a Kieron Gillen Once and Future cover for those who support us here on indiegogo) the Spring Special contains the kind of material people familiar with Tripwire’s history would expect:

 

• A Flash 80th anniversary feature looking at the history of DC’s Scarlet Speedster
• A Neil Gaiman feature, taking a look at the writer’s long and renowned career including The Sandman, Good Omens and American Gods

•An exclusive Kieron Gillen interview with the writer talking about hit series like Once & Future, Die and The Wicked + The Divine


•A look at 80 years of Batman’s deadliest and most iconic foe, The Joker, star of comics, film and TV


• It will offer a preview of the eagerly awaited second Wonder Woman film, Wonder Woman 1984 in the year that Wonder Woman commemorates its 80th anniversary
• a look at the genesis of horror comics beginning with EC in 1950 right up to the present day with more modern takes like The Sandman and Hellblazer
•Louise Simonson talks about her long career as a writer and as an editor
•The return of Stripwire, Tripwire’s acclaimed strip section which will include work from the likes of Roger Langridge and Andy Bennett, who has drawn a Sherlock Holmes alternate world short created with Tripwire’s editor-in-chief Joel Meadows.
•An exclusive chat with writer Ram V on his work for companies like DC, Vault and Marvel.
•A look at how comic artists like Frank Quitely, Jock, PJ Holden and others create their work using Wacom and Cintique tablets.
•Company profiles of Vault Comics and SelfMade Hero

•A career retrospective on director Richard Stanley (Color Out Of Space)
•A look at New York’s historic Society of llustrators and a chat with its executive director.
•A Lost Tale featuring Gene Ha on a DC series that never was.
•An interview with renowned British illustrator Alistair Little
•An archive section reprinting interviews with the likes of Alan Moore, Frank Miller and Mike Mignola

In fact there is far too much in the issue to list it all here.

This campaign is important to us because it will allow us to return to the format that garnered us our international reputation. Creating for the web is amazing because it offers immediacy and the opportunity to share content instantly but there is something unique about having a physical, tangible object you can hold in your hand. So those who support us here will allow us to achieve this goal and help us to create new quality print journalism. We intend to return to the production values that we achieved with our Annuals from 2007 to 2011, creating an object that is accessible but that people want to have in their possession.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

We have worked out that we require £13,000 from this campaign. We have broken down our expenses that we require to make this work:

We need £4500 to print the magazine. This will allow us to print 144 pages in full colour at the sort of quality we need to offer the full impact of the issue, printing 2000 copies with 1000 copies featuring the Dan Mora Once & Future cover that only people who support us here will get.

We require £2000 to pay an editor and a designer for the project. Editing, commissioning and designing 144 pages is a huge undertaking and the person who does this will need to be paid properly.

We need £1500 to create the unique perks we are offering in this campaign like badges, T-shirts, unique prints featuring Tripwire covers past and present featuring work from the likes of Walter Simonson, Frank Miller, Mike Mignola, a print with our current cover by David Michael Beck and others and other really cool stuff.

We need a further £1000 to pay a number of journalists who will write some of the articles contained in the issue. These writers are all professionals and this is their career and so we feel it is essential they get paid properly for their work.

We also need a further £4000 to get the various perks out to all of our supporters through a professional fulfilment company.

If we don’t hit our entire target, then we would send out the perks ourselves rather than using a fulfilment company and look at scaling back how many we would print. Plus we would also look at saving money by paying the editor and designer a little less.

The Impact

The return of Tripwire to print would see quality print journalism back in an industry where this is harder to find than it used to be. Tripwire has always been proud of creating magazines in print and it would allow us to do this again. It would also hopefully act as a springboard to allow us to return to publishing the magazine on a regular basis again. It would also act as a showcase for creative people’s unique work in print rather than online, offering a glimpse behind the creation process.

We published 55 issues and we garnered a lot of notable fans in the world of comics and genre. Oscar winning director and writer Guillermo Del Toro (The Shape Of Water) said this about Tripwire:”Tripwire has been for nearly three decades the touchstone of comic book culture in the U.K and one of the leading periodicals dedicated to this narrative art form. Incisive, smart and always relevant.”

Best selling author Ian Rankin (Rebus) was equally effusive: “ Still the coolest magazine on the planet, and helping young and old alike fritter away their lives with the best coverage of comics, film and TV.”

Legendary TV writer and producer Mark Verheiden (Ash vs The Evil Dead, Daredevil) was also one of our biggest fans: “TRIPWIRE is essential reading - one of the best on the market”

Finally fantasy grandmaster Michael Moorcock (Elric) had this to say about us: “TRIPWIRE really is a breath of fresh air. Its layouts are superb, with great well-written features perfectly set off by the pictures, adding clarity and intelligence to every page. And it keeps on doing it. Amazing, gratifying. A pleasure to look at, a pleasure to read.”

Our decades in publishing, both print and online, and our involvement over the past three years with the successful Portsmouth Comic Con, means that we feel confident we can deliver a great project. We are also keen to reestablish Tripwire as an advocate and champion of all aspects of pop culture artforms. We do what no other magazine does and we shall continue to do that here.

Risks & Challenges
We know life is tough at the moment and print faces a lot of different challenges. However, we feel that our enthusiasm and love for comics and genre and our almost thirty years experience will allow us to deliver what we have promised here. We know every key figure and mover and shaker in the worlds of comics and genre and feel that this will help us to succeed here. We also know people who run websites and magazines who cover the worlds of comics and genre so they will help us get the word out. So they will help us either to share this campaign online or even in some cases they will kindly contribute to the campaign. So we feel more than up for the challenges as we produced a magazine for many years in the past and these are skills which we continue to hone. The team at Tripwire including writers who have worked for places like NME, The Guardian and more, are prepared for whatever hurdles we have to overcome. We have also solicited a direct market edition so we can get income from those copies sold and also done a deal to offer a digital edition through Comixology which will help our revenue for the magazine.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if people can’t contribute financially to our campaign, they can still help us. They can share it online via Twitter, Facebook or other forms of social media. They can plug it on their blog or their website if they have one. Thanks for reading and watching our video and thanks for your time.

story:
Join BRONCO INK COMICS for the return of

Okay, okay! It's not really a return per se, but SUPER TEAM INTERNATIONAL is the story of a motley crew of superheroes from around the world struggling to work together as a cohesive team against a vi.llainous l.eague of e.vil called V.I.L.E. V.I.L.E., under the leadership of The King of All Evil Dragons, is done messing around and ready to rid the world of heroes once and for all. Little does either team know that a greater threat grows in the background! SUPR TEAM INT'L is a celebration and return to the style of those awesome Bronze and Modern Age Comics of the 80's with a 2020 flair.

Carlos and I grew up on classic DC and Marvel comics on opposite sides of the hemisphere, and their influence runs thick! Looking for a way to tap into the magic one more time, I started writing the story that would coalesce into SUPER TEAM INTERNATIONAL! It's a self-contained universe in six issues, telling the tale of a team of heroes with hearts as big as their inexperience. While I knew what the story was going to be, I didn't know who it was going to be about beyond a couple of superheroes I've had in my back pocket for a while.

That's where my kids came in. 

Sebastian and Samantha have been blossoming into delightfully, creative little powerhouses as a direct result of current day superhero movies and anime (we're looking at you, Marvel and Kodansha). Over the years, I had found character ideas scribbled in their notebooks and on scraps of paper and on their tablets, and some of it has been utterly brilliant. We took the best ones, heroes and villains, mixed in a few public domain characters, and then when I added mine to the mix, we had a working cast to star in the comic!

Next up was finding the right artist to bring them to life. That's where Carlos Diaz came in. I've known him for several years and worked with him on a few projects in that time. I'll let him tell his story:

As soon as I read the script and saw the logo, I had a strange feeling of nostalgia and euphoria. I knew we were thinking about the same thing: The Giffen Justice League,and the classic post-Crisis stories of the bronze and early modern age ... you know, when the comics were fun and there were no limits to the imagination! That is really what SUPER TEAM INTERNATIONAL is all about. 

Every time that I sat in front of the PC to work, I was excited as a boy, especially when Scott sent me directions to shape the characters. I can't tell you how much fun it was to dress Buck Gallus like as human chicken and turn his old el Camino into the Chicken Mobile. MR CHICKEN is the kind of hero that you doesn´t know if you should hug or offer him a bowl of soup. It was also a challenge to mold DEEP TRENCH's fish face... or draw a worm with an Ipad! When I was drawing the last details to the KING OF ALL EVIL DRAGON's face, I could hear him speaking. It was strange, but he spoke to me with his gritty voice while raising one of his sinister eyebrows. I designed each character to be unique from his physiognomy to his posture because each of them has a different story and motivation.  

Once the character design was finished, I immersed myself in drawing each page. I tried to give a more classic style to be more in line with the climate of the story, a sequence of action scenes with funny dialogues. STI is not only about drawing men and women in spandex suits doing heroic poses. There are also other different characters in STI, such as Donutopia. Forget the Hall of Justice or Avenger's Tower, a donut shop is the best place where your favorite heroes can meet. In short, it´s a pleasure to draw this story full of heroes and villains with hilarious touches. I hope you, dear readers, can enjoy it as much as I do!

MORE ABOUT CARLOS

Born in Buenos Aires four decades ago, Carlos’ life was changed forever the day he picked up The Flashvolume 2, #3, for first time. That’s when he knew he’d be a comic artist for the rest of his life. Carlos has collaborated on short stories for anthologies in Argentina and around the world, and in 2017, he won a national prize as writer for the graphic novel "Tupac". Carlos works as a storyboard artist for advertising agencies and film producers, but the comics were, are, and always will be his greatest passion!

MORE ABOUT SCOTT

Born and bred in rural Alabama, the earliest known photo of Scott O. Brown is at age two, reading the Sunday comics on the back of a pick-up truck. It wasn’t long before he discovered comic books proper and embarked on a career creating and helping others create comics and graphic novels. Winner of the Harvey and Independent Publisher awards, Scott is a veritable Man of ComicsTM, and has been writing, lettering, and producing comics for the industry since 1999!

MORE ABOUT SEBASTIAN AND SAMANTHA

Twins and burgeoning creative powerhouses in their own right, Sebastian and Samantha Brown started with single page photocopies that they sold for a quarter at the Small Press Expo. They created many of the characters in STI ’88 and co-wrote the plot. This is their first comic book.

We hope you are as excited about this foray into classic superhero storytelling as we are! Make a pledge, join the team, and let's save the universe!

Thank you!

Scott, Carlos, Sebastian, Samantha
