It was strange, but he spoke to me with his gritty voice while raising one of his sinister eyebrows. I designed each character to be unique from his physiognomy to his posture because each of them has a different story and motivation.  Once the character design was finished, I immersed myself in drawing each page. I tried to give a more classic style to be more in line with the climate of the story, a sequence of action scenes with funny dialogues. STI is not only about drawing men and women in spandex suits doing heroic poses. There are also other different characters in STI, such as Donutopia. Forget the Hall of Justice or Avenger's Tower, a donut shop is the best place where your favorite heroes can meet. In short, it´s a pleasure to draw this story full of heroes and villains with hilarious touches. I hope you, dear readers, can enjoy it as much as I do!MORE ABOUT CARLOSBorn in Buenos Aires four decades ago, Carlos’ life was changed forever the day he picked up The Flashvolume 2, #3, for first time. That’s when he knew he’d be a comic artist for the rest of his life. Carlos has collaborated on short stories for anthologies in Argentina and around the world, and in 2017, he won a national prize as writer for the graphic novel "Tupac". Carlos works as a storyboard artist for advertising agencies and film producers, but the comics were, are, and always will be his greatest passion!MORE ABOUT SCOTTBorn and bred in rural Alabama, the earliest known photo of Scott O. Brown is at age two, reading the Sunday comics on the back of a pick-up truck. It wasn’t long before he discovered comic books proper and embarked on a career creating and helping others create comics and graphic novels. Winner of the Harvey and Independent Publisher awards, Scott is a veritable Man of ComicsTM, and has been writing, lettering, and producing comics for the industry since 1999!MORE ABOUT SEBASTIAN AND SAMANTHATwins and burgeoning creative powerhouses in their own right, Sebastian and Samantha Brown started with single page photocopies that they sold for a quarter at the Small Press Expo. They created many of the characters in STI ’88 and co-wrote the plot. This is their first comic book.We hope you are as excited about this foray into classic superhero storytelling as we are! Make a pledge, join the team, and let's save the universe!Thank you!Scott, Carlos, Sebastian, Samantha

story:
BUY THE BOOKS @ SQUARE!

Please go to Squareup.com to buy The Galactic Comet

https://squareup.com/store/the-galactic-comet

The Galactic Comet is an exciting kids storybook, perfect for bedtime or just to escape into fantasy for a while. The story promotes family values; highlighting the respect for elders and taking an interest in their wealth of experience. For a child, holding a book and delving into the adventure within is a great imaginative and tactile exercise. That connection is priceless. It's even more special when the parent or grandparent can read the story out loud to them with funny character voices. With this story it's my hope to help strengthen family bonds and inspire  children's imaginations. Please support this campaign to be a part of helping The Galactic Comet become a reality!

UPDATE:  Checking the proofs, the book is an awesome 11"X 11" in size! This is excellent for kids as they blast off into the universe of The Galactic Comet!

 

 

About the Author and the Storybook

  • I’m a family man of over twenty years and the father of two children. I’ve spent over two decades in product development/marketing and sales. I’m an artist with nearly thirty years’ experience in animation, special effects, 3D design and dubious voice-over work. I enjoy the creative process and developing projects to their completion.
  • When my Navy veteran grandfather reached the last years of his life, I visited him and learned more about his life. After he passed, I created a eulogy and poured over 94 years of his life in pictures. It was amazing. Sometimes we don't get to say goodbye to the ones we love, but the time you spent with them is invaluable. Though a kids science fiction storybook, The Galactic Comet is a tale of two kids learning about their grandfather in ways they never knew and appreciating the man that he is.
  • Joining in this endeavor allows independent creators to produce art in true free-form. Devoid from corporate thinking and massively funded agendas, stories here can be told with passion and energy. It’s truly exciting when people can come together and be a part of creating something fresh and exciting.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • There is a target goal of $12,000 to complete the FIRST 28 page storybook, part ONE of a four part series. The largest portion of the cost is the printing, binding and shipping of the books to investors. Funding will complete Book ONE which can be completed and shipped in November 2018. Other funds are needed for hardware and software upgrades to handle the complexities of 3D rendering.
  • I have operated as a brand executive for over twenty years and have managed the process of many common manufacturing supply chains. I bring experience, speed and a successful track record in creative development and production.
  • All funds received are directed towards necessary 3D software, printing, binding and shipping related to The Galactic Comet four-part storybook series.

 

Storybook mock-up sample

(3D rendering proposal)

3D Design with Poser 11, DAZ Studio and Photoshop CS

Virtual sets and lighting were created to give a level of cinematic depth.

 

 

Thanks for taking a look! If you like what you see, grab a copy of The Galactic Comet and support this family endeavor! Delivers November 2018, in time for Christmas!

story:
Our Story

In 2015, Overground Comics creator Jon Hughes hit the road and toured the entire west coast of the country telling comic shop owners and comic readers in over 300 different stores about Overground's new line of books that would be coming to stores soon.  The one title that everyone wanted to talk about during the tour was our high risk project, America.  

For our other books, Overground Comics stayed small, and worked with artists who had proven themselves in the independent comic book community, with most of those books being delivered on time and with great results.  

With America, we decided to reach out to some enigmatic talents, and take a chance on making a big splash by landing some big talent.  It worked.  Sort of.  Overground Comics was able to sign outstanding Marvel and DC artist Jason Pearson to draw the first two issues of the book, and fans were excited to see Pearson back to work on a monthly title.  After two issues, however, Jason decided to remove himself from the project, and we were left to find another artist to fill the void.  While we had artists in our studio we knew that we could trust, we knew that fans would want another established artist to fill that void, so the search began.  

We contacted Ale Garza, who like Pearson was a talented, established artist looking for a fresh start.  Fans were again excited to see Garza added to the project, and work began on  finishing the polarizing series.  Unfortunately, Garza was unable to deliver the books before our distribution deadline, and Overground Comics was unable to deliver the fourth and final issue of the book.  After finally receiving the finished pages from Garza, Overground was able to publish the final issue through another independent imprint called American Mythology, but unfortunately, so much time had passed that most readers weren't even aware that the book was available, and order numbers dropped significantly.  

Despite all of the challenges with our small company getting in over our head, we did produce a good book that people responded really well to, and we want everyone to have access to the finished project once and for all.  This campaign finally brings the book together in a graphic novel, with some awesome never before seen bonus material.

What We Need & What You Get

For this campaign, we are raising money to print as many copies of the graphic novel as possible, to be sold on tour at conventions across the country.  It's simple.  The work has been done for most of the project, we just now need the funds to print as many copies as we can to be able to get them to everyone who wants one.   Here's a closer look at some of the rewards:

Sketch Cover by Brandon Peterson

Sketch Cover by Chad Townsend

Sketch Cover by Chad Townsend

Sketch Cover by Josh Howard

Sketch Cover by K. Lynn Smith

Sketch Cover by Daniel Leister

Sketch Cover by Jessica Von Braun

Sketch Cover by Matthew Weldon

Sketch Cover by Johnny Segura

Sketch Cover by Jason Meents

Sketch Cover by Skylar Partridge

Sketch Cover by Vivian Friedel

Sketch Cover by Terry Parr

Why does "America" matter?

A lot of people misunderstood this book when it was produced, largely due to the fractured nature of the delivery of the book, but we believe that this is a book that people will benefit from reading.  Is America an outrageous character?  Yes.  However, her inability to accept the changes in her life is something that we can all relate to, and something that needs to be discussed.  Readers won't simply be entertained by this book, it's an introspective look at who we all really are, and how we respond to unwelcome change.

Risks & Challenges

Honestly, this is an absolutely zero risk campaign.  The book has already been completed, we are simply trying to raise money to print it.  If we only raise enough to print what's purchased through the campaign, then we're okay with that.  We're not trying to overachieve, we're trying to get this book into the hands of the people who have been waiting patiently for it.  All pledges are guaranteed to be rewarded, because nothing really needs to be done except an order being put in to our printer.  That's not difficult.  We just need the funds to pay for it.  

Help Us Out!

If you can't pledge, then please help us out by spreading the word about this project.  We sold thousands of copies of these comics nationwide, and even had the book published overseas, but so many people were left wanting a conclusion they didn't have access to.  Tell your friends and fellow comic readers that now is the time to finish this story!

story:
World Wide Warriors 

World Wide Warriors is a good, old fashion diverse superhero genre book honoring the classic Claremont/Cockrum Uncanny X-Men with a JLA vibe to it and a sprinkle of Watchmen.

Allan Goldman and I started working on this title a few years ago and with the help of colorist Tony Brandão and lettering by my lovely wife Nilda, we have nearly 4 issues finished to date. 

With your help, we make this happen and bring this project to life. I'm willing to give up original pages, covers, and sketches to see this to fruition. I hope you'll join our passion.

Support a NEW AGE in comics!

  • $50,000 Stretch Goal: Extending the length of the book to 64 pages! 
  • $70,000 Stretch Goal: An original sketch cover by Dave Ryan & including a World Wide Warriors poster (folded) for all tiers $100 and above! (1 per backer)
  • $100,000 Stretch Goal: Original Sketch Raffle. One lucky backer will win an original World Wide Warriors original cover by Rudy Nebres and an original sketch by Dave Ryan! 
  • $115,000 Stretch Goal: World Wide Warriors Trading Card for all backers! 
  • $130,000 Stretch Goal: All 5 variant covers by Byran Hitch, John Bryne, Rudy Nebres, and Jeff Johnson included!!
  • $140,000 Stretch Goal: GOLD FOIL stamped edition on the cover and square-bound printing!

 

This campaign will begin an ongoing series that you can invest yourself into. It's not going to end. We will do whatever it takes to continually put out this series and make comics great again!

story:
Short Summary

The following is the opening sequence to Project Shadow Breed:

  • In the new millennia, SinTech, A private government contract corporation, began developing a serum to turn ordinary soldiers into werewolves.  With the backing of the US military, SinTech perfected the serum.  In 2014, they created the first “Wolf Pack” of soldiers.  What they didn’t expect to create was Marrok.

If that doesn't setup "BADASSERY" (it's a word, look it up. Actually, don't look it up) then we don't know what will.  Project Shadow Breed is the brainchild of Justin Bartz, a writer, a husband, and a father from Michigan.  When he's not spending time with his family, his mind drifts in and out of the world he's creating.

This special issue of Project Shadow Breed is an early sneak peek release of what's to come next.  As a contributor you will get your hands on a copy of Project Shadow Breed before the public release, even those attending comic conventions.  We are not scheduled for conventions till after June.  WooHoo!

Join Justin as he unveils what government contractors create behind closed doors and unleash in the public sector.  Join Marrok (half werewolf, what's that about?) and Leroy (Ex-Military, Mentor, and official Marrok ass-kicker) as they uncover the truth behind Marrok's past (he wasn't always a werewolf you know) and get mixed up in the biggest war that's coming to Seattle. Oh, and they save people too.

What We Need & What You Get

Great news!  The book is already complete and ready for print.  Which means we can get books to you faster!  The funds that need to be raised will cover the cost of printing and perks for backers.  This venue allows small publishers in the indie market to thrive and share content on a consistent basis.

  • Print Costs: $1100 (500 Regular Cover /100 Blank Variants)
  • Perks Costs:
    • Bookmarks: $30
    • Posters: $50
    • T-Shirts: $100-$200
    • Original Art: $1,000,000,000,000 (we think you get the picture)
  • All the funds raised will go towards the production of this book.  Excess funds, if reached, will help fund future issues and so forth.

The Impact

Justin Bartz has been developing the Project Shadow Breed world for as long as he can remember.  The passion you hear in his voice when he is talking about this book is undeniable.  There are many stories about vigilantes rising to face the injustice of the world.  However, Justin writes these characters with so much heart and soul that you feel it on every page.

The goal, with your help, is to bring this story to as many people who love storytelling as much Justin and the Amazing Action Comics team does.

As we grow, we'll never forget those who rode this journey with us.  Your names will forever be imbedded in our hearts and in the pages we create.

Risks & Challenges

Any project faces a number of risks and challenges to reach a finished product. We understand the faith that backers will have shown in this project and will be fully committed to bringing Project Shadow Breed to life within the projected timeframe.

We are very much looking forward to taking on the challenge of bringing this project into your homes as early as June 2019.

In the unlikely event of delays We'll keep all backers and interested parties updated, both here, on our website (www.amazingactioncomics.com) and via social media. We strongly believe that good, honest communication is the best approach in business and hope that this transmits the level of commitment We have to making this project happen.

Without potential (and more importantly, actual) investors this dream simply wouldn’t occur in the timeframe defined. This is a symbiotic journey of creation. Our vision and time invested is only part of the elements for success, YOU are an important part in making this happen. We sincerely hope you'll join us in this endeavor.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that everyone may not be in the position to help fund this project or this project may not be to your liking.  However, you can still support us and help make this a successful campaign.  You can simply:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign via your social media. 
  • Share, share, share and use the Indiegogo share tools whenever possible.
  • Follow us on social media:
    • Twitter
    • Instagram
    • Facebook

We thank you for taking the time to review our campaign and always appreciate comments and feedback.

story:
Short Summary

One of the many cool things about The Book of Jessica is that it is part of a larger Post-Apocalyptic Universe being developed by MWP Comics called The Third Testament Universe. This universe will allow the reader to follow multiple storylines which will highlight many heroes and heroines. Currently, in addition to The Book of Jessica comic series, The Book of Luka graphic novel is in production and will be available in April. The Book of Luka follows the Guardian Luka and his companions in the same universe as Jessica. 

The big picture:

The Battle of Armageddon has come and gone, leaving a charred and devastated world behind.  There was no rapture, no day of jubilee...only destruction.

In the aftermath, humans possessed by lower demons stalk the desolate landscape devouring souls and flesh alike. In addition to the supernatural evil haunting the world, human scavengers and petty warlords fight over the scraps, challenging even demons in their savagery.

But hope does exist, however small.

Those given special powers by the archangels stand watch over the ever-shrinking flock of humankind. 

Guardians, with their increased strength and anointed swords (capable of killing all but high demons) are the watchdogs that defend the citadels. 

Far-roaming, stealthy, and possessing deadly speed, Rangers scout the wastelands for  supplies and worthy survivors.    

These warriors, and the flocks they protect, are led by the Bishops. Chosen for their bravery and leadership in the first days of the Apocalypse, they have the power to exercise lower demons and the will to do what must be done in order for those under their care to survive.

Working outside the confines of the warrior-class are the Relic Holders. Given tokens of immense power by the seraphim just prior to the Apocalypse, they carry the weight and pain of their gifts as they forge their own paths to restore the world for mankind.  

This is were Jessica comes into play! Here are some pages from Issue #1!

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign is to support the main artwork, cover art, and initial print run. Here are the numbers:

  • Principle artwork and cover: $3000.  Pencils/inks by Toni Doya, Colors by David Ocampo, and Letters by Ernesto Lovera.  Cover art by Kevin McCoy. These artists have worked for the likes of Marvel, Image, Zensecope, and even the Seattle Seahawks!
  •  Initial 500 print run: $900

We've got a ton of perks ranging from PDF copies or paper copies to original art and even having your likeness in a MWP comic or graphic novel!

Our Record

MWP has a record of completing projects at the highest level.  Just take a look at what Mountaineer West Productions has completed or successfully funded in the last 18 months:

Comics/Graphic Novels:

The Book of Luka #1  (From The Third Testament Universe) 

The Book of Luka Graphic Novel. Fully Funded.  (April 2019 Release)

The Book of Jessica #1.  Complete. 

War Angels #1. Fully Funded, Early 2019 release.

Film:

Lions Short Film (Military Scifi) Fully Funded. This film will be in the film festival circuit in 2019. 

Books:

The Gateway Military Scifi series

 

Southern Rites (Southern Gothic Fiction)

Escape of the Relentless (Runan Empire Series #1) - Military Scifi scheduled for January 2019 release

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge is time.  Will MWP get this project out in early 2019 or will we need to wait for other projects to pay off and delay it several months or even into 2020?  This is where your help is vital to maintaining a constant flow of quality comics to fans. 

We have set a budget for this project that allows us to create one of the highest quality comic books your going to find out there, indie or otherwise.  That being said, it isn't cheap and your support will be vital to getting this issue complete and out to people. 

The writing is done, we have worked with ALL of the artists before on Issue #1 and they are excited about getting started on Issue #2.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially but like the project please share with your friends and on your social media.
story_txt:
Short Summary
One of the many cool things about The Book of Jessica is that it is part of a larger Post-Apocalyptic Universe being developed by MWP Comics called The Third Testament Universe. This universe will allow the reader to follow multiple storylines which will highlight many heroes and heroines. Currently, in addition to The Book of Jessica comic series, The Book of Luka graphic novel is in production and will be available in April. The Book of Luka follows the Guardian Luka and his companions in the same universe as Jessica. 
The big picture:
The Battle of Armageddon has come and gone, leaving a charred and devastated world behind.  There was no rapture, no day of jubilee...only destruction.
In the aftermath, humans possessed by lower demons stalk the desolate landscape devouring souls and flesh alike. In addition to the supernatural evil haunting the world, human scavengers and petty warlords fight over the scraps, challenging even demons in their savagery.

But hope does exist, however small.
Those given special powers by the archangels stand watch over the ever-shrinking flock of humankind. 
Guardians, with their increased strength and anointed swords (capable of killing all but high demons) are the watchdogs that defend the citadels. 

Far-roaming, stealthy, and possessing deadly speed, Rangers scout the wastelands for  supplies and worthy survivors.    

These warriors, and the flocks they protect, are led by the Bishops. Chosen for their bravery and leadership in the first days of the Apocalypse, they have the power to exercise lower demons and the will to do what must be done in order for those under their care to survive.
Working outside the confines of the warrior-class are the Relic Holders. Given tokens of immense power by the seraphim just prior to the Apocalypse, they carry the weight and pain of their gifts as they forge their own paths to restore the world for mankind.  
This is were Jessica comes into play! Here are some pages from Issue #1!

 




 
What We Need & What You Get
This campaign is to support the main artwork, cover art, and initial print run. Here are the numbers:

Principle artwork and cover: $3000.  Pencils/inks by Toni Doya, Colors by David Ocampo, and Letters by Ernesto Lovera.  Cover art by Kevin McCoy. These artists have worked for the likes of Marvel, Image, Zensecope, and even the Seattle Seahawks!
 Initial 500 print run: $900

We've got a ton of perks ranging from PDF copies or paper copies to original art and even having your likeness in a MWP comic or graphic novel!
Our Record

MWP has a record of completing projects at the highest level.  Just take a look at what Mountaineer West Productions has completed or successfully funded in the last 18 months:

Comics/Graphic Novels:
The Book of Luka #1  (From The Third Testament Universe) 

The Book of Luka Graphic Novel. Fully Funded.  (April 2019 Release)

The Book of Jessica #1.  Complete. 

War Angels #1. Fully Funded, Early 2019 release.



Film:
Lions Short Film (Military Scifi) Fully Funded. This film will be in the film festival circuit in 2019. 


Books:
The Gateway Military Scifi series
 
Southern Rites (Southern Gothic Fiction)
Escape of the Relentless (Runan Empire Series #1) - Military Scifi scheduled for January 2019 release


Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge is time.  Will MWP get this project out in early 2019 or will we need to wait for other projects to pay off and delay it several months or even into 2020?  This is where your help is vital to maintaining a constant flow of quality comics to fans. 
We have set a budget for this project that allows us to create one of the highest quality comic books your going to find out there, indie or otherwise.  That being said, it isn't cheap and your support will be vital to getting this issue complete and out to people. 
The writing is done, we have worked with ALL of the artists before on Issue #1 and they are excited about getting started on Issue #2.  

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't help financially but like the project please share with your friends and on your social media.

story:
It is the turn of the 23rd century. The excess riches of Planet Kelly have been put into the trade of lost souls and territory. Upon the debut of the first industrial undead soldiers, conventional warfare grew to be considered an antiquated art form and a source of entertainment for the blood thirsty elite. By these circumstances, the rambunctious mercenary crew of the "Shining Prospero" have become wealthy and respected craftworkers of mayhem. 

 

Pistol Planet Boogie

 

Hi, my name is Lemmie Styx

I am a self taught artist, and everything that I have done so far has been on my own time, with my own materials, and not for profit. I have studied the greats; every notable western comic book artist from JACK KIRBY, and MIKE MIGNOLA, to Eastern and European influences like AKIRA TORIYAMA, and Olivier Ledroit.

I would continue down this path of non-profit work, and artistic discovery; but a venture as time-consuming as comic book production requires at least some financial justification. 

So, a personal thank you to all that decide to back this campaign. If we meet our base goal of $2,000 I will not spare any personal expense in delivering the highest quality comics possible.

Most likely I will be working full time in conjunction with producing this comic, so in order to stay good on my promises, I have given myself a full three months to produce and manufacture all of the merchandise (when the campaign ends in at the beginning of February). However, if I raise enough money to work on the book full time, I would gladly change the release date.

My interests are broad, but this project will be primarily for those who are nostalgic about CARTOONS, VIDEO GAMES, ANIME, ACTION MOVIES, and SCI FI from the 90s and 00s.

Once again, Thank You!

Sincerely,

Lemmie Styxx

 

Stretch Goals!

 

2K = 48 page oversized issue bound. 

3K = Poster added with process video and original art for sale.

3.5K = die cut sticker added with process video and original art for sale.

4K = Metal pin added with new design and process video.

5K = t shirt added with with process video and original art for sale.

6K = bonus 8 pages added to the story!

Beyond???

 

CONTACTS:

website: https://gibbswwilliam.wixsite.com/lemmiestyxx

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/lemmie.styxx/

youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JkUOU-MUdIg

redbubble: https://www.redbubble.com/people/LemmieStyx/sho...

fiverr: https://www.fiverr.com/lemmiestyx?public_mode=true

email: gibbswwilliam@yahoo.com

story:
Story Preview

Demons have ruled the Earth for almost 1000 years.  Humanity was forced to live in caves to survive.  Humanity is on the brink of extinction, there is no solution in sight.  Follow Galden, Ryoku, and others as they discovered what happened 1000 years ago.  Watch as they fight to restore life to the way it used to be, and save mankind's future.

People that became characters 

Perks

One of the unique perks offered in my campaign is the opportunity to be in the story.  I will have 21 slots available for people.  With that being said, when I create the anime for this story, your character will also be a part of the show.

Impact

By backing this book, you will do more than help me achieve my dream.  You will also create job opportunities for animators, voice actors, sound engineers, video editors and more.

For as long as I can remember, I've read comics and watched anime.  I came up with this story 4 years ago, but after talking to a few comic and manga companies, I've learned that it's a very inclusive environment.  After seeing more and more demand for indie content, I decided to create this book. This book is the first step in my plan to create a new life and embrace my calling.  The funds generated from this campaign will not only allow me to create this book, but also allow me to create a new animation studio.  This gives me and my backers a very unique opportunity. The opportunity to not only be in the book, but the anime as well. 

Thank you for your support!

Thank you for your support!

story:
Hello, I’m John Celestri. I’ve been creating comics and animation for 45+ years.

I animated the iconic Boba Fett in the Star Wars Holiday Special, and many other cartoon shows of the 1970s and 1980s. These include Filmation Studio’s He-Man, She-Ra; and Don Bluth’s Dragon’s Lair and Space Ace video games.

I’ve turned my talents and experience to creating my own characters  for a line of all-ages comics aimed at young kids…and reawakening an  adult’s Inner Child!

What’s so different about what I’m doing, you ask? Well, I’m creating for a much younger audience than what is today’s beginning readership for comic books, which is 13 to 15 years old.

My characters and stories are for the “Seedlings,” kids who are between 4 to 12 years old. And within that age range I have two specific groupings: 4 to 7, and 8 to 12.

I’m being very specific in my age grouping because as kids grow from 4 to 7 and develop into 8 to 12 year olds, what entertains them also develops and changes.

 

 

Snuffy & Zoey Toy Box Adventures focuses on two sibling bears who jump into their magic toy box and have adventures. My idea is to encourage young readers to explore their imaginations and create their own entertainment and stories. But I’m not writing stories with any hidden social or political messages.

In the first 24 page book, Snuffy and Zoey try to steal cupcakes from a dragon!

In the second 32 page book, Snuffy and Zoey’s soccer ball bounces into the magic box and is lost inside! In trying to find it, Snuffy and Zoey are captured by a gang of Pirates made out of colorful balloons!

Nicky Nardson: Mega Moose Comics is about a bullied nerd, who is magically given extraordinary powers. With a wave of a magic feather, Nicky can change into a Minotaur-type being with all the powers of the animal kingdom. The series is aimed at youngsters dealing with surviving elementary and middle school society. The first issue contains two standalone stories (12 and 16 pages).

I write my stories in a manner that does not talk down to kids in a condescending manner. My goal is to reintroduce innocence and a feeling of whimsy to comics. I don’t mean a “sugary” innocence, but rather innocence in a way that kids are. Let them grow up naturally; comic stories don’t need to force feed kids darkness.

So, I’ve completed the artwork for all 5 oversized (8.3 x 11.7 inch) books, which are much larger than the standard comic book size, and printed on heavy premium paper.

 

These include a 16 page Snuffy & Zoey Draw and Color book, which offers basic drawing lessons and coloring pages…

 

…and a 28 page Mega Moose Ashcan Edition, containing all the rough pages of both Mega Moose adventures.

 

Yes, I've completed all this artwork... But I need your help to pay for the printing of these books in the USA.

Please check out the various perks I’m offering!

Thanks for your support! And if you like what I’m trying to do, please share this campaign with your friends and family!

story:
CREATORS

Evan McCormick and Ariel Vergez, a writer that paints and a painter that writes, respectively. Evan with a background in hospice and global philosophy brings a rich heritage of healing maps that powers the ethos and story of the world of Children of Plants. Ariel with a background in design and larger-than-life murals and visual arts brings a deep culture of stunning and dynamic visuals to the project.

Together they have crafted a universe that follow the epoch of mammal kind through the ages.

In a future sci-fi earth a divine-like being falls in love and loses his powers. Poly has to sacrifice everything and in the end gives his heart away to his love for the earth to be restored.

In book one Poly confronts a world he neglected and has to quickly use his remaining power to keep his world alive.

A global tree, technologically driven biology, a delicate peace treaty between three radically different cultures and an awakened consciousness offering unconditional love.

Plot Summary

Poly walks the branches of a global tree. A plant born from a seed that is able to remember the first particle that entered our realm called physical space. 

The Global Tree has grown up with war. The three remaining tribes of mammals have gained wisdom through war and have committed themselves to a treaty. A time of peace known as, A Ceremony of Rest, a period devoted to eliminating heart heat.

Why INDIEGOGO?

This campaign will offer us a chance to get the first book in the Children of Plants saga published and to ignite a host of artist committed telling this sensory tale. We see this project becoming alive with animated formats along with a continuation of the Children of Plants stories through digital and printed mediums.

If you are somewhat enlightened and like stories, this is for you!

What Are Supporting?

  • This is a 32 page full color comic.
  • No-Limit Sci-Fi
  • Enlightened Comic

 

Here are samples of pages found within the comic book.

Mockup of inside of book (sans text ;P)

 

 

Risks and challenges

We are so excited that Children of Plants: POLY — LOVE is complete and ready to print. Digital downloads will be available once your personal surveys are completed. As with all things COVID related — there may be inherent delays in shipping physical goods. Thankyou for your time. We are grateful for the attention you have given this project. Hope to hear from you soon.

Evan & Ariel

 

Follow us  on Instagram @ChildrenofPlants and on the web at: ReishiStudios.com

story:
Welcome to The Bobcat Issue 5: Unknown Territory Indiegogo Campaign!

This Campaign has been created to fund the production of the 5th Issue of The Bobcat Saga which will ultimately be the second Chapter of The Bobcat: Volume 2 - Trade Paperback

The Bobcat is a Native American Western with elements of Indigenous Mythology, Steampunk, and The Supernatural 

Thunder Being on Sparrow Hawk Mountain

The Bobcat: 1898 Indian Territory - Will Firemaker is a Cherokee blacksmith who is finding out that the ancient legends of the Tribe are true, and they are leading him to a world he never could have imagined 

Will Firemaker

Unknown Territory is the latest installment in the growing Western/SciFi/Steampunk/Supernatural series that takes place at the end of the Old West and the beginning of the Industrial Age 

Jailbreak at Cherokee National Penitentiary

 

Issue 5:

This chapter of The Bobcat begins with the new educator from the East Coast-Dr. Augustus Aloysius Fletcher-settling in to his professorial position at the Cherokee Female Seminary. All seems well but there is an ominous underpinning that is felt to be lurking in the shadows. An unseen force with an elusive point of origin.

The people of Tahlequah couldn’t scarcely imagine what lies in store for them.

Dr. Shock & his Mechanical Beast

Meanwhile, the military convoy transporting a top-secret precious cargo has set up camp on the edge of town. Things seem pretty calm at the moment...

U.S. Military Convoy Camp

Armored Wagon

The soldiers seem to be preparing for something...but what might that be?

Jim Mehsling, our resident artist who has been dazzling us all since the beginning of this wonderful journey, is the heart & soul of this saga. We have invited a guest artist to help add to the excitement of this installment and his name is Bryan SilverBax. Bryan has created an exceptional homage cover for Issue 5 - a salute to the iconic Batman GN ’The Killing Joke’                                                     

The Bobcat Issue 5 Official Cover Reveal:

The Bobcat Issue 5 ‘Unknown Territory’ Homage Cover

1898 Indian Territory: A Young Cherokee Blacksmith living in Tahlequah has One Foot in the World of the European Settlers and One in the Mysterious Realm of Cherokee Lore that is his Legacy

Will Firemaker is one of ”The Chosen”. The Great Cat befriended Will as a child and Unaduti the medicine man has called him ”Guh-Hey” (Bobcat in Cherokee) ever since. When the cat was killed, Will found himself on a journey that he never could have dreamed of. Ancient lore and the fantastic began to meld with reality. While in the Qualla Boundary, his ancestry and legacy were revealed to him by ”The Little People”. Will had been charged with the task of ’Guardian’, taking the place of the absent Great Cat.

Will Firemaker is The Bobcat! 

The Bobcat & Tsul ‘Kalu

 

 

The Little People reveal the calling Will has as his Legacy

Unaduti the Medicine Man and Will Firemaker’s Mentor

An example of the Cherokee Syllabary from The Bobcat Volume 1:

 

 

Will Firemaker’s good friend- and probably a little bit more -Annie McCoy is revealing to the reader certain skills she has acquired over the years...unbeknownst to all but a few.

Annie McCoy

 In addition to all of the fictional elements in the story, The Bobcat Saga is chock full of actual persons, places,and events from 1898 Indian Territory as well as factual accounts from American History: 

 

The Old Jailhouse built in 1874 is featured in Issue 5 and the structure still stands in Tahlequah today. You definitely need to check it out for yourself!  

 

 

Hidden talents, secret identities, and forces beyond all reason and comprehension make themselves known in this wildly entertaining volume that is sure to be a favorite of comic fans everywhere!!! 

Join The Bobcat Family and come along for the ride as we enter: ”Unknown Territory”

 

CREATION TEAM : HOSTLER-MEHSLING

James Hostler is the Creator and Writer of 'The Bobcat' Saga. He is an Oklahoma native and a Citizen at large of The Cherokee Nation. James draws from his experiences in the former Indian Territory, as well as actual accounts and events of his family and predecessors. His people are Cowboys and Indians. James has been an avid fan and collector of the comic world as well as a huge Sci-fi/Fantasy buff. Many elements of the comic universe will appear in this tale.

Jim Mehsling is an Award-Winning Artist,Creator, and Animator who works across diverse Genres. Jim is a Topps Trading Card Artist who has worked on Star Wars: Rogue One, Star Wars: 40th Anniversary, Star Wars: Galactic Files, and The Walking Dead. Jim has also won 'Best Animated Feature' from Lucasfilm for his animated short 'Bounty Hunter: Pit of Carkoon'. Jim has brought the story and characters to life in 'The Bobcat' with his signature style of illustration and color use. Jim is a big fan of the Western Genre as well as the Sci-fi/Fantasy realm. We are quite fortunate to have Jim's great work on this project

 

  We are thrilled and very proud of our relationship with the iconic Caliber Comics Publishing Group! Caliber first brought you the legendary series The Crow and Deadworld, as well as many other classic titles. It is such an honor to be a part of this rebirth of one of the original Indie Comic Publishers that has given so much to the Comic world! The Trade Paperback Volume 1 has the collected first trilogy (Issues 1,2,3) of The Bobcat as well as bonus material and art from The Bobcat universe. The TPB has nationwide distribution and can be ordered through Caliber directly, Amazon, and TheBobcat.net - Of course you can grab one at your Local Comic Shop and support the guys that keep us all connected!

 

 

 PHYSICAL PERKS: 

Also Available - The Bobcat Volume 1, Trade Paperback & Single Issues 1,2,3,4  included in the Perk Options

 

The Bobcat Single Issues 1,2,3,4

The Bobcat Complete Set: Single Issues #1-4 and Trade Paperback Volume 1

NEW VARIANT COVER PERK AVAILABLE:

 Introducing our latest Variant Cover straight outta Rome,Italy and created by Francesco Tomaselli ? We are very pleased with this amazing take on the Issue 5 story!

An Assortment of Original T-Shirt Designs: 

T-Shirts

 

NEW ADD-ONS:

Die-Cut Vinyl Decals, Exclusive Bobcat Coasters, and Holographic Stickers:

A must have for the ardent collector!

 

Art Prints:

8”x10” Prints

Trading Cards:

Trading Cards-Set of 12

Vinyl Decals:

Vinyl Decals

Full Size 11”x17” Prints also available:

 

 

Original Art Sketches by Jim Mehsling: 

A new Perk added for the very fist time:

An Original, One-Of-A-Kind Digital Art Proof from the pages of Issue 5

There will be only 5 pages available and they are each 1 OF 1 !!!

  • Original Digital Art Proof

 


 

The Bobcat Cover Gallery:

 

 

 

The Bobcat Trade Paperback Volume 1

Pinup Gallery:

 

Will’s Father

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

Risks: There are no risks for our generous backers as we have always provided a fine product for the last 5 Campaigns we have done. The risks we face are well known to us and they primarily involve financial investment and returns which vary from project to project. Challenges: Other than the obvious task of creating the best story possible, bringing the finished product to completion in a timely manner, while maintaining the highest quality of work, is usually our greatest challenge...one that we have faced and conquered time and time again!
story_txt:
Welcome to The Bobcat Issue 5: Unknown Territory Indiegogo Campaign!This Campaign has been created to fund the production of the 5th Issue of The Bobcat Saga which will ultimately be the second Chapter of The Bobcat: Volume 2 - Trade PaperbackThe Bobcat is a Native American Western with elements of Indigenous Mythology, Steampunk, and The Supernatural Thunder Being on Sparrow Hawk MountainThe Bobcat: 1898 Indian Territory - Will Firemaker is a Cherokee blacksmith who is finding out that the ancient legends of the Tribe are true, and they are leading him to a world he never could have imagined Will FiremakerUnknown Territory is the latest installment in the growing Western/SciFi/Steampunk/Supernatural series that takes place at the end of the Old West and the beginning of the Industrial Age Jailbreak at Cherokee National Penitentiary Issue 5:This chapter of The Bobcat begins with the new educator from the East Coast-Dr. Augustus Aloysius Fletcher-settling in to his professorial position at the Cherokee Female Seminary. All seems well but there is an ominous underpinning that is felt to be lurking in the shadows. An unseen force with an elusive point of origin.The people of Tahlequah couldn’t scarcely imagine what lies in store for them.Dr. Shock & his Mechanical BeastMeanwhile, the military convoy transporting a top-secret precious cargo has set up camp on the edge of town. Things seem pretty calm at the moment...U.S. Military Convoy CampArmored WagonThe soldiers seem to be preparing for something...but what might that be?Jim Mehsling, our resident artist who has been dazzling us all since the beginning of this wonderful journey, is the heart & soul of this saga. We have invited a guest artist to help add to the excitement of this installment and his name is Bryan SilverBax. Bryan has created an exceptional homage cover for Issue 5 - a salute to the iconic Batman GN ’The Killing Joke’                                                     The Bobcat Issue 5 Official Cover Reveal:The Bobcat Issue 5 ‘Unknown Territory’ Homage Cover1898 Indian Territory: A Young Cherokee Blacksmith living in Tahlequah has One Foot in the World of the European Settlers and One in the Mysterious Realm of Cherokee Lore that is his LegacyWill Firemaker is one of ”The Chosen”. The Great Cat befriended Will as a child and Unaduti the medicine man has called him ”Guh-Hey” (Bobcat in Cherokee) ever since. When the cat was killed, Will found himself on a journey that he never could have dreamed of. Ancient lore and the fantastic began to meld with reality. While in the Qualla Boundary, his ancestry and legacy were revealed to him by ”The Little People”. Will had been charged with the task of ’Guardian’, taking the place of the absent Great Cat.Will Firemaker is The Bobcat! The Bobcat & Tsul ‘Kalu  The Little People reveal the calling Will has as his LegacyUnaduti the Medicine Man and Will Firemaker’s MentorAn example of the Cherokee Syllabary from The Bobcat Volume 1:  Will Firemaker’s good friend- and probably a little bit more -Annie McCoy is revealing to the reader certain skills she has acquired over the years...unbeknownst to all but a few.Annie McCoy In addition to all of the fictional elements in the story, The Bobcat Saga is chock full of actual persons, places,and events from 1898 Indian Territory as well as factual accounts from American History:  The Old Jailhouse built in 1874 is featured in Issue 5 and the structure still stands in Tahlequah today. You definitely need to check it out for yourself!    Hidden talents, secret identities, and forces beyond all reason and comprehension make themselves known in this wildly entertaining volume that is sure to be a favorite of comic fans everywhere!!! Join The Bobcat Family and come along for the ride as we enter: ”Unknown Territory” CREATION TEAM : HOSTLER-MEHSLINGJames Hostler is the Creator and Writer of 'The Bobcat' Saga. He is an Oklahoma native and a Citizen at large of The Cherokee Nation. James draws from his experiences in the former Indian Territory, as well as actual accounts and events of his family and predecessors. His people are Cowboys and Indians. James has been an avid fan and collector of the comic world as well as a huge Sci-fi/Fantasy buff. Many elements of the comic universe will appear in this tale.Jim Mehsling is an Award-Winning Artist,Creator, and Animator who works across diverse Genres. Jim is a Topps Trading Card Artist who has worked on Star Wars: Rogue One, Star Wars: 40th Anniversary, Star Wars: Galactic Files, and The Walking Dead. Jim has also won 'Best Animated Feature' from Lucasfilm for his animated short 'Bounty Hunter: Pit of Carkoon'. Jim has brought the story and characters to life in 'The Bobcat' with his signature style of illustration and color use. Jim is a big fan of the Western Genre as well as the Sci-fi/Fantasy realm. We are quite fortunate to have Jim's great work on this project   We are thrilled and very proud of our relationship with the iconic Caliber Comics Publishing Group! Caliber first brought you the legendary series The Crow and Deadworld, as well as many other classic titles. It is such an honor to be a part of this rebirth of one of the original Indie Comic Publishers that has given so much to the Comic world! The Trade Paperback Volume 1 has the collected first trilogy (Issues 1,2,3) of The Bobcat as well as bonus material and art from The Bobcat universe. The TPB has nationwide distribution and can be ordered through Caliber directly, Amazon, and TheBobcat.net - Of course you can grab one at your Local Comic Shop and support the guys that keep us all connected!   PHYSICAL PERKS: Also Available - The Bobcat Volume 1, Trade Paperback & Single Issues 1,2,3,4  included in the Perk Options The Bobcat Single Issues 1,2,3,4The Bobcat Complete Set: Single Issues #1-4 and Trade Paperback Volume 1NEW VARIANT COVER PERK AVAILABLE: Introducing our latest Variant Cover straight outta Rome,Italy and created by Francesco Tomaselli ? We are very pleased with this amazing take on the Issue 5 story!An Assortment of Original T-Shirt Designs: T-Shirts NEW ADD-ONS:Die-Cut Vinyl Decals, Exclusive Bobcat Coasters, and Holographic Stickers:A must have for the ardent collector! Art Prints:8”x10” PrintsTrading Cards:Trading Cards-Set of 12Vinyl Decals:Vinyl DecalsFull Size 11”x17” Prints also available:  Original Art Sketches by Jim Mehsling: A new Perk added for the very fist time:An Original, One-Of-A-Kind Digital Art Proof from the pages of Issue 5There will be only 5 pages available and they are each 1 OF 1 !!!Original Digital Art Proof
  The Bobcat Cover Gallery:   The Bobcat Trade Paperback Volume 1Pinup Gallery: Will’s Father   Risks and challengesRisks: There are no risks for our generous backers as we have always provided a fine product for the last 5 Campaigns we have done. The risks we face are well known to us and they primarily involve financial investment and returns which vary from project to project. Challenges: Other than the obvious task of creating the best story possible, bringing the finished product to completion in a timely manner, while maintaining the highest quality of work, is usually our greatest challenge...one that we have faced and conquered time and time again!

story:
Starring Sonya Devereaux Extended With Stretch Goal!

Our Starring Sonya Devereaux IndieGoGo for the new book - Warrior Woman Death Team 5 - was in its final hours but we've been getting so many great fans asking us to extend the project with a new stretch goal that we decided to do just that!  Our awesome backers helped us to achieve the first goals - a new Sonya Devereaux Cosplay Trading Card and the creation of the Sizzle Reel - 10 pages of exclusive digital content for all backers!  So many fans wanted a Sonya Devereaux sticker that we got together with an awesome sticker manufacturer and came up with this sweet number!

If we can reach $2500 by the time this IndieGoGo ends its extended run, all of our pledge backers will receive this cool Sonya Devereaux sticker to stick pretty much wherever you want!  Within reason...you probably don't want to stick it on your local police car or your mother's bible...but anywhere else!  

There are even more HUGE things coming from Sonya soon! 

 

 

NEW STRETCH GOAL REWARD - AN ALL NEW DIGITAL STORY FOR ALL BACKERS

Every Hollywood actress knows that to get gigs you need a good demo reel! Now you can see Sonya's in an exclusive 10-page, color story! When pledges reach $1,200, in addition to the Ivy Cosplay trading card, EVERY backer will receive this digital issue featuring Sonya in scenes from Ice Cop 5, Co-Eds Fro Another Planet, Cheerleader Prison Break 2, Make-Believil 4: The Daydreamening and other never-before-seen movies!  Please help by sharing this campaign's link with your network!

 

Preview page of the exclusive IGG story.

 

SONYA DEVEREAUX WARRIOR WOMAN DEATH TEAM 5 STRETCH GOAL ANNOUNCED!

We are excited to announce the first stretch goal in the campaign for the new issue: Warrior Woman Death Team 5! When pledges reach $1,200 all backers of physical rewards will receive a new trading card featuring Ivy Cosplay as Sonya’s character from Spider-Shark vs Snake-Bear! Ivy is a talented and gorgeous cosplay model and we were honored and thrilled by her choice to cosplay Sonya! The first trading card featuring AZ Powergirl Cara Nicole was so popular we wanted to do another!

 

HOLLYWOOD'S 306TH BEST ACTRESS & SCREAM QUEEN IS BACK!

Hollywood’s 306th best actress is self-absorbed “Scream Queen” Sonya Devereaux, whose career consists entirely of ultra-low budget, straight to DVD movies – the kind you find in the bargain bin or playing at 2am on cable TV. 

Each 32-page, full color issue of the critically-acclaimed Starring Sonya Devereaux contains a stand-alone B-movie that Sonya has made, framed by an event in Sonya’s life that leads to the movie’s viewing. In a unique twist, real life actors loan their likenesses to co-star with Sonya in these hilarious, ridiculous, fictitious films! 

IGG EXCLUSIVE cover by Best Comic Artists of 2020 nominees Brendon & Brian Fraim - NOT available through retailers.

THIS ISSUE: Warrior Woman: Death Team 5

When Warrior Woman Eena (Sonya Devereaux) is forced out of retirement to search for kidnapped Princess Harlotta, she re-assembles the mighty, all-female Death Team to combat evil Lord Tombstroke. But can they stop fighting amongst themselves long enough to save the kingdom from tyranny and a moat-load of misogyny?  Actors Carlee Baker (Robot Chicken) and Troy Fromin (Saved By the Bell) co-star in this action & joke-packed sword & sorcery romp, with a special guest appearance by writer/artist Frank Dietz and Cody Cox, a backer from the prior campaign, in a hilariously real scene with Sonya! 

Written by Todd Livingston & Nick Capetanakis, illustrated by Brendon Fraim & Brian Fraim, and colored by James Couts.

Main cover by Best Comic Artists of 2020 nominees Brendon & Brian Fraim

This issue is currently featured in Previews (FEB 21) with a scheduled street date of April 2021 - but only the Exclusive perks are available through this Indiegogo campaign. If you liked Violet Vixen, you'll LOVE Warrior Woman Death Team 5!

Parody Variant cover by Best Comic Artists of 2020 nominees Brendon & Brian Fraim

 

Preview page from Starring Sonya Devereaux: Warrior Woman: Death Team 5

 

STRETCH GOALS ARE COMING!

Watch for the reveal of this project's first stretch goal coming soon!

 

WHY CROWDFUND?
Due to COVID-19, retailers have suffered a drastic loss of cash-flow. Reduced store hours (if a store has been fortunate enough to remain solvent) and limited number of customers that can be in the store at the same time has dramatically reduced the budget that stores can spend on titles. Sadly, independent publishers are the first casualties.  By crowdfunding, you will ensure the production and distribution of this totally unique book, and get karma points resulting from supporting independent creators!

Preview page from Starring Sonya Devereaux: Warrior Woman: Death Team 5

RISKS/CHALLENGES
The overwhelming bulk of the story/art pages and the editorial pages are done and are ready to print right now. We have an experienced team of creators and production people who are confident this will finish on time.

Preview page from Starring Sonya Devereaux: Warrior Woman: Death Team 5  featuring a backer from the previous campaign.

story:
Bref résumé

 Les contributeurs financent des idées qui leur plaisent et des personnes en qui ils ont confiance. Voici quelques pistes à suivre dans cette section :

  •  Présentez-vous et parlez de votre parcours.
  •  Décrivez brièvement votre projet et pourquoi il est important à vos yeux.
  • Expliquez l'importance du projet auquel les contributeurs vont participer. 

 N'oubliez pas, restez concis mais original. Demandez-vous : si quelqu'un s'arrêtait de lire à cet endroit, serait-il prêt à faire une contribution ?

 Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

 Fournissez plus de détails aux gens :

  •  Expliquez le montant du financement dont vous avez besoin et à quoi il va servir. Soyez clair et précis : les contributeurs ont besoin de vous faire confiance pour vous aider.
  •  Parlez de vos contreparties uniques. Suscitez l'intérêt de vos visiteurs !
  •  Décrivez où les fonds iront si vous n'atteignez pas complètement votre objectif.

 L'impact

N'hésitez pas à expliquer votre projet plus en détail et indiquez aux visiteurs en quoi leur contribution fera la différence :

  •  Expliquez pourquoi votre projet est précieux pour le contributeur et pour le monde.
  •  Mettez en avant vos expériences réussies sur des projets tels que celui-ci (si vous en avez).
  •  Rendez votre projet concret aux yeux des visiteurs et suscitez la confiance.

 Risques et défis

 Les gens apprécieront la transparence de vos propos. Soyez ouvert et démarquez-vous en exposant les risques et les obstacles auxquels vous allez peut-être faire face pour atteindre votre objectif.

  •  Expliquez pourquoi vous pensez être en mesure de relever ces défis.
  •  Décrivez comment vous comptez résoudre ces éventuels problèmes.

 D'autres façons d'aider

 Certaines personnes ne peuvent pas contribuer mais cela ne veut pas dire qu'elles ne peuvent pas aider :

  •  Demandez aux gens de passer le mot et de faire de la publicité autour de votre projet.
  •  Rappelez-leur d'utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo !

Et le tour est joué.

story:
*Pictures are 3D renders, not real photos*

*Final product may differ (more detail)*
There are currently 3 figures to pick to from for reward.
Newest Model Finished: 12/27/14

Newest Model (Work in Progress) 1/2/2015



Short Summary

  • My goal is to purchase a 3D printer.
  • We are Currently modeling many figures from the series to be 3D printed.
  • Having our own printer would cut down costs for everyone, especially fans and supporters.

What We Need & What You Get

  • $500 is the lowest amount you can put on Indiegogo, the amount I need is around $900 for a higher quality printer than what you can buy at Best Buy.
  • I am only asking for partial amount to help me purchase.
  • 100% of funds will towards printer, any extra funds will go towards upgrades and extra color material.
  • Figures made with new printer will be shipped to people helping with $15 or more. (The Rare Metal figures will be printed by professionals)
  • Here is the printer I am interested in:


  • Amazon Link : Click Here

The Impact

  • Your funds will help lower the overall cost and production of these figures.
  • I am personally paying all the up-front costs for indie creator friends of mine to have their own action figure.
  • This will help so many more people other than myself.

Risks & Challenges

  • There are very few risks involved, I do not see any that could really come up.
  • With Flexiable funding and goal is not met, I will still make sure your figures will be printed, even if I have to pay someone else to do it.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help get the word out about this campaign.
  • Indiegogo has amazing share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Hey there, I'm Danny! I'm the writer and creator of 'Masks' - a thrilling sci-fi western adventure (and more!). The project started out as a few short novellas I wrote one summer, which then developed into a longer story, and recently - into a comic book script.  

The story of Masks takes place in 2060s, in a world divided and ruined in 1965 after a failed scientific experiment. When all people were divided into Masks and Maskless, civil wars and riots consumed the world,  effectively destroying it by the turn of the millennium. A century later we find a masked Bookkeeper in his pursuit of a certain book...

The success of this campaign will allow us to complete the first issue of the comic book and start working on the next one. All funds will go towards developing the series and expanding the rung from the currently planned 12 issue to possibly 24.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding we need to produce the first issue is $9330. Most of that money will go towards Matias Zeballos, who is a professional comic book artist and spends a lot of time working on the project. The editor responsible for handling texts and layout will take a cut as well. That'll leave me with some pocket change, but I don't mind - all i want is to make the best possible comic book to share with you guys!

If the campaign is largely successful and the budget surpasses $17330, the additional $8000 will help us launch the comic book in paperback (the perks will be updated accordingly).


If we don't reach our goal - still, all funds will go towards this first and, hopefully, second issue.

But when we do reach our goal - 'Masks' will kick ass! We'll distribute it digitally and submit it to the biggest players in business - Dark Horse, Image and all those guys!


We have tons of great perks for you, too! For your support you will get all kinds of cool stuff, including early access to the first two issues; t-shirts; a signed copy of the short novella collection that the comic book is based on; and, my favourite - a chance to be written into one of the future issues!!


The Impact

'Masks' is dark, gritty and realistic. It does have supernatural elements, but no straight out 'superhero' stuff. My main inspiration when creating the world of Masks was Stephen King's 'The Dark Tower' series. 

While the post-apocalyptic theme is rather beaten these days, the concept behind 'Masks' is fairly original - a world divided into Masks and Maskless, 'good' and 'bad', so to speak. A society that destroyed itself for no other reason than being different.


The plot is also unpredictable. Nothing is spoon-fed to the reader, and the story takes its time to answer all your questions. To me, such stories are the most intriguing and thought-provoking. Something you will remember and hopefully want to be a part of for a long time.


Risks & Challenges

Putting your work out for the world to see is always risky, but I trust in our team and in our project. Our dedication and the effort we put into the work guarantees that the story we're telling is excellent. The art is beautiful and the plot is exciting, and that sort of thing speaks to people.


I believe our readers will appreciate the final product and find it well worth their time. 

Our goal here is to make an amazing, exciting and all-around cool comic book that you will fall in love with!

Other Ways You Can Help

Like what you're seeing but can't contribute? No trouble! Your support is the most important thing to us, so simply spreading the word around will be enough! Tell your friends on Facebook and Twitter to check out our campaign and help us out!

For your support you will get all kinds of cool stuff, including early access to the first two issues; t-shirts; a signed copy of the short novella collection that the comic book is based on; and, my favourite - a chance to be written into one of the future issues!!


   The Impact 'Masks' is dark, gritty and realistic. It does have supernatural elements, but no straight out 'superhero' stuff. My main inspiration when creating the world of Masks was Stephen King's 'The Dark Tower' series. 
While the post-apocalyptic theme is rather beaten these days, the concept behind 'Masks' is fairly original - a world divided into Masks and Maskless, 'good' and 'bad', so to speak. A society that destroyed itself for no other reason than being different.



The plot is also unpredictable. Nothing is spoon-fed to the reader, and the story takes its time to answer all your questions. To me, such stories are the most intriguing and thought-provoking. Something you will remember and hopefully want to be a part of for a long time.
    
Risks & ChallengesPutting your work out for the world to see is always risky, but I trust in our team and in our project. Our dedication and the effort we put into the work guarantees that the story we're telling is excellent. The art is beautiful and the plot is exciting, and that sort of thing speaks to people.

I believe our readers will appreciate the final product and find it well worth their time. 
Our goal here is to make an amazing, exciting and all-around cool comic book that you will fall in love with!
    Other Ways You Can Help Like what you're seeing but can't contribute? No trouble! Your support is the most important thing to us, so simply spreading the word around will be enough! Tell your friends on Facebook and Twitter to check out our campaign and help us out!

story:
What is Patron Comics?

Hi! I am Anthony James Perez, Publisher of ReginaCaeli Publishing and creator of Patron Comics - a comic book series pegged as 100% entertainment with 100% catechism. 

I created Patron Comics in order to seamlessly incorporate entertainment with catechism in way that is not too hard sell. Our youth, who are the primary target of the comics, imbibe their catechism better if they see it applied in real-life situations, and real-life situations and characters are what we offer in Patron Comics. 

In this confused world where people deny God and the cross, pursue paths of self-destruction like divorce, same-sex marriage, and abortion, we need to reinforce and in many ways restructure the way we teach the catechism to our Catholic brethren, and Patron Comics does precisely that: we tackle these issues, and more, head on, using the light that comes from Sacred Scripture, Magisterium, and Sacred Tradition and in a way that is very entertaining for our readers. 

The entry point of our stories, and its main theme is spiritual battle specifically through exorcism. The creative team and covered all the bases to make sure we aren't just making something for cheap thrills; we're here to show that the devil exists, but our aim is not to scare our readers, but to show God's victory over evil. It is also our experience that by talking about the supernatural, we can easily have a captive readership; from there we can deliver the correct catechism regarding topics like ghosts, haunted houses, and occult activities, and, in the case of Book 1, we used this theme in order to emphasize the utter importance of Holy Communion and Confession. 

Patron Comics was created with the help of the Archdiocese of Manila Office of Exorcism and is endorsed by several bishops here in the Philippines. 

Breaking the Cost down

I am in need of 25,000 USD or roughly 1.14 million Philippine Pesos in order to create, publish, and print books 1 and 2 of Patron Comics this year, and there are two batches of printing. The first batch, for around 1000 copies, has started this June, and will be printed monthly until March. The second batch, for 8,000 copies, will start late September or early October.The cost is exclusive of the salaries of the administrative staff (I only employ two people at the moment to minimize costs). 
This is how the cost is broken down: (cost is in PHP)
1st Batch
artists' cost - 33, 000 PHP per issue
printing cost - 27,000 PHP per issue of 1000 copies = 60,000 per issue

60,000 PHP per issue x 7 issues remaining = 420,000 PHP or around 9000 ++ USD. 

2nd Batch

artists cost - 0 PHP

printing cost - estimated at 240,000 PHP per issue of 8,000 copies 

240,000 per issue X 3 issues (10 issues consolidated into three to minimize costs) = 720,000 PHP

420,000 + 720,000 = 1,140,000 PHP Total Amount


I appreciate every donation to this cause, big or small. I will take whatever funds that people donate in order to defray the high cost of printing. We need to win the culture back, and I believe that this is a step towards that direction. We have to save souls and we have to be creative in doing so. 

Those who donate 500 USD or more will receive a free signed copy and their names will be included in the Thank You page. Please email me at patroncomics@gmail.com if you have made payment so I can acknowledge receipt. 

The Big Picture

For so long, we have seen the decline of morality especially in our media. From movies to television, from our songs to our books, there is a great deluge of immorality and they are passed off as entertainment. Patron Comics is an endeavor meant to resist this downward spiral and to revive interest in the Catholic faith via entertainment. 

I have spent much of my personal funds in order to jump start Patron Comics, and now I am in need of more funds to see through the completion of Books 1 and 2 this year. I want to be partners with you - especially if you are working in the youth, catechism, or pro-life ministry. Help me generate the necessary funds, or help me find schools or groups and organizations that will buy the comics (especially those who will buy in bulk). Help me get the word out that such an endeavor exists. 

The dream is not only to create the comics, but to expand to film if and when the time comes that the comics become known enough. I realize we reach more people through film and therefore we can impart the Gospel to more people. Let's push back this culture of death that has loomed over the media for so long. Patron Comics is our fighting shot to win back souls for God through media.

story:
This campaign is to raise money to print the all-ages illustrated story of Ink the Void. 

Ink the Void is about a young boy who is given the task of filling a large endless void with his oversized brush and pail of ink. At first daunted by the task, he soon runs off creating wondrous environments and creatures. However, in his carelessness he unwittingly creates a monstrous ink monster who begins consuming his creations.

This story started out as an Inktober comic. For those that don’t know, Inktober is a portmanteau and personal challenge where you create an ink drawing every day for the entire month of October. It was created by Jake Parker in 2009 and thousands around the world participate each year. 

Seeing as I typically draw with ink, I wanted to create something special, something that really challenged my abilities but was simple enough to actually draw everyday. All the stories I initially came up with were too involved, with too many characters, settings, or actions. And as I sat with a brush in hand, staring at a blank paper, daunted by the limitless possibilities before me, it hit me. Fill the void.

As the month progressed I knew I had created something special and I wanted it to go beyond just a few internet-posted drawings in October and into a book.

I nerd out about books, not just the content, but the printing as well. The texture of the cover, the weight of the pages, the sheen of the ink, the careful design from cover to cover, the visceral experience of a well printed book excites me as any well-created artwork should. I felt that Ink the Void deserved that experience.

Book Details

  • Limited Edition of 500
  • Signed and numbered
  • 6.5"x6.5"
  • Hardcover w/ Spot UV
  • 64 pages with custom endsheets
  • 32 illustrations accompanied by hand lettered text
  • Printed on 85lb. paper using two passes of Pantone Black
  • A four page "making of" section in the back of the book

What You Get

As mentioned above, every book is signed and numbered. This will be on the title page where all drawings in the book will also go. I will happily dedicate the book to anyone that requests such.

Besides the book, every contribution of $25 will come with an exclusive 4"x6" signed print.

I've made most of the original illustrations available as perks for contributions of $100 or $150. Most of the illustrations were created on 9"x12" art board (these are for $100). There were three created on 11"x17" for double page spreads in the book (available for $150). The fourth I've made available in that tier is comprised of two 9"x12" illustrations and, when sitting side by side, produce the image below (also for $150).

Please, note, some of the illustrations to fit the book better were altered digitally from their original form. If interested to know which pages are those, or which pages were created on the 11"x17" I am happy to let you know. I am also willing to send images of an unaltered scan if you are interested in any of the original illustrations.

What Does Limited Edition Mean?

If I do print the book again, and it that is largely based on the success of this edition, it will be softcover with a different design on the cover and printed using regular black ink (instead of the Pantone Black 2x, which is considerably more expensive). I will also include a thank you page with all the contributors from this campaign.

Requests and Other Additional Info

Edition numbers will be given in the order that the contributions are received. All requests for edition numbers and original pages will be honored on a first come first serve basis. For original page requests, to ensure you're getting a page you desire, please, choose three.

All items will ship together with the book when it arrives in April or May.

Images of the books are mock-ups, actual product may vary slightly, for the better.


Risks & Challenges

I have already completed the book and sent it to the printer so there are very little risks of this book not coming into existence. However, to pay the printer I did have to take out a loan from a very shady looking fella named Dimitri. Now, if I raise enough money with this campaign I can pay him back, no problem. If I don't well... Dimitri says, "you no pay me back, I take hand, hand you draw wit." *gulp* So, there's that risk...

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. The most helpful and easiest way is to spread the word. Social media has the widest reach but word of mouth tends to be the most sincere. Preaching from a street corner might be the least effective but I will applaud the effort of any individual who would like to take it to that extreme. 

Video Credits

Animation by Colin Lawler

Music and Audio by Brandon Jiaconia

Narrated by Joe Vitale

story:
<Share a story>

What is a GifT Book??

This is an app that is quite different and fun, 

where artists can connect with many readers.


<What can be discovered?> 

The Gift can further deepen artist's info.

 People can discover many different kinds of ideas from the artists. 

They will be able to discover their favorite artists.


<About us>

We are artists who enjoy creating stories.

To share our stories, we even created a website. 

http://www.agora-gacha.net

https://www.facebook.com/AGORA-gacha-185003614906878/


<Our problem>  

This is not a job, rather a place where we enjoy meeting artist friends. 

We hope to create an app to further promote our works, but 

for amateur artists like us, we do not have the budget to engage in such a project.

Thus we would like to create a simple template and share it amongst the artists. 


<Amount needed>   

We need at least 2,500 dollars.

2,100 dollars to develop this app and create a gift page.

and 400 dollars to make the gift.


<Benefits for the donors>   

These days there are many different ways to make purchases.

Therefore buyers can choose a method that best suits them.

Knowing your favorite works or artists can enrich one's life even more.

And in the future,

if we could sell a lot of artist apps, we  will give your investment back to you 

with option money.


<First gift book work>   

"THE CREATURES"

By Takuya Mishina which is a work based on soul.

This is an app that is quite different and fun, where artists can connect with many 

readers!

https://www.facebook.com/takuya347/

http://www.geocities.jp/takuyamac347/


<Target Time of our First App>  

Untill Summer season (2016) 

We will tell you our process regularly.

<About Perks> 

From Mishina's "CREATURES" 

Appreciation message/Digital book/Endroll with individual names/Printbook

/USB /Ice cream/Original Mishina's paint/etc.

(Attention: These perks do not indclude the App. We report our progress status.)


<Introduction of Takuya Mishina>

My name is Takuya Mishina from Japan.

My passion is to create illustration, and comics.

I want to become a professional artist so that the creators and art enthusiasts 

can enjoy my work.

My art is not enough now. In the future,

I want to master and reach the zenith of my art and expression.

Tr.Eugene, Everett


<Risks and Challenges>   

We will do our best to meet the challenge.

Even if we cannot meet the minimum budget,we will do what we can.

If we succeed in this challenge, we will make and develop more applications 

for artists.


<Voice from Artists>     

 

Everett : http://everettglenn.net/

Please join us in creating this new platform for artists.

This new app is the foundation of something bigger 

and I'm happy to be a part of it.  

YABUPAN:https://www.facebook.com/yabupans/

Joy!   

My theme is "MEDETAI" which is based on the Japanese happy ceremony.

My motifs are familiar stuff that make people smile.

TORAJIRO: http://torajiro.boy.jp

I'm TORAJIRO. 

I draw a lot of men, pieces of their lives and a moments of their behavior. 

Also I love NY and will have an exhibition someday.

Mayaya: http://www.agora-gacha.net/artists?artist=6

Hi, everybody! 

I wish more readers will find my art work!


<For Ones Who Cannot Contribute>   

Indiegogo is a way for us to promote our activities as well.

We would appreciate it if you could please share this page to others.

And we are waiting for many artist friends join in this project.

Artists/ Adam,Bryant, Akira Saito,Everett, Emanuel and Linda

Fedelico, Hiroaki Tobita,  IKURU, Luis Morocho, Madara, Martin, Mayaya, 

Mishina, Mihoko, Miyuki, Natsuki Eda,  Piero, Torajiro, Urbantrixsta, 

YABUPAN... 

Guest Editor/Barbara Daly


Thanks for reading! See you soon!!

info@agora-gacha.net

story:
I WROTE MY FIRST BOOK!

I am THRILLED to finally share sweet BABY BEE with the world! Inspired by my sweet daughter Xena Vida. Being raised in a Caribbean home (BELIZE STAND UP), we learned manners EARLY. Our Mothers taught us to communicate our wants, needs and feelings directly— yet RESPECTFULLY. They say chivalry isn't dead— NEITHER  ARE MANNERS! Becoming a NEW MOM at the time COVID-19 began, Xena and I were robbed of social activities such as; play dates with other moms and infants, mommy and me classes, even going to the mall! My daughter, unfortunately, isn't able to get as much social contact and experiences as I was able to at her age. Social contact that taught me how to make friends, lose them, share and disagree with other kids but we learn to work it out in order for us to play together. A lot of our children were and will continue to be robbed of these experiences, therefore I sought after a solution.  FEAR NO MORE!

I PRESENT TO YOU:

BABY BEE'S GOOD MANNERS

An educational comic strip series. Social communication teachings for children. 

Raising a generation of EMPATHETIC, POLITE & RESPECTFUL HUMANS!
