story:
Short Summary

Welcome Back to the UVUniverse!

One year later and 261.4k fans later, we are back and ready to go with our second issue!

This fundraiser is going to help us produce copies of the second issue, move our products into one warehouse and pay our artists for their efforts and time!

The second issue script has been completed, and the team has been working on it for quite some time now!

The feedback on the first issue was AMAZING, and we implemented as many of the requests as we could into this next issue, and are very proud to say that this might be our best one yet!

ULTRAVIOLET: Fun in The Sun 

Takes place right after the first issue and the action picks up very quickly, and you get to meet our newest character in the series, Kaja Bylilly! 

In this issue, you get to learn the backstory of why UV came to Earth, and what lurks around the corner for Jai!

The Impact

Once we reach this goal, 

We'll be able to start up Twitch streaming again, purchase the second issue in bulk, move all of our products into one big warehouse, and purchase more copies for the first issue to be made as well! The rest of the budget goes to shipping, smaller freebies, and legal fees that may occur for UV!

 

Risks & Challenges

The Biggest risk is shipping delays, just like last time! 

With COVID and its variants spreading around and countries considering lockdowns again, we will do our best to keep everyone updated on the shipping status, and shouldn't have an issue with the ETA's this time being its out second go around!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please consider supporting us by reading the comic on Webtoon!
  • Share this link around with people you think might be interested!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Welcome Back to the UVUniverse!
One year later and 261.4k fans later, we are back and ready to go with our second issue!
This fundraiser is going to help us produce copies of the second issue, move our products into one warehouse and pay our artists for their efforts and time!
The second issue script has been completed, and the team has been working on it for quite some time now!
The feedback on the first issue was AMAZING, and we implemented as many of the requests as we could into this next issue, and are very proud to say that this might be our best one yet!
ULTRAVIOLET: Fun in The Sun 
Takes place right after the first issue and the action picks up very quickly, and you get to meet our newest character in the series, Kaja Bylilly! 
In this issue, you get to learn the backstory of why UV came to Earth, and what lurks around the corner for Jai!

The Impact
Once we reach this goal, 
We'll be able to start up Twitch streaming again, purchase the second issue in bulk, move all of our products into one big warehouse, and purchase more copies for the first issue to be made as well! The rest of the budget goes to shipping, smaller freebies, and legal fees that may occur for UV!
 

Risks & Challenges
The Biggest risk is shipping delays, just like last time! 
With COVID and its variants spreading around and countries considering lockdowns again, we will do our best to keep everyone updated on the shipping status, and shouldn't have an issue with the ETA's this time being its out second go around!

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please consider supporting us by reading the comic on Webtoon!
Share this link around with people you think might be interested!

story:
Kale&Bailey is an online romantic-comedy comic about two guys that fall for each other through a very unconventional midnight encounter. With my time being split all over the place these days, I just don't have time to focus on the story anymore. With the help of this fundraiser, I'll be able to keep the fire burning and illustrate Chapter 4 of Kale&Bailey to share with the world. 

By reaching our fundraiser goal, the continuation of this fun romantic story will be 100% possible!

 

You can read the story HERE

 

*If we are not able to reach our goal, then I will update 1 page per $200 raised*

story:
Hi There!

My name is Mason Parker. I am a hip-hop MC, spoken word artist, actor, and content producer. In 2012 I conceptualized "The Paperback Hero Saga" as a response to the monotony of the mainstream. Often times in pop culture, the best way to educate is to entertain. With the music industry quickly becoming visual, I viewed it as an excellent opportunity to introduce my comic book to help illustrate the themes discussed in my music.

Now that the project is complete I need you to help me get it to the masses. This project has been a 6 year journey, taking thousands of personally funded dollars, and even moving clear across the country in order to complete. I have put my EVERYTHING into this project and so at this point I proudly present the product of my passion hoping to garner the sincere support of others wanting to perpetuate the love frequency in the art we create and consume. I truly believe this project will change lives for the better. Please help me touch as many people as possible.

What We Need & What You Get

So in order to pull this off, we will need a total of $16,500- $20,000 which we have broken down into 3 phases raising a minimum of $5,500 each. The first phase will include producing more visuals to extend the reach of the project, creating merchandise and as much social media and grassroots promotion as we can muster. The second phase will be dedicated to creating more press opportunities, completing the rest of the visuals, and of course, physical copies of the comic book and album. The third phase will be focused on taking PBH Saga on the road!  To show how appreciative we are for your support, we offer several perk packages when you donate over certain amounts. Perks include t-shirts, posters, as well as autographed copies of the CD and comic. Trust me, the more we CAN do, the more we WILL do, so rest assured we plan for the perks to only get bigger and better with each phase!

OK, so you may be asking, "What if you don't get all the money?" Well, the money will still go towards our promotional efforts at whatever scale we can afford. Your contribution is valuable to me, and in turn I believe this project will enrich the lives of the people who support it. I believe it's a fresh take on age old principles and truths that impact all of our lives for the better once we understand how they work.

I am so passionate about spreading this to the masses because I believe that not only is this a positive message needed in today's entertainment, but because I believe it will positively impact YOU. So even if you can't contribute financially. Listen to the music. Read the digital comic. Enjoy it, and tell every friend and family member you talk to! Either way, your efforts are going towards a worthy cause and are EXTREMELY appreciated. Please use the Indiegogo and social media share tools to spread the word about what we're doing!

SHINE,

MP

story:
(Official Cover of the book - Artwork by LAZ MARQUEZ)

 

H.J. Maestre's NIGHT OF THE WEIRDOS, the first book in THE WEIRDOS SAGA, is a 250-page, Multi-Colored trade paperback, chronicling the horrific story of six orphans surviving the weekend of Halloween in 1999... 

Journey through 8 terrifying volumes of suspense, terror, comedy, and action.

 

EACH VOLUME HAS A COVER TO JUMPSTART THE CHAPTER OF THE BOOK, EACH DONE BY VARIOUS ARTISTS FROM AROUND THE WORLD:

 

READ BELOW TO LEARN MORE -

 

THE STORY

In order to know their story...let's answer the obvious question:

Who are the Weirdos?

Six warriors..a Holy Paladin, a Werewolf, a Ghoul, a Goblin, and Two High Elves...

I know...what?!?! If that sounds cheesy or confusing to you, we don't blame you..we know. You can imagine why they ended up with the nickname, "The Weirdos"

But..​believe it or not, they are the only ones standing between you and every evil entity, out to rip your skin from your body! 

Now...they face their greatest adversary in the form of a seductive woman...Lilith, mother of demons, the goddess of death, etc....she's really bad, take our word for it. Her ultimate goal is to Kill every man, woman, and child on the planet!

Anyways! SPOILER ALERT!!! The encounter between Lilith and The Weirdos is so brutal and explosive, that it spills from one dimension to another, dragging the epic battle from 1985 to 1999.

In this new timeline, Lilith begins her revenge by hunting a group of orphaned children. These kids are about to spend their Halloween weekend, fending for their lives, while learning their secret connection to The Weirdos. 

This is a tale of their Origins...

 

 

 

THE NOVEL FEATURES 3 DISTINCTIVE ART STYLES FROM 3 DIFFERENT ARTISTS, TO TELL ONE COHESIVE STORY!!!

 

Volume 1 Artwork 

 

Volumes 2-3 Artwork (In black & white for story purposes)

 

Volumes 4-8 Sneak Peak 

(We want to show more pages, but even out of context, we would be going into heavy spoilers)

 

 

OUR NOVEL FEATURES A NUMBER OF ACTORS & ACTRESSES, DRAWN AS CHARACTERS, WITH THEIR LIKENESS. SINCE WE ARE TREATING THE NOVEL AS A FILM IN COMIC BOOK FORM, WE FELT IT WAS NECESSARY CASTING GREAT TALENT SUCH AS:

AND OUR CAST EXTENDS TO SEVERAL MORE!!!

 

 

PERKS & BREAKDOWN

 

FOR STARTERS:

*Every Perk includes the physical book and the digital copy.* 

 

The Following Perks are based on past battles, where The Weirdos faced off against Michael Myers, Freddy Krueger, Jason Voorhees & Chucky: 

HALLOWEEN WEIRDO

DREAM WEIRDO

MASKED WEIRDO

LITTLE WEIRDO

 

HOLLYWOOD WEIRDO:

INCLUDES THE PHYSICAL/DIGITAL COPY OF THE BOOK, AND AN 18 X 24 POSTER OF THE BOOK'S COVER (Which is the image, found at the very top of this chain)

 

WEIRDO COLLECTOR

INCLUDES ALL 4 T-SHIRTS, THE PHYSICAL/COPY OF THE BOOK, AND THE 18 X 24 POSTER

 

ULTIMATE COLLECTOR

INCLUDES EVERYTHING PLUS...10 OF THE MOST WANTED FAIRY CRIMINALS IN EXISTENCE, ALL CAUGHT BY THE WEIRDOS. THE 10 PRINTS COME IN 8 X 11

story:
Hopeless is a graphic novel series project started by Oytun Yılmaz and Onur Böle. The storyline and artwork were designed by Oytun Yılmaz, scripted by Onur Böle. The main purpose in submitting our project to indiegogo is to fund the production and distribution costs. If we can exceed our goal or come to be recognized by a publisher in the process, we are going to create the next episodes of the series.

STORY  

The protagonist Mr. Hopeless is an unsuccessful, weak and slothful everyman, with a body too naïve a pain in the neck of his soul, who eventually leaves him. Having become all the more spiritless now that he lacks a soul, Hopeless notices that he has also grown invisible and that he does not, in the regular sense of the word, even “exist” in the current world which now seems to him a negatively-aesthetic cluster of images. 

Accompanying his invisibility is a dog that only he can see, a dog that can randomly multiply and decrease in number. It turns out that the dog(s) will guide him throughout the search for his soul, as a letter that he receives informs us. The letter is from a man who introduces himself as Mr. Spider. The story begins right in the beginning of the protagonist's surreal journey across the Mother Land, a world of fantasy with metaphysical undertones, inhabited mostly by animals: it is the probable shelter of lost souls, but one that torments, psychologically dissects, forces Hopeless to face his background more than it offers a shelter. It is also a journey in which the main character slowly loses his status as a protagonist, not only because it is a place that dismantles established identities, but also it soon becomes apparent that other (animal) characters have deeper stories than the protagonist's. 

WHAT IS IT LIKE?     

It is a subtly political, partly existential, and highly absurt story inspired by Dante, Goethe, Kafka, and Burroughs. Imagine walking through darkly humorous prison-wall paintings grabbed tight by a divine lobster and listening to Bob Dylan with a perversely burlesque turn: A journey that expose the ascetic nature of Dorian Gray's homoerotic Portrait. We subvert anthropocentric and theological assumptions, analyze necropolitics, criticize the danger of apathy in the simplest and a seemingly puerile context: Have you ever thought of the farcical opportunities issuing from the different ways of not existing? If not (or if so), we invite you to give it a chance and join our journey.

We attempt to present an enjoyable read. The story includes elements of surreal, black and blue comedy, but first and foremost irrealistic humor with less of an expressionist taste, in a way that challenges and satirizes many recurring questions inherent in modernity, literary conventions and motifs, such as the moralistic undertones in the Faustian canon. Doing all of these in a comic format, in a simplified world that reads like a twisted fable is itself a great challenge to ourselves and the genre in which we apply our methods. You are invited to interpret, revisualize and even complete the universe we offer, while enjoying the read and the artwork (so we hope). 

 

CLICK AND READ ON ISSUE

https://issuu.com/oytuny/docs/hopeless-sample

 

Our target is thus adults who appreciate ambiguity, allegorical/alternative worlds out of their comfort zones, lack of fixated subjectivities. If you strive for liberation but are too conscious of the –global and local – conditions which have generated and continues to structure us beyond our control, then this story might be for you. In a way, we seek people who would not mind letting the gravity of their train of thought and the gusty levity of their chuckle cohabit. As for our format, the non-linerar story arc is optimal for a mini series, since we are more interested in process-driven narratives than Aristotelian structures; however, once it is completed it can be published as a full original graphic novel since it constitutes a whole. It is a colored work, as it is essential for the carnivalesque, grotesque, macabre style of artwork and story.

 

Some Characters of the First Issue

 Hopeless

The would-be protagonist of the story. Invisible, redundant among us. A flour sack dragged, tortured, analyzed, shaken out of his oblivion across the Mother's Land, but has free will as much as we do.

Mr. Four Legs

Hopeless' companion and guide. A mock Virgil and pseudo-Woland. Initially single and mute, he displays a skill to multiply and become a pack.

The Pig

The welcomer of the Mother's Land. A s-s-stutterer with a perpetual grin that grinds your eyes, before the high-pitched swelling of its fragmented words grinds the entire earwax of your own language. The Pig holds a meat grinder, an animated mouth-device that chews the newcomers all the way through the guts of the Land. Yes, entering the Mother's Land is hella painful and you must be literally ground to bits. Hopeless is about to get each of his cells castrated.

Spider, aka Daddy Longlegs

A man of letters. A Platonic dreamer in a dream world. A masochist with an idealized ego that denies reality. An astute producer of guilt in others. Obsessively in love with Blatta. If he wishes you a happy Christmas, you should see the Mormon in him, sneaking to push his agenda. Beware of him though, for he is unbelievably persuasive! Hopeless doesn't know better when Spider invites him to Mother's Land.

Scorpion

The mirror-image and the object of Mr. Spider's homicidal/homoerotic pursuit. An alleged child killer. A rational and careless superego that must perish so that Spider could be relieved of agony. Blatta's current lover. Though the tension in the first issue is between his alleged infanticidal nature and his congruent position in the love triangle, a deeper story will be unfolded later in parallel with Hopeless' psyche.

Louse

One of the bouncers in the club Blatta works at. Just there for fun. Oh, and he accidentally exposes one of Mr. Four Legs' powers: The power of not only increasing in number, but also growing in size on a gigantic scale.

Blatta

The subject of Spider's unrequited love, his ex-lover. A burlesque performer. An elusive yet authoritative figure. Liberated from all kinds of trauma, she has grown immune to Spider's persuasive and guilt-generating skills. Contains men and fixes them painfully, which might be why Hopeless feels uncomfortable with her.

WHY INDIEGOGO?

Production and shipping costs are a major concern for us, especially because our work appeals to international readers and we do not have any financial support or a sponsor. Indiegogo is a great place to accomplish the projects of the like. If we reach our goal, we offer to share with you a limited edition of the first two episodes of our project which is now complete. Since mass production is not yet an option for us, a limited addition will allow for a high quality work with the cost as minimal as possible. We also kept these factors in mind while carefully selecting rewards.

WHAT YOU WILL RECEIVE

Paperback edition, poster and fan art: Our initial and biggest goal is to deliver the first two episodes of our story in high quality paperback form. We have had to limit the first edition to only 250 copies in order to fulfill this goal with a realistic budget: We ensure you will have added a painstakingly created product to your collection. Not only will you receive the 88 page colored book and 20" x 27" sized coated glossy paper posters including the characters of the first issue, but also fan artworks added to the book (5 additional pages and possibly more). The one you see above was made by Şerif Karasu and you will get the artwork of two more artists in print. We are in the process of creating our characters for the second issue, and you can also get posters including them if you would like to take a peek into what is to come.

story:
Short Summary

My Love, Passion, Ministry

  • My name is Archie A. Cunningham. I'm a Christian artist.
  • My best friend Jeremy Hays and I created Armored Forces 20 years ago, but it took 911 to push me to really act on this story.  The labor of love and sacrifice to bring theses stories heroism and faith.
  • I thank you for taking the time, sharing my dream. supporting the Adventure.

What We Need & What You Get

The Cool Swag:

  • Armored Forces needs 15,000 for it to be printed, marketed, distributed and taking the comic to Comic Book Conventions across the land.
  • Each perk has unique packages! from  $10 poster to the Power box that has multiple goodies!

Change the heart of the reader:

Short Summary
My Love, Passion, Ministry

My name is Archie A. Cunningham. I'm a Christian artist.
My best friend Jeremy Hays and I created Armored Forces 20 years ago, but it took 911 to push me to really act on this story.  The labor of love and sacrifice to bring theses stories heroism and faith.
I thank you for taking the time, sharing my dream. supporting the Adventure.

story:
Welcome!

Thank you for visiting the Model 316 Productions Indiegogo campaign. We are taking a unique approach to help independent creators take their 2D concepts and turn them into real 3D objects such as action figures, figurines and other collectables.

We will do this by adding high resolution 3D printing to our current capabilities which include CNC routing, milling and high quality casting in a variety of materials.

15 talented artists and content creators have come together to create a series of Collectors Coins to be given as incentives to those that support the campaign.

The Collector Coins are just the beginning.

Once the obligations of the campaign have been fulfilled, Indie creators will be invited to participate in a design and development process at no cost to themselves to bring their creations to life. The main focus after the campaign will be figures and models.

Creators are currently fine tuning their designs. They are getting even cooler!

Funding

Proceeds from the campaign will go towards equipment and materials that will add to our extensive list of services and skills.

Our primary goal is to give artists and creators an economical way to turn their ideas into collectibles and items to share with their fans. There are so many great characters and artwork being created and the challenges of turning them into real objects can be daunting.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, you can help by sharing the campaign with others. We also have a Patreon option for those wishing to contribute in smaller payments towards their desired reward tier. It can be found at http://patreon.com/model316

Due to licensing considerations with creators, the Patreon option is for a limited time. Contributions must start during the campaign.

If you have questions, please ask!

 

Stay tuned for awesome Stretch Goals.
